Reviews.Title: “Fresh gem in heart of Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Neneb
Reviews.Content: Arriving days after Hurricane Isaac had blown through, I didn't know what to expect of New Orleans and the hotel. Certainly, NO was in clean up mode and recovering but there is a tangible spirit to the place that is energetic. The Hotel Le Marais is situated right in the heart of the Quarter but off Bourbon Street....so nice and quiet. It is a fabulous little find. Walking into the cool foyer and courtyard after the humid streets is wonderful. The rooms are well fitted out, the beds comfy, and the decor funky and fresh. The staff were all friendly and welcoming despite the difficult circumstances for many of them at home. Everything is within walking distance and I found NO easy to wander around. There is valet parking at the hotel, but there are also various self-park carparks within walking distance if you want to reduce your costs.

Reviews.Title: “LSU Game!”
Reviews.Author: DawgFan79
Reviews.Content: We had 8 in our party travel to NOLA for the LSU game in Baton Rouge. Unfortunately the game didn't turn out the way we wanted but the hotel was fantastic! Very modern and clean with lots of the extra perks that everyone loved (free WIFI, 2 bottles of water daily, free continental breakfast with hot food and 2 welcome cocktails). All great touches that really put this hotel in high favor with our group. Highly recommend to anyone traveling to New Orleans. Very close to Bourbon (half a block) yet far enough away so that you can't hear it. Great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Susan J
Reviews.Content: A group of us were at the Hotel during Hurricane Issac in August 2012 and the staff was wonderful, they took good care of us and helped calm our nerves. Everyone was very helpful and friendly and extremely accomodating. The hotel is quite chariming and the rooms are very nice, and the continental breakfast is one of the best ever.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: Bree88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend.My friend and I ended up with bites all over!!I love this place, but that's the only problem,I hate bed bugs!Service was good,location was great, breakfast was nice.Rooms were clean,but obviously not really.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: suzanneb408
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Marais was a gem from the reservation to the memories. I made our reservation on-line and received not just a confirmation email from the hotel, but a personalized one from Daniel, confirming the reservation, offering options for transportation and other amentities. The rooms are spacious, the bar is very nice, the "continental" breakfast is far more expansive that the typical continental breakfast, the pool is small but the pool furniture and seating are upscale. We ended up there for Hurricane Isaac and had to extend our stay until the airport reopened. The hotel management stayed round the clock,while the employees were able to stay home with their families. They made us feel very safe during the hurricane and accomodated all of the guests at every turn. The location is in the French Quarter, 1/2 block from Bourbon St. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Memorial Day Weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Fewscrewsloose
Reviews.Content: Checked in Memorial day weekend and it was surprisingly quiet. Decided to honeymoon in New Orleans and where better than the French Quarters. It's a corner away from Bourbon St. but still far enough from too much hustle and bustle. Look hands down, if you want a nice romantic getaway with your sweet cheeks this place is def. the place to be. Go downstairs for a martini or walk outside and hit the streets. You won't be disappointed! Best believe I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JoelleeWellee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Marais was the second stop on our honeymoon. We immediately felt at home by the friendly front desk staff who are extremely attentive and helpful and the fact that when you walk in the front doors, the chaos of Bourbon St. is a distant memory. Love the fact that it was a quiet escape from the loud streets. Loved the decor. Loved the drinks at the hotel bar. Bed was comfortable. Bath amenities were great. My one gripe - we were woken up, A LOT by slamming doors. While you couldn't hear anything from the outside of the hotel, from around 6-9AM the hallway doors were slammed over and over. Not sure if this was guests coming out in the morning, or the fact that our room was positioned next to a supply closet so when the maid staff would get supplies, the door would slam shut and wake us up. Besides this, we loved this place and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: svladysadie
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice, and the service was excellent. We felt like this was a real bargain, especially regarding the location in the center of "the quarter", yet it was easy to find. The room was clean and well arranged. Valet parking is really required.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: kurokitty
Reviews.Content: We came here for a wedding this weekend. This place is great! Great location, really friendly staff and as a boutique hotel, it goes out of its way to make sure you enjoy your stay -- they gave out two free drink coupons for the bar, the bottles of water in the room were complimentary and the breakfast bar was excellent in the morning. The only drawbacks came early Sunday morning when the bar was still playing really loud music -- I wouldn't accept a room on the ground floor in the future. Also because of limited space in the area, there's no dedicated place to load/unload if you're coming by car and the street can be pretty busy, so I'll take this into consideration next time around. Otherwise, we really enjoyed our visit!

Reviews.Title: “A great find in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nick B
Reviews.Content: Located just off of Bourbon Street, it's great to be able to walk to everything! Within a few minutes walk you can be in the French market, Cafe Du Monde, St Louis Cathederal and much more! The salt water pool is great to dip in when its hot, my eleven year old daughter loved it! The rooms were clean, comfortable and well maintained. My only comment being that the bathroom was a bit on the small side! Breakfast was enjoyed by the whole family! Overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and great amenities”
Reviews.Author: KChanimal
Reviews.Content: I travel often for work and typically stay at your big chain hotels (Hilton, Marriott, Westin, etc...) that are nice, but usually pricey and charge you extra for everything (internet, breakfast, etc...). So, staying at Hotel Le Marais for a recent long-weekend vacation was a really nice treat, given the price, location, and amenities that were included in the cost of the stay. Hotel Le Marais is conveniently located in the heart of the French Quarter, a block off Bourbon Street and just a few blocks from Canal. It's a great little boutique hotel with lots of welcome amenities, including: --free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel --"welcome" drink tickets for use at the hotel bar (without restrictions) --a very nice workout facility --complementary bottled water in the room that was replenished on a daily basis --free "continental" breakfast that included your usual coffee, cereal, and bread, but also bacon, sausage, eggs and fresh fruit and fruit juices --a jar of delicious gingersnap cookies at the front desk that you could help yourself to anytime --fruit flavored water available at the bar throughout the day/night In addition, the staff throughout the hotel were very courteous and helpful. And while we didn't use it, there is a small saltwater pool in the courtyard of the hotel that looked rather nice. This is a great place to stay if you want to be close to the action of Bourbon Street, but it also remained surprisingly quiet, even with a street facing room, for it's location. We'll definitely stay here again if we come back to Nola and want to stay in the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet boutique hotel in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Karen L
Reviews.Content: An oasis of calm yet only steps from the madness on Bourbon St., this small hotel was a great choice for us. Not being big late night partiers, the room was amazingly quiet once doors and windows were shut. Loved the courtyard and pool area for relaxing with a nightcap although I wished the neon blue-purple lighting was toned down. Great location, near beautiful Royal St. and wonderful restaurants. Easy to pick up a cab to other neighborhoods. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Even when you give them a problem that they didn't have - they work hard to solve it.”
Reviews.Author: OldPhatDude
Reviews.Content: My daughter in-law had her flight cancelled and didnâ€™t get down to New Orleans till the next day. I got things messed up and thought that her room reservation had been cancelled. I went to the front desk with my imagined problem and did they ever work to make me happy. Eventually they figured out that I was the problem and put me straight. The thing is how hard they worked to make me happy and how nice they were when they found out I was the problem. Love all of the guys at the front desk. Oh yes the hotel was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: gemflanagan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in July 2012. It is located in the French Quarter just one block from Bourbon St. The hotel is very clean and well decorated. Check in was hassle free and the staff were all very friendly. On arrival we were given a voucher for a free drink in the bar - this was a lovely surprise. The bar was nice and clean with a lovely outdoor seating area beside the pool. The pool was quite small. Our room was nice and spacious and the beds were very comfortable. The location is ideal and is close to all the main attractions. I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate accommodations and a wonder ful stay.”
Reviews.Author: graylanternlizard
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were greeted by a warm, friendly young lady. Our room was outstanding. Beds extremely comfortable and the room was very clean. Miniscule issues with the glass shelf above the sink needing tightening and the facial mirror light didn't work. I'm not one to complain, but I believe it would have been fixed promptly if I would have asked. I liked the in room safe. We could secure items without having to take them to the car. The courtyard was peaceful. Bourbon street was very rowdy each night, but we never heard the noise from the courtyard. We were centrally located just a high block from Boubon Street. All the scenic sites were within easy walking distance. This Hotel was like a small peaceful oasis to go to at night, once one had their fill the French Quarter. If I'm in New Orleans again, this is the only place I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Christine E
Reviews.Content: I just came back from staying here with a group of girls for a bachelorette weekend and had an amazing time! The hotel is in the perfect location for bourbon st and quick walk to the riverfront. The staff were very friendly and accommodating during our stay. They called us cabs, held our bags before and after check in was available, gave great advice for local attractions and restaurants and acted as photographers when we needed it! We had great rooms with balconies over looking the pool, the beds were very comfortable, free bottled water every day and a yummy breakfast with bacon, sausage, eggs, cereal, and pastries! I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lex682
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on a business trip. Our conference hotel was sold out and they booked the overflow here. Frankly, I got the better end of the deal. This is a very pretty, modern boutique hotel in the heart of the French Quarter with perfect proximity to everything. It is a half block off of Bourbon street but you would never know it. Quiet and peaceful at night. The rooms are a good size, the bathroom could use a touch more counter space but otherwise no complaints. The bed was very comfortable. It took me a day to figure out that the coffee maker and hair dryer were in the dresser and not the bathroom but those aren't big deals for me anyway. I can't wait to go back and stay here on personal time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: JulzieJ1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in July - hotel is right next to Bourbon St and Royal St so you can easily walk anywhere in the French Quarter. The decor of the hotel is great - looks very modern, clean and funky and love the purple theme! We had a standard room and it was very big, comfy bed and nice bathroom (good hairdryer!). The gym is small but has a couple of treadmills and some weights so you can get a decent workout (you need it after all the amazing food in New Orleans). Breakfast is supposedly simple by American standards but for us it was more than enough - bagels, eggs, toast, cereal, muffins, juice etc etc. They even have iced tea out by the pool during the day. Free cocktail in the bar is also a nice touch. Staff all very polite and efficient - would highly recommend this hotel, wouldn't stay anywhere else in NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “A Contemporary Oasis in the Heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Meticulous_One
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the magnificent Hotel Le Marais for three nights during my recent visit to New Orleans. I was extremely impressed with the accommodations, amazing staff and the ideal location. I was accommodated in a superior king room at Hotel Le Marais. My room was situated on the third floor of the hotel and faced Conti Street. My room was quite and serene, even though Bourbon Street is just around the corner from the hotel. The down-to-earth staff made my stay at Hotel Le Marais particularly memorable. The hotel staff went above and beyond their call of duty to make my visit to New Orleans enjoyable. The staff was knowledgeable about area attractions, made great restaurant recommendations and assisted me with scheduling fascinating activities. Hotel Le Marais is an excellent value and I will definitely stay here again if I return to New Orleans in the future.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful family stay in the french quarter”
Reviews.Author: StaceyAN
Reviews.Content: We recently ended a two week trip through the South and stayed at the Le Marais. It was wonderful boutique hotel on a great street in the quarter. It is walking distance to wonderful restaurants and entertainment. The rooms are small, but the amenities are upper class. I highly recommend this hotel. We travelled with our 10 and 14 year old and they loved the salt water pool

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, weird balcony”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice at Le Marais. Both times we paid extra for a room with a balcony. I went on a girl's weekend trip last year and shared a room with two doubles with a friend. We had a small balcony and enjoyed coming back to the room and sitting out on the balcony people watching. Believe me, there was a lot to see every night, considering Bourbon street is right around the corner. I went with my husband on my second visit. I was expecting the same type of balcony that I had last year, however I was unpleasantly surprised to find it is a shared balcony, It is EXTREMELY startling to step outside in the early morning or late night and have a complete stranger standing there in the dark. I would never have paid the extra for this room had I known this. Aside from the balcony situation, the hotel is nice, it is in a good location and the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “August stay”
Reviews.Author: Mark P
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely brilliant hotel. We are a family of four (2 adults and 2 children - aged 4 & 12) and would thoroughly recommend this hotel. It is ideal for family but we can also see the attraction to couples. The room was great - spacious, very clean, well equipped and very modern. Pretty courtyard garden with small pool - all very attractive. The hotel is well located - close enough to the action but still felt like a quiet oasis. All round great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller-A1
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights with my 15 year old daughter. Was a little concerned given it seemed more like a couples hotel and perhaps a bit too noisy with a lot of nightlife. In fact it was a wonderfully quiet hotel. Very upscale and modern, trendy boutique hotel (just 66 rooms). The beds were very comfortable although not quite as firm as I like. The room had a safe, coffee maker, excellent flat screen TV, plenty of outlets for recharging electronics, bright, free WiFi. Bathroom had a large modern shower stall (no bath) plenty of towels, shampoo, soap, conditioner, etc. Great complimentary breakfast with a couple of hot dishes and the standard continental fare. The service was excellent - wonderful suggestions on restaurants, etc. "Swam" in the pool, which is really too small to swim but it was clean and refreshing to splash around. The courtyard is so quiet even though Bourbon St. Is just around the corner. A nice place to sit and relax after a long hot day of sightseeing. Overall, a nearly perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best we've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Robin B
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location...never had a question they couldn't answer. Located a block off of Bourbon Street and just a few off of Canal. Easy access (less than 10 minute walk to French Market and Cafe Du Monde), competitive rates and much more friendly than others in the area. Would go back again and recommend it to everyone. Family friendly as well!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQtee
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were contemplating staying here or at the Royal Sonesata. It was for my birthday and he wanted to make it perfect so he actually booked both places until we did further research and recommendations amongst friends and most particularly trip advisor, and cancelled the Sonesta. So in the end, we choose Le Marais, and it was one of the best decisions we've ever made!!! 1. Stay...Boutique hotel.....one needs to understand what that means. In short laymen's terms...it's small and chic. What I like to call clean and crisp. Modern and sleek. This hotel defines that. Loved the newness about it and the non oldness of New Orleans feel while being in the heart of New Orleans. The bed was beyond comfortable and the overall feel was amazing. We checked out the Royal Sonesata and there is no comparison. The Royal Sonesta hotel is very nice and ornate, but it felt VERY OLD and not the newness that we love being part of. The pool at Le Marais although very small, very appropriate. We stayed for a week and had it all to ourselves with the exception of a couple couples in the pool which we actually enjoyed engaging with. 2. Perfect location....Our hotel was in the heart of it all! 1 block off Bourbon, and in the best proximity to royal street and everywhere we wanted to explore 3. Service...the staff treated us with the utmost respect and accommodation. We made frequent requests and its was so admirable that the front desk would not even accept a tip from us even though we tried to make them take it. We also had another mishap where we left our luggage for a very late checkout and the staff broke one of our bottles of wine and not only offered to repay us with the wine but also to pay to replace everything in our bag on top of the dry cleaning bill. It was not necessary but the level of service they provided to even accommodate that made us feel so appreciated. 2 recommendations we would make is: 1, Have chairs on their balconies. It's a beautiful seating area, make it worthwhile to be there 2. Bar food. The hotel is extremely accomidating with having food by poolside, but it would be really nice to not have to order in and have them supply "bar food" No matter what, I would not stay anywhere else and would recommend this hotel to anyone who visits there. you will not be dissappointed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, super clean, design boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: QualiGuidesBelgium
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is perfectly located in the very heart of the French Quarter , just a few steps from the famous Bourbon Street. It has a nice cosy bar and inner court with tiny heated pool, free Wifi and complimentary breakfast. The staff is friendly and helpful. The beds are very comfortable and the TV screen is huge!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at this hotel last week and throughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel was everything we could ask for... comfortable, clean and quiet room, helpful staff, and great location. This hotel is only a block off of Bourbon Street and 3 blocks off of Decauter St. also, only 2-3 blocks away is the Canal St trolley line. The hotel is a small boutique hotel that has all of the amentities of a large hotel but very intimate and special. The rooms are very nice and updated and extremely comfortable. There is a really nice continental breakfast that is served every morning.. also includes eggs, sausage and bacon.. really great. We will definitely stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: NOLATraveler7
Reviews.Content: Stayed in March 2012 while attending a conference. Was going out on a limb, but the photos looked great. This was a GREAT find. Just off of Bourbon and you'd never know it. The staff were very friendly, helpful, and even recommended places to eat. They serve breakfast every morning, and cocktails on our first night. The courtyard seems very nice, although we didn't use the pool. Rooms were very nice - renovated, good view, large bathroom and nice shower. Bed was comfy and we slept well. Place seemed very clean and well-cared for. Nice attention to the finer details - good amenities, attentive service, etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated Hotel Close To Everything...”
Reviews.Author: KLOSETMONKEY
Reviews.Content: Just Returned from a 3 Night Stay in New Orleans - Native to the area and huge Saints Fans, we visit frequently and enjoy staying in different hotels to experience more of what the city has to offer. We chose this hotel based on the ratings. Pros: 1. Convenient Location, in between Royal Street (antiques/shopping) and Bourbon (party time!). 2. Quiet: despite the location, we heard no noise inside the hotel. 3. Complimentary Cocktail Ticket upon Arrival: always nice to unwind before heading to your room after traveling. 4. Clean and Modern with Comfortable Bedding and Large Flat Screen TV. 5. Complimentary Breakfast: though it was nothing extravagant. Cons: 1. Parking is expensive and being busy when we arrived on Conti Street, it was a little hard getting settled up with the Valet 2. No Vending Machines in the building: sometimes you just want a coke and the lounge never seemed to be open during the day. We had to go next door to a bar. 3. One Elevator/Extremely Slow: It is a Small "Boutique" Hotel, so understandably so. Service was friendly and overall, the Pros beat the Cons, so hotel would be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Our kind of place.”
Reviews.Author: UgAbUgA11
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend in this boutique hotel. Its located across the street from the Royal Sonesta, but it doesn't have the same intensity. With only 55 rooms, its one of the most serene hotels we've ever stayed in. The contemporary design of the lobby, waiting area are lounge add to the clean look. The patio area is well done, with a small salt water pool, banana trees, and comfortable seating. The room was not the largest we've ever been in, but with a little organizing of our 'stuff'' it worked out well. No sound from Bourbon street, even though its only a 1/2 block away. All the things to do are all within easy walking distance. Breakfast is served in the lounge. The only downside wasn't anything about the hotel, but the cab ride that I prepaid from the website. Hard to locate the cab at the AP which was a half hour late, and on returning was late again. Might be an issue with the cab drivers. Next time we'll just hop a cab at the AP and hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the French quarter”
Reviews.Author: alideb
Reviews.Content: Great location in the French quarter.1/2 block from Bourbon street but didn't have any noise issues. Staff helpful and friendly. They were helpful with parking our motorcycle. Room big enough, modern and clean. Breakfast an added bonus

Reviews.Title: “So classy but the area outside is not so classy”
Reviews.Author: Reyna24
Reviews.Content: If your looking for luxury you must stay here. This hotel if fancy and new. The bathrooms are fabulous and the pool is even better when you swim at night. The pool isn't deep or big but its still fun to swim in. The hotel was right in the French Quarter so you dont need to walk far for things. I'm a 13 year old and if you ask me, New Orleans is never a place that you want to bring your kids. I mean literally this place is worse than Vegas. There are half naked women giving out cards to everyone. One even tried to give one to me. There aren't any decent restaurants near the hotel because they are either bars or strip clubs. The only decent restaurant in the French Quarter is the Hard Rock Cafe. I loved that one because the music is great. Its loud but still great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and convenient!!! Great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shannon P
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! This place exceeded my expectations!!! The staff was super friendly and courteous - we didn't have a refrigerator in our room and when we asked about it, they said not all rooms came with them - about an hour later there was a knock at our door and there was a gentleman with a refrigerator!!! It wouldn't have been a big deal, but we had leftovers from lunch we wanted to save - the valet parking was wonderful, well worth the money....the staff was helpful in recommending places to eat - Deannie's was awesome - overall a great experience - very affordable for the location - it was nice to be able to walk out of the hotel and be on Bourbon St and be able to walk around without having to find parking - rooms were very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh, new, and clean, a few steps from Bourbon Street.”
Reviews.Author: cmcnally56
Reviews.Content: Le Marais is the perfect French Quarter alternative for a traveler who demands an immaculately cleaned room, excellent quality sheets and bedding, and superior appointments. The surfaces (bedside table, desk, etc.) are spotless. The light fixtures are dust-free. The window sills are squeaky clean. The whole room smells fresh. Why is this important? How many times have you been to New Orleans? I have been more than I can count. And I have been in TOO MANY dirty-feeling hotel rooms. You know the ones - there's no trash thrown on the floor and there are no dirty towels in the corner of the bathroom - BUT the room just feels- and smells - kinda dirty??? "Once burned, twice shy..." That's the reason that Le Marais is now my go-to choice in NOLA. Sure, you can object to the fact that there's no restaurant in the hotel. Big deal. You're surrounded by hundreds of great restaurants in the Quarter. You can step across the street to the old Royal Sonesta if you need to grab something quick. But admit it: It is hard to find a spot in the Quarter with the kind of fresh, clean, new rooms that you will find at Hotel Le Marais. Note: We were in NOLA during an epic series of rainstorms and did not get to enjoy the pool or the outdoor courtyard, but they looked lovely. We hope to hang out there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in the Heart of the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: Jay_in_DC
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic 2-night stay at Le Marais, perfect for those that appreciate smaller hotel properties over the larger chains. Location is just about perfect, a few blocks into the Quarter between Bourbon (for the partiers) and Royal (for the shoppers) streets and just a couple blocks up from the riverfront. The hotel has been completely updated inside and has a modern, colorful vibe in the common areas and the room...felt a little like South Beach in Miami. Very nice complimentary continental breakfast, one free drink (any drink off the menu!) per person at the hotel bar, and a couple of free water bottles per day in the room were all nice bonuses. Rooms are on the small side (to be expected given the location) but had enough room and everything you need. Well decorated with one of the cooler showers I've ran across. Staff was professional, friendly, and accommodating. We stayed there with my parents (70ish) and some younger friends (mid-20s) and we all loved it! GREAT value find at $129/nt!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming comfort”
Reviews.Author: Kathie J
Reviews.Content: Our room was good, it smelled nice when we opened the door. The bed was heavenly, lots of good pillows and soft bedding. The room had a cozy quality with its shuttered window, and low ceilings. I liked the decor, modern clean look. My only disappointment was the cleanliness of the bathroom. The door which was nice looking, was splattered with unknown dried liquids from previous guests. Black granite tile is so lovely surrounding the sink, but once again smudges and fingerprints stole its glamor. A wall mounted mirror was cheated of its sparkle with more prints and smudges. Clean is so so important, to me. My comfort and ability to relax depends on it. Everyone was friendly and helpful, as was Shawn at the front desk. Shawn is just a kind soul with a quick smile. Approachable, and that's important too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Gregory S
Reviews.Content: You cannot find a better location in New Orleans, the Hotel Le Marais is right in the heart of the French Quarter. It is within walking distance to everything you would ever want to do in NOLA. It's a perfect hotel for anyone who enjoys modern, contemporary design. The hotel was very clean and the staff was amazing. The morning breakfast and free drink vouchers on arrival were very nice touches. We would definately stay at the Hotel Le Marais again and recommend it to anyone visiting this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem - Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTravelGal76
Reviews.Content: Having never been to New Orleans, I wanted something in the french quarter but was really concerned about the noise level. Hotel Le Marais was just off Bourbon Street but felt like a world away! Fabulous clean and air conditioned rooms, very contemporary feel with trendy decor - it's a great hotel for 20 & 30 somethings. Gorgeous little courtyard, complimentary breakfast and complimentary drink tickets - what more can you ask for in Nola?!? I will definitely stay here again and will be recommending to friends travelling here - thanks Le Marais. Last thought - the staff are great and very attentive!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and staff was extremely friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Brando1974
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in New Orleans and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at La Marais. Lauren (bar supervisor) was very helpful and accommodating and her drinks were amazing. The rest of the staff made our stay a wonderful experience. Hotel was clean and it has a pool and gym which is a plus in the hot summer months. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yowie Bay, New South Wales, Australia
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian A
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better. So close to Bourbon Street yet so very quiet. Our group consisted of 3 couples all in our 50's & we all found the hotel perfect for our 3 night stay. Booking in was a breeze but we were a few hours early for the normal book in time. The staff stored our luggage & took our phone number to call if the rooms were ready early. The downstairs bar was the perfect place to meet & relax over a cold drink after a busy day of sightseeing.The bar tender was a fountain of information & she recommended a number of places to eat at & the two that we tried were excellent.The complimentary continental breakfast had more than enough to satisfy most peoples taste. The rooms were clean & comfortable & the bed was the best hotel bed we have ever encountered. The front desk staff were always very helpful & always had a nice smile.All of our group would recommend staying here

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: katyakatyak
Reviews.Content: the location right in the heart of the french quarter can't be beat. everything was within walking distance and made our trip so easy. the hotel was pretty great, with a few problems. checking in we had a couple problems with our reservation, but nothing major. we got a free drink at the funky bar which was nice. breakfast was very basic, but as long as there is bacon i am happy. i loved the pool, but it was quite small and more like a hot tub. during the week the place was quiet and nice, however the weekend was another story. we couldn't hear boubon street at all, but did hear lots of late night partiers coming home. overall i would absolutely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, not traditional”
Reviews.Author: aernest
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to Bourbon Street, this location is excellent. If you don't, it's still not bad because the noise from Bourbon really doesn't intrude. This hotel is very hip (minimalist decor, neon, etc.) and seems geared toward a younger clientele, but I too found it quite comfy and nice. The only downside is the parking-don't circle the block like we did. Just stop and go in and Bull will come out and unload your luggage and park you. I think it was about $35 to park our car for one night. There is a decent breakfast bar, but no restaurant, as others have noted. If you can't find a place to eat nearby, though, you're just not trying very hard!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Kristen D
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Marais was an amazing choice for our 4-year anniversary. Who knew such a place existed so close to Bourbon St.? The bar downstairs was so convenient, not too expensive and the bartender was very knowledgeable. It didn't hurt that upon check-in we received two free drink coupons. The bellhop/valet had an amazing attitude and was always funny and in a good mood. The front desk staff was helpful and each had a good attitude. The courtyard was fantastic and the pool was a great place to relax after a long day of walking. The room itself was great! Huge bed, lots of storage space and a great shower! The iPod deck was a nice touch, too. I really appreciated the key-card secure elevator since the hotel is so close to Bourbon. Overall, a fabulous experience and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: MadonnaTheresa
Reviews.Content: Reviews from other travelers said the Hotel Le Marais was well appointed ...yes; quite...yes; close to everything...yes; and a nice place to come back to...yes. I stayed here in June with some friends. The Hotel is located in the French Quarter, just around the corner from the infamous Bourbon Street. Itideally is a great place to come back to at night iwhen you have "ripped" through New Orleans like a "Hurricane"

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and new hotel near Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: CriticsReview
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Very close proximity to Bourbon Street (less than five minute walk), but without the noise. Its entrance is on the side of a street rather than in front facing the main road, so be on the lookout. New facility with a nice lobby and heated pool. Our room looked out onto a quiet courtyard. Complimentary breakfast with eggs, muffins, cereal, yogurt, milk and coffee. There was limited seating to eat, but it was still great. There is also a bar, and we got complimentary drink coupons when we stayed there. The only downside is that parking is difficult since the area around the hotel is limited, so we parked our car in an overnight garage near Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute hotel stay turned out to be a big win!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelinRedhead
Reviews.Content: We were visiting New Orleans to check out the area before relocating there. Originally we planned to stay in the suburbs (where we were looking for houses), but decided to stay int he French Quarter to get the "real" New Orleans experience. Hotel Le Marais was not only budget-friendly, but it was super nice! Very clean and the beds are very comfy! It's more than I expected. It's right in the French Quarter without being in the middle of all the crazy nightlife. Close enough to walk to Bourbon Street, yet far enough to enjoy a good quiet night's sleep. We walked to the cathedral, the river front and beyond. The staff was EXTREMELY friendly and the complimentary welcome cocktail is a nice touch. Also love the complimentary WiFi. Bonus -- the pool courtyard makes for a cool evening hangout. It was pretty quiet on a Sunday night in May so we had the pool area to ourselves. This is now our go-to hotel for the French Quarter. Clean, classy and budget-friendly boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Older Hotel is Modernized!”
Reviews.Author: gbdoux
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about this hotel. My husband and I booked this hotel a few times when it was the St. Ann/Marie Antoinette. The hotel had great character with New Orleans charm. The courtyard and adjacent bar were quaint. We absolutely loved it! It has since been modernized. We stayed there once since it's revitalization. Love the new modern look. Bar and courtyard are still wonderful places to hang out with friends. I forgot to mention that the courtyard has a swimming pool. It's great on hot summer days and nights. Pros - conveniently located between Bourbon Street and Royal Street and only a few blocks from Canal St. Located near many restaurants. Very Modern!! Cons - rooms are pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitchell L
Reviews.Content: A small gem of a hotel. Close to everything yet on a quiet street. The staff couldn't have been friendlier. By the end of our three night stay we were on a first name basis with everyone. Rooms were clean. The AC was powerful [an important factor during the summer] The breakfast included bacon and sausage. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Cannot say enough nice things about this amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BeadleEngland
Reviews.Content: Friendly and super helpful service - from the bar staff, cleaners, front desk, valets - they were all lovely. Amazing value. This rates as one of the top 5 hotels I've stayed in globally (and I've stayed in some really high end hotels like Westins, Four Seasons etc). Free continental breakfast in the bar/seating area included in your stay - lovely to enjoy out in the courtyard by the pool. Free drink vouchers to redeem against anything - including lovely cocktails - in the bar. Complimentary bottled water in your room - replaced daily! Complimentary iced tea by the pool daily. Beautiful pool and courtyard with seating area to enjoy - lovely and shaded and quiet, despite the 100 degree heat. Such a luxury! Beautifully appointed rooms. Quiet, private, lovely shuttered windows - we were on the top floor so had great views of some surrounding architecture that really helps get you in the spirit of the city. Great choice of cocktails. Valet parking prices were pretty steep at $27 per night but appreciate this is probably because you're right in the heart of New Orleans and given how amazing everything else was, I don't even really care! Our first visit to New Orleans - beautiful city and a wonderful boutique hotel, perfectly located for local attractions and restaurants. You can walk to the French Market, the Cabildo, Canal St, 1850 house/Pontalba buildings (well worth a visit), the beautiful antique shops of Royal St and the downtown civil war museum in Memorial Hall. GW Fins is great for more fine dining; Bubba Gump great food at great prices. I'm not a Bourbon St kind gal so we avoided that (easy to do). You're right in the thick of things at this hotel. I honestly cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. I want to go back already.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, beautiful room.”
Reviews.Author: Chacha2017
Reviews.Content: With that said, you may wonder why a 4 star. After many trips to New Orleans I can tell you one of the most important things is noise reducing drapes which may not be attractive but make sleep much easier to come by as this town is NEVER quiet. The staff was friendly and attended to all our needs. The rooms clean and the whole hotel is beautifully decorated. I did notice a situation that has already been addressed and that is the shower! You can flood the whole room if you are not careful. Ending on a positive note, the Rum Runners are lethal! Beware!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, stylish, and in the heart of Nola”
Reviews.Author: Leila S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel le Marais for four nights and loved it. This modern, boutique hotel was clean and well-maintained. The beds were heavenly! The one issue in the room was that the shower would spray outside the stall, leaving huge puddles on the floor, so we had to have the shower head practically facing the opposite wall to avoid the mess. The staff was extremely helpful, particularly Pierre, who booked several tours for us and got us $10 discounts per person per tour. The best part of the hotel is that it is in the heart of the French Quarters. This visit was all of our first times in Nola. Being able to walk to key landmarks, check out local art galleries and antiques, and grab a beignet was a huge plus! Other hotel perks: free drinks per guest, free bottled water in the room, 15% off our stay, and chocolates and ginger snaps in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Needed”
Reviews.Author: Carrie T
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at the Hotel Le Marais on a mini-vacation with friends. The hotel met our needs very well. Rooms were spacious and comfortable, location was very convenient, staff members were friendly and helpful. The free breakfast is a nice feature, and the back patio/pool area is a great place to gather and relax. My only complaint is that the water pressure in the shower in our room was terrible - just a light trickle of water. But the others I was with didn't have this issue in their room, so I assume it was just a fluke. New Orleans is a large city with a lot to see, leaving me wanting to return. I would definitely consider staying at Le Marais again the next time.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: petsozzie888
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for a week recently, and loved every minute of it! Everyone from the valet, bellhop, front desk, and bar were great; very friendly and helpful. Really liked the artwork in the lobby and bar -- just wish there had been info on where to buy it. (I Googled the artist and still couldn't find what I was looking for... bummer -- but obviously not the hotel's fault.) Our room was very clean and we LOVED the bedding and pillows -- Super-comfy. So comfy that we didn't want to get out of bed most days despite our schedule! The drink vouchers were a nice touch <and the drinks were great!>, and we also loved the pool area with the banana trees (complete with 3 bunches of ripening bananas at the time!). Liked the electronic 'do not disturb' indicator as well (as much as I travel, it was my first time seeing this = pretty cool!). We booked through bookit.com and got a free jazz brunch for two at the Court of Two Sisters - what a nice surprise! (Though it is worth paying full price if this option isn't available!) The hotel is in an ideal location in the French Quarter, half a block from Bourbon St. Just nextdoor is a 'dive' bar called The Copper Monkey with great late-night food, fewer tourists than most places in the area, and THE BEST bartenders!!!! (And proper Absinthe preparation!) A block away is a nice wine bar also (at the former St. Louis Hotel -- I forget the new name...) This was my 6th trip to NOLA, and definitely the best! I'm pretty much over Bourbon Street, but staying in the French Quarter is always nice - there are still fantastic dining and shopping options within walking/short-driving distance that are less-touristy, esp. on/around Frenchmen Street. Acme's (FQ) chargrilled oysters are still to Die for (depsite how touristy it has become), and the 'original cocktail walking tour' can be a real hoot depending on who your guide is --- I'm ashamed to say that I forgot our last guide's name -- he is a retired teacher and Fantastic! --- took us to some really nice and historic bars, some so nice that I was surprised that they let tour groups in, with the jeans and sneakers and all ..... A fascinating history lesson moreso than a pub crawl! He took us to Antione's, Arnaud's, French 75, the newly-expanded Monteleone carousel bar, the Napoleon House, etc... He even explained the origin of the term "Dixieland" --- quite interesting!! Be sure to take a swamp tour as well!! NOLA is a fabulous city --- I can't possibly imagine how anyone wouldn't have a great time there!! Anyway, Hotel Le Marais was great, despite our crappy back-alley view (wish we had known that beforehand...) Still, highly recommend! Staff was great. Hotel Le Marais was great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very cool boutique hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: LMM1983
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Marais has the most "personality" of any hotel I've ever stayed in. Very cool, pretty colors, just a really interesting place. Free drink tickets upon arrival, comfortable bed, VERY friendly staff (especially the valet), and a really awesome location. Next time, I'll request a room not facing the street, as we were apparently there on trash pick-up day and it was quite noisy. But other than that, we loved everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: MicahAH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Le Marais while in town for the "Beasts of the Southern Wild" premiere in New Orleans and was thoroughly impressed. There were so many small touches that made the experience enjoyable, such as the touch panel in the lobby, which provides information to guests looking for a great restaurant or something to do. I also enjoyed that the elevator required you to swipe your key card BEFORE the elevator would even open... which I think helps keep non-guests from tie-ing up the elevator. Everything was newly renovated, and I liked that all of the blankets were white. It's hard to fake clean when everything is white!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Liz G
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel right in the thick of the Quarter. The rooms were super clean and the beds amazingly comfortable. Got a free drink coupon for their bar and free breakfast (which was pretty much the best hotel breakfast I've had). Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Gem in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Gene J
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Marais was a beautiful property. The look and atmosphere of the hotel was second to none. The rooms had great amenities, like an I-pod docking station and large hi-def tv's. I thought the staff was very helpful and friendly. The location is second to none. Once you arrive, you don't need to drive anywhere. Bourbon Street was just a few feet away, and there were restaurants all around. Great place to stay while in New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Subtle Sophistication in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: brownpads32
Reviews.Content: As a first time traveler to New Orleans, I didnâ€™t know what to expect. When my husband and I travel, we fully appreciate most kinds of accommodations (large resorts, bed and breakfast properties, branded chains, boutique hotels) but for my first and probably last trip to this city I wanted to stay at an independent property that had some New Orleans character, was reasonably priced (under $200 a night), offered updated rooms and a great locationâ€¦thatâ€™s EXACTLY what we got at Hotel le Marais. I joined my husband on his work trip so we stayed Sunday to Wednesday morning. Sunday afternoon we got to enjoy the courtyard and the poolâ€”here is where we got the New Orleans character and feel. The stone and wicker chairs and the windows and awnings above create a very quiet and charming atmosphere. Our rate and what we got for it was VERY reasonableâ€¦to get WIFI, comfy beds and some breakfast bites for well under $200 a night is more than reasonable, which brings me to my last pointâ€¦location. Not a huge fan of Bourbon Street but you are close to the â€œactionâ€� with this hotel. And you are close to everything else that matters too so you canâ€™t go wrong location-wise. If you are looking for a full service property there are certainly other choices but if you like the boutique feel, appreciate value for your dollar, and are looking for some subtle sophistication in the French Quarter look no further.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Nicky14
Reviews.Content: We have been to N.O. many times over the years, so when I realized that this hotel was between Bourbon and Royal, my first thought was that noise would be a factor. But, surprisingly, we heard nothing from Bourbon Street. My only complaint about noise was the slamming of the guest room doors. We heard it all through the night as people came home from their various outings. I also felt that the walls were a bit thin...could hear the music next door on the I Pod docking system. I even brought a fan with me from home in order to help drown the noises out, but to no avail. And this is certainly not the hotel's fault..I was just mentioning. The hotel staff were very friendly. It was nice to have a free cocktail on arrival. The bottled water in the rooms was also very nice. The WI-fi was easy to access. The beds were comfy. I love white bedding. The rooms were very updated, and we overlooked the courtyard...nice. The bathroom could have been a little cleaner, I thought, but overall, was acceptable. The pool area/outside courtyard area could have been a little cleaner. There were full ashtrays everywhere...gross. And it didn't seem as though they kept the area looking as nice as they could have. The pool is super small, and there wasn't a lot of seating available. We very rarely sat out there because all of chairs were occupied, or people had left drinks sitting there as though there was still someone there. The proximity of the hotel to Canal street was nice. Really it was the perfect spot for us. We really did enjoy the experience and will return...but I won't forget my fan.....

Reviews.Title: “AC sucked; Doors hard to shut; Noise level from hallways LOUD!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda J
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel and was extremely disappointed with their service! Upon arriving, there was no valet at the front door, even tho 5 minutes earlier Iâ€™d spoken with the front desk via phone, who told me the valets were waiting at their front door; and instructed me to simply pull right up. No valet for at least 10 minutes; no signs instructing how or where the valet worked. When I first got to my room, the temperature was 77 degrees. Turned the AC down but it literally took 4 hours for the room to cool off to a 73 non-sweat temperature. Hotel sent AC man up to tell me it works just fine, that the problem was just in my mind. He said he would bring us a small plug in fan but NEVER did! The doors appeared to shut and sounded as tho they shut but the doors were very hard to shut and latch. (Conversations with other hotel guests confirmed they had this issue as well) We were able to hear every conversation guests/maids had while walking thru the hallways! (Conversations with numerous other hotel guests, from different floors than I, confirmed they had this issue as well) Then my card was charged $28 more dollars than the receipt I signed at the front desk while checking out. Basically they LIED to me about how much my card was getting charged. However, the hotel did give me a refund of this $28 bucks within a few days. Also upon checkout, the front desk could not describe the valet parking procedures or give me a timeframe on how long it would be before the valet brought my car around... Overall I'll never stay at the Hotel Le Marias in New Orleans again. All things considered if they hotel personnel would have accommodated me with the fan they agreed to bring, and were helpful with the valet questions, and if they would have only charged my card for the amount on my signed receipt - then Iâ€™d go back. BUT they didnâ€™t seem to care! Note: many folks in line at the front desk were complaining, which made for a negative atmosphere. During my vacation to New Orleans, this hotel was the only complaint I had.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet stay in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: evarett
Reviews.Content: I would recommend a stay at Hotel Le Marais for anyone looking for the comforts of a new boutique hotel that's a quiet hideaway yet right in the middle of the action. The Location This is the perfect location for anyone visiting the French Quater for the first time. The hotel is within walking distance to any one of the many incredible areas, including being around the corner from the excitement of Bourbon Street and fascinating Royal Street shopping. The Service All staff were very friendly and the front desk staff were always available to answer questions or book any tours. Check in was very quick and our room was available early which was nice after a very early flight. The Room We had a courtyard view room, two double beds. The room was very clean and comfortable. Being a boutique hotel the decor was modern and the beds were very comfortable with nice bedding. We never heard any noise after we retired so we got good sleeps. Amenities It was nice to get bottles of water in the room, and our complimentary bar beverage was a nice touch - although I would argue that you should receive a free drink for every night you're staying as one nighters get one drink as well. The pool and outdoor courtyard was a nice refuge when looking to unwind after a long day in the quarter, in fact most times we had it to ourselves. The music and free beverages (non-alcoholic) outside added to our enjoyment. It's a nice perk to have a free breakfast however most days it was cold unfortunately - but free is free. The free wi-fi was easy to connect to and I appreciated the business centre and being able to print our boarding passess for free. Room Tip: Don't pay extra for a "balcony room", the balconys are very small, and do not appear to have any furniture to sit out and enjoy so why bother.

Reviews.Title: “Trouble Before Arrival”
Reviews.Author: Daniel R
Reviews.Content: I booked my room with Hotel Le Marais about a month ago, and Iâ€™m scheduled to arrive in a few days. Today I received a call from them, but I did not answer since I didnâ€™t recognize the number. Of course, after looking up the number, I called back to inquire about the call. Given they left no message, I assumed it was unimportant, and perhaps a courtesy call of some sort. WRONG! On the contrary, I was informed by two separate people that the hotel was going to be closed on my day of arrival. No explanation was offered; instead I was transferred to someone who could â€œbetter help meâ€�. Of course, Iâ€™m thinking why would a hotel be closed without warning? When I finally got in touch with someone who could â€œbetter help meâ€�, I was informed the building was going to be closed due to the electricity being out on that day. In the back of my mind, I kept questioning why no message was left to tell me this? Why would you require your guests to do the extra research and work to get this info from you? Needless to say, when I had someone else call back to make reservations for my already schedule dates, they were told the hotel was overbooked for that dayâ€¦no, not without power, but overbooked. Iâ€™m looking into other alternatives right nowâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: SJAC67
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, I was cautious because I had read about the small rooms and the paper thin walls, but when I found a great deal on Hotels.com, I had to take a chance. We had a standard King room. The room size was more than adequate and the bed was probably the best hotel bed I've ever slept in. Location of this hotel is great, right in the center of things and felt very safe even at night. There were only a couple of bumps, but certainly not deal breakers for another trip. The bathroom has a pocket door, but ours didn't slide all the way closed. My husband and I didn't have a problem with this, but if you were staying with someone that wasn't a spouse or very close friend, this might cause a challege. The magnifying mirror in the bathroom was broken and almost fell off the wall, but that wasn't a big deal either. As far as the paper thin walls, I requested a room away from the elevator and we never heard any outside noise. Slept very quietly the entire time. The valet parking was a little harder than I've had at other hotels. The hotel shares a garage with the Royal Sonesta and either the one valet was parking a car, or they don't stay on hand outside this hotel, but it's not marked very clearly about where to go or what to do. I left my husband in the street and went into the hotel where they told me to pull behind a vehicle and wait and several minutes later, someone finally came out to help with our bags. We ended up leaving our vehicle there and hoped that it would get to where it needed to go, which it did and when we were ready to leave, it didn't take anytime to get it back and the gentleman helped with bags and was very nice. So, leaving was definately easier than arriving. All of that being said....this was a VERY nice hotel and the staff was extremely nice and always made up feel welcome each time we left or came back in. We did not get a balcony room as they are very small and don't have chairs on them, but for the deal I got, I was very satisfied with our stay. For future visits to NOLA, I will certainly consider Hotel Le Marais as an option.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Nick T
Reviews.Content: When I hear boutique hotel, I think of small, quaint, but old and run down, Not the case here. Hotel le Marais is modern with cool lighting and friendly staff. Rooms were clean, modern and in very good condition. WiFi is free, fast and easy to connect. Buffet breakfast is free with an adequate spread. One minute walk to all the action on Bourbon Street and down at the riverside, but bring your ear plugs for when you decide to call it a night. There are a few areas I would mark it down: 1. Bath room - no room for toiletries and door requires a muscle man to open and close it. Shower is only partially screened. 2. There is no dining area, so breakfast needs to be eaten at the bar or in lounge chairs with small coffee tables. Not an easy way to negotiate your bacon and eggs. 3. Hallway is noisy and walls quite thin so you can hear your neighbors coughing and...what not. 4. Pool and court yard area looks nice but we didn't venture out there as it was so hot and there was no shelter. Overall a good stay, but I think other reviewers on here are looking through rose coloured glasses. A good value for money hotel right in the heart of the french quarter and I would not hesitate to stay here again. Hopefully they consider some of these opportunities for providing their clientelle with an even better experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT centrally-located hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wyatt H
Reviews.Content: I found this small, boutique hotel on bookit.com, and was blown away! If you want old-world rustic, then this isn't your place. But if you want urban, chic, new, small, clean, wonderfully comfortable linens and beds, and OUTSTANDING sevice from smiling, happy people, then look no further! Located on Conti Street, between Bourbon and Royal, you are steps away from the boisterous debauchary of Bourban, and the ritzy arts of Royal. My room was actually on Conti, and in spite of it's central location, it was quite and comfortable. Valet Parking is just immediately across the street at the Royal Sonesta parking garage. I give this property my highest recommendation, and I will return many times!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the FQ”
Reviews.Author: phl5110
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to NOLA and I did a lot of research on TA about hotels. Hotel Le Marais did not disappoint - the location was perfect, in the middle of everything yet not noisy and ridiculous like on Bourbon Street, even though it was a few steps to the corner of Conti and Bourbon. Our room was a nice size, enjoyed the modern decor and the room was great with a REALLY comfy bed, although the water from the shower gets all over the floor due to the very short little glass wall - if it was extended a couple of inches that would easily solve the problem. The only thing that wasn't 100% for me was the continental breakfast, but then again it's free so you really can't complain. There wasn't a ton of selection and the bagels were stale one day. We ended up eating out for breakfast half the time anyway, since there are so many good places nearby. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We had them call us a cab one day to arrive at 8:50 since we had to pick up our rental car at 9, and at 9:05 the cab still hadn't come. The guy from the front desk actually ran into the middle of Bourbon trying to flag one down for us, so he definitely went out of his way to solve the issue. I would definitely stay here again if we come to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay - Clean and Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Courtney S
Reviews.Content: Went here when visiting my brother in New Orleans. Not a bad place at all, price was good considering I had to sleep somewhere other than his place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: umezoom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took the trip down to NOLA for our 5th anniversary. Our biggest requirements were that the hotel be located in a central place so we wouldn't have to rent a car, that the accommodations be nice, and that prices were not astronomical. Hotel Le Marais met all of these requirements and exceeded our hopes. The hotel itself was very clean and modern -- decor was nice and our room was very comfortable. It is great to come back from a day out and about in the sweltering NOLA heat and relax in the comfort of a well air-conditioned room. Staff was very friendly, and the free WIFI and breakfast was awesome. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: PVAZSharon
Reviews.Content: This hotel fit our needs perfectly. Great location close to French Quarter but quiet retreat down a side street. We stayed only one night since we were on our way to Baton Rouge for a wedding, but we couldn't be more pleased with our stay there. Shawn, at the front desk, was very friendly and helpful, giving us restaurant suggestions and trolley information. Wish I could remember the bell hop's name, but he was very welcoming and personable. The complimentary welcome drinks were a nice way to begin our stay, and the bartender was friendly. The lobby, bar and outdoor courtyard were lovely. The room was clean, comfortable and beautifully furnished. Since we were picking up a rental car at the airport later in the afternoon, the front desk person graciously stored our bags and called a cab for us. Our son and daughter-in-law stayed there too and had a similar experience. On a return trip to New Orleans, we would definitely stay at Hotel le marais.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter retreat”
Reviews.Author: azhottraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Marais was a great choice for us. The French Quarter can be overwhelming with too many hotel, restaurant, and bar choices. We loved New Orleans but will probably not stay in the French Quarter next time. The Hotel Le Marais is an exception to drab old buildings in the Quarter. Pierre, at the front desk, was exceptionally helpful. We had requested a courtyard room because we knew the other King rooms facing Conti street would be noisy. They could not accommodate us the 1st 2 nights but Pierre was able to get us into a courtyard room by the 3rd night. He also arranged tours for us, was prompt responding to all requests, and gave good advice. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. The only critique is that housekeeping didn't leave fresh plastic or coffee cups and didn't wipe count off counters for 2 nights. But that was a very minor nuisance. The beds are comfortable, the large TVs great, excellent lounge/bar area and fitness room, courtyard, etc. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Marais”
Reviews.Author: Bunny W
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to the French Quarter. Our first stay at the Maison Dupuy was lovely so we booked a 2nd. That stay proved to be problematic in so many ways we knew we'd not stay there again. In our search for new accommodations we came across Hotel Le Marais via BookIt and we're so glad we did! The hotel is fresh and modern with a central location in the heart of the French Quarter. All we asked for in a room was present from a very clean room, to comfortable bedding, plenty of linens/towels, and even free bottles of water. I realize these may be found in many hotels, but if you add to that the incredibly warm, friendly staff who were always ready to serve in any way possible, then you've gone up the scale. Everyone from hotel manager Daffne Ruglas, the wonderful front desk employees, bartender, and housekeeping were professional yet personable. The only reason I did not give this the highest rating was because our room was directly across from the elevator. Early morning revelers still partying on the way to their rooms waking you up at 3:30AM didn't make for the best of circumstances, but when you're in NOLA, you tend to expect things like this. The next time we book our stay here (and we will plan to stay at the Hotel Le Marais again) we'll ask for a room away from the elevator. That would make it perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfecto!”
Reviews.Author: misschannie
Reviews.Content: This little boutique hotel was absolutely perfect for our Mardi Gras trip. Not only was it cute and classy, but it was also decorated superbly. The decor was exceptional. The rooms were well maintained and the bed was super comfortable. The hotel was poisitioned perfectly, .5 blocks away from Bourbon St. walking. Plus it is situated on a street with plenty of great restaurants. Each morning, the complimentary breakfast was freshly prepared and the food choices were good. The bar was well stocked and the drinks did us justice. The pool, while small, had the perfect temperature setting and provided us with the splashes we needed. I am definitely planning on going back to stay here on future trips!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Kelly U
Reviews.Content: Love our 3 night stay here. Perfect location. Easy access to anywhere you want to go. Courtyard and pool area a great mid-day escape from walking the city. Yummy fresh drinks served at the bar. Highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again if I ever find myself back in NO.

Reviews.Title: “Always tell them if you book through third parties-but good stay!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights for our one-year anniversary last summer. The hotel is gorgeous and perfectly located! Our bed was extremely comfortably and we certainly appreciated the complimentary bottled water. The open shower was a little off-putting, but we quickly got used to that and we loved the "modern" appeal of the hotel compared to others in the area. However, on check-out, we were charged again for the room even though we had already paid through a third-party. They had our card on file for damages, and simply charged the full stay to it. We were quite shocked when we arrived home to find such a large charge and it took several days and speaking to several "higher ups" to sort it out. They were still relatively new, so we are hoping they have sorted this part of the business out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: LeeG1982
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and in the best location you can hope for. The staff is friendly and helpful and really make the stay enjoyable. The bar has a great selection of tasty drinks to enjoy by the pool or on one of the lounge chairs in the private courtyard. This hotel is right off Bourbon Street but when you are in the back courtyard you feel as if you are in a quiet neighbourhood. When you are done relaxing you just need to walk out the front door to experience all the craziness and fun to be had on Bourbon Street. I can't say enough great things about this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Superior Hotel, Best Location, Excellent Service and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Lovesgreatfood_9
Reviews.Content: We travel down each June for the Zydeco and Creole Tomato Festival from Nashville. Therefore, we have stayed in MANY NOLA hotels! This hotel was excellent in every way!! The positive reviews are absolutely correct! We flew in early Thursday morning and were able to check-in very early with no problem--just a quick phone call and we were in! My brother and his wife were staying in a room next to us but their room was not ready. They gave us 4 extra free drink tickets in addition to the four we got when we arrived for the VIBE bar in the lobby (and the mixed drinks are ten to fifteen dollars so we were thrilled!!) The windows facing the street are triple paned so you hear very little of the Bourbon street sounds. We did hear people talking in the halls the first night when they returned to their rooms but no big deal! The staff was SO accomodating, friendly, and sweet!! The decor is very trendy and hip which we loved and the pool and courtyard are VERY nice! The rooms looked recently renovated, and the beds are heavenly! The maid service is OUTSTANDING! OUR rooms were spotless each day-and I'm very type "A" so it passed my test with flying colors! We also received free bottled water in our rooms each day, and unlimited bottled water in the first rate hotel gym!! In addition, I also especially loved that you had to use your key to not only enter the hotel after a certain time at night, but you had to have it to get on the elevator and in the gym as well!! The breakfast buffet was wonderful and well stocked with absolutely everything you would or could need for a great continental breakfast! On our last day our flight didn't depart until four so they gladly stored our luggage for us while we walked around town. Upon our departure, I left without my hanging bag of very nice dresses! We called the hotel from the car service and the very sweet "French I believe" front desk clerk (female) cannot recall her name, said they would overnight my bag to me immediately. It arrived on Tuesday morning on my front door just as I had left it! Now that's SERVICE!! This hotel gets a 5-star from me and will be the ONLY place that we ever stay on our future visits to NOLA!!

Reviews.Title: “As good as all the great reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: I am struggling to find a single fault with this hotel so I will just quickly run through the numerous positive aspects. Firstly I think the staff deserve recognition as they were charming and helpful from the moment we stepped through the door. The location was perfect, we were slightly concerned about noise being in the heart of the French Quarter but it was not an issue at all. I also cant stress how good value this hotel is, we were previously staying in a large chain hotel on the outskirts of town which was awful and was only $60 a night cheaper. There aren't many places you could find such a great hotel at such a reasonable price especially considering breakfast is included. Lastly the room was immaculate, the bed large and comfortable and the bathroom was lovely. As a few people had mentioned the rooms aren't that large but they are big enough. Can't reccomend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the right choice!”
Reviews.Author: toalt2
Reviews.Content: You really can believe all these great reviews: perfect location, quiet (at least for us, we asked for courtyard facing room away from the elevator), comfortable bed and rooms. Without a doubt we would stay here again. The staff really did provide good customer service and care when our room was missed by housekeeping- they sent someone right up, and the next day the manager gave us a restaurant voucher for our trouble. The breakfast was convenient and the lobby area had a great feel. The hotel was not too big or too small, and it was very clean and well maintained. I always study trip adviser before I make my choices, and I want to return the favor - Le Marais is absolutely the right choice!

Reviews.Title: “Le marais is a cute boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: verese
Reviews.Content: My stay a le marais was quiet and relaxing. I enjoyed having a room facing the courtyard. The banana trees are a nice touch and having cold water to drink was delightful. The pool is nothing.to brag about but ok to dip your feet in after a long day of walking . The salt water is soothing. The breakfast was nice but after a few days you've had enough since the menu doesn't change. I recommend daisy dukes and the bourbon house for a full hearty breakfast. As far as housekeeping I have to say it sucks. I booked a double bed room but received single amenities--1robe 3 towels 1set of toiletres note housekeeping never restocked supplies until I asked them to. On one occasion I was in the room while housekeeping was cleaning my bathroom I watched as she used a rag to clean the debris from the shower and took the same rag and wiped the toliet seat I asked her to please re clean the toliet seat using a new rag she looked at me as if I were crazy then did as I asked. A poor job was done when it came to dusting and changing the sheets everyday. I.stayed for a week and after the second day I needed to take the linens completly off the bed in order to get a fresh set. With all that being said everything about this cute boutique hotel is a plus but housekeeping really need to step their game up. P.s. Pierre is a nice guy but I wonder why he wore the same suit and shirt everyday. Uniform maybe?

Reviews.Title: “Le Marais exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: maryhBatonRouge
Reviews.Content: Reviews for this hotel were good, and we agree that it's an excellent choice. The staff were friendly and heopful. We enjoyed our welcome drinks at the bar (these could be used anytime during the stay). The continental breakfast, with eggs, sausage, bacon and the other usual items, was pleasant in the bar area. The room was quiet; well-stocked, and looked out over the courtward with its salt-water pool. Great location in the French Quarter. Parking was expensivek, but easy; that's just what happens in the FQ. We will return when we want a night in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “AS ADVERTISED”
Reviews.Author: HoustonLion
Reviews.Content: Stayed all over N.O in the last 10 years and this place is a little gem Rooms are not huge but do the job and beds are so comfy I will be back

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: PrettyInPink98
Reviews.Content: I have a mixed review on Hotel Le Marais... there are cons and pros to this hotel when normally I feel one way or the other. Pros: *Price was good and definitely got a lot for your money including 2 free drinks from the bar and a free breakfast with hot food *Location was within walking distance of everything... right in the middle and just a block from Bourbon *Loved the modern decor in the lobby and bar area *Enjoyed the pool which was like a big hot tub Cons: *Our room was not ready when we arrived even though it was check-in time *Location was just a block from Bourbon which means I heard the music and people till 4 am *I heard people in the hallways all hours of the night, doors opening and closing were loud and the housekeeping was very loud in the morning *The shower door only covers half the shower so it was easy to make a water mess all over the bathroom floor *The hotel employees were not friendly or helpful... however the bartenders were pretty good Overall I would recommend it if you are looking for a hotel that fits this price range because you do get a lot more for your money than similar priced hotels. However, when I return to New Orleans I definitely want to try Hotel Monteleone.... I fell in love with the look and feel of it just from the lobby and Carousel Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great French Quarter Location”
Reviews.Author: jwdubs60
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Marais is located on Conti, between Bourbon and Royal - which puts you close to all the late night excitement, but away from the noise. The hotel has been completely renovated in the past 18 months and the rooms are cozy (small), but well furnished. The staff throughout the hotel were courteous and attentive to our needs. The cost of the room was reasonable and included a continental breakfast and free wi-fi throughout the hotel. Parking is expensive (as you would expect in the French Quarter) and they share the valet service with the Royal Sonesta hotel located across the street. It was a little confusing when we arrived at the hotel as there were no signs on valet parking, but you can enter the self-park for Royal Sonesta directly across from the Hotel LeMarais on Conti and stop at the valet stand. The valet staff were very quick with retrieving our car whenever we needed it. The Hotel Le Marais is an excellent choice if you are looking for a smaller boutique hotel, with excellent service and close to all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Service #1”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler1717
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Do yourself a favor and stay here. Great location! Tucked in on Conti away from the madness but steps away from everything! The service is fantastic. Pillows are a bit thick for my taste-but I am sure others love them. Does take about 30 minutes to get your car from the garage, so plan accordingly. Other than that, loved it! Quiet, trendy place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Canada010
Reviews.Content: We did a lot of research and finally decided on Le Marais for our NOLA stay. We couldn't have been more pleased! The front desk staff were courteous and helpful and made our stay wonderful. We were warmly greeted each time we came in the door and they were invaluable in choosing restaurants and made reservations for us. The bar area and pool area were both well used and they were a comfort at the end of a long day walking. The location is great and we never even took a taxi.
