It is surprising that you cannot hear the noise from Bourbon St. It is close to restaurants, casino and water front. We highly recommend this hotel as one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, conveniently located, clean”
Reviews.Author: Amberleah14
Reviews.Content: This hotel has its own flavor - much more character than a chain. And it somehow manages to be quiet while conveniently located within walking distance of the French Quarter. The beds are heavenly and the amenities nice. Personnel was very customer-centric. The rooms are small, but adequate. The furniture (which is very nice) occupies most of the space, leaving only a moderate pathway. But the bed was do luxurious, we didn't care! Parking was a nightmare. The hotel offers valet service, but we arrived late night and had to self park in the garage. Self-parking is usually simple; this was anything but. Regardless, we would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Suprise”
Reviews.Author: rwaltd
Reviews.Content: New Orleans has many places to stay. You will not be disappointed with le Marais. Located in the French Quarter between Bourbon and Royal Streets this a quiet oasis in the middle of the excitement. The service staff were knowledgeable and friendly. They made all the right recommendations for dining and directions during our two night stay. I recommend this hotel without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location; Amazing Value”
Reviews.Author: TheByrdsTheWord
Reviews.Content: The location is unbelievable if you want to be close to the action and bars - right between Bourbon and Royal. Also right around the corner from a cab stand and an easy walk to jackson square. Despite the location, the hotel still is quiet (we had a fifth floor room). The rooms are pretty, clean and modern, the staff is friendly and the breakfast is better than expected. Overall great value. For martini fans, try one of the specialty cocktails at their downstairs bar. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Intimate, Boutique Hotel in the Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: AkronTravelBug
Reviews.Content: I first came across this hotel in Budget Travel Magazine as it was rated in the top 100 boutique hotels in the US. After reading reviews here on TA, I was convinced this was the right hotel for us. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to be in the heart of the French Quarter, but away from all the noise it brings, and if you are looking for a modern, cool, hip and small intimate hotel, without breaking the bank. Location: Between crazy, fun Bourbon Street and artful, sophisticated Royal Street. Perfect for those who are like me, and like a little of both. I loved how we could walk off Bourbon and sneak into our hip hotel, which almost seemed hidden in the street. It's like a secret. Rooms: I emailed a request a week before our stay for a room away from the elevators (which I read on here, how noisy it can be). They honored our request and our room was located in what seemed like a private hall which only consisted of a few rooms. It was perfect! The walls are thin, and we happened to have two very noisy neighbors, one partying until the wee morning hours, and another with the kid crying at night. Oh well, it is New Orleans, and not the hotel's fault. The room was what I expected. Very nice, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was small for two people, but it works. My only complaint here is although the modern shower design is cool, it was very difficult for me to shave my legs. Since there is such little room, no bar close to the water, or anything - yoga balancing skills are a must. Large TV, desk, chair, dresser, safe, bottled water . . .everything one needs. Kids: I was surprised to see kids here, not many, but a few. This hotel does not cater to kids, and honestly, if you have kids here . . .why? The pool is small, there is no restaurant - only a bar, and you get a free cocktail upon check in, this should be your clue. Pool: The lagoon type pool is small, intimate and great for a mid-day cool off while sipping a cocktail. My one complaint here is they need to keep the towel supply full. I had to ask for more towels and saw it empty on two occasions. Staff: Very friendly, and all went our of their way for any request. We were greeting every time we entered or left the hotel. Any questions were answered and they had no problem calling a taxi for us to the airport. Cleanliness: Clean, but not perfect. I felt the hotel could improve in this area. There was a dead roach in the courtyard that laid there for a bit. (yes, I do realize roaches are common and should be expected down South) The rooms were cleaned, but I also felt housekeeping could have made the bathrooms sparkle a bit more. For some reason our housekeeper never took our tip - very odd. Breakfast: No complaints on continental breakfast. The bacon was perfect. There was fruit, juices, some type of egg (scrambled or boiled) each day, bread, muffins, yogurt, cereal and coffee. You won't go away hungry. Bar: Very nice. Great for a cocktails while swimming, or nice to sit at before heading out for the evening, or returning from your night. Great music - young top 40's. Bartenders, like the rest of the staff are very nice and personable. Would I stay here again? Absolutely! This really is an excellent hotel at a great price. Thanks for the great stay and New Orleans experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TJQ01
Reviews.Content: The hotel, location and staff were all excellent. When you enter the hotel you find yourself in a modern and efficient lobby that is complemented with a comfortable courtyard, and an inviting bar. The rooms were spacious, clean and extremely comfortable. Complementary breakfast was a great way to start your day. Two items in the room I would change are (1)additional towel bars or hooks in the bathroom and (2) less firm pillows. The location was by far the most ideal, close to Bourbon street yet you were not disturbed by late night noise. Being centrally located allowed you to walk 15-20 minutes to most restaurants and activities. Everyone at Hotel le Marais works like a concierge, very helpful and providing local information. Elbert Pierre the concierge who checked my family in contributed greatly to our having a great time and our looking forward to a return trip. JC and Laurent at the VIVE bar were a wealth of local knowledge in addition to making a great Sazerac. Looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Le Marais”
Reviews.Author: Brigadoon68
Reviews.Content: Extremely nice hotel, with exceptionally helpful staff. We spend a week in Le Marais and enjoyed every minute. I can't describe what was better: the room with balcony, the breakfast, the pool, or the great cocktails in the lounge. Wonderful experience. Thank you Le Marais for making us want to come back to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Emilie G
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, clean, quiet despite the location and nicely decorated. The included wifi and breakfast are definitely a plus. My only negative comment is that the room is a bit small (we were 3 in a double bed room) as the pool is. Otherwise it was a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Camille H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend 2012. I think this hotel is a steal if you catch it on an off-season weekend when the prices are lower. In any event, the rooms were really comfortable, though slightly on the smaller side. We were on the courtyard side of the building, and you'd never know you were steps from the mayhem on Bourbon. The complimentary breakfast was great, and the welcome drinks were a nice touch. Love the courtyard and pool -- very upscale feeling, but cozy and completely non-pretentious. One downside to this being a boutique hotel: there's no housekeeping after midnight, so we had to walk down to get the extra towels the housekeeper never left. Also we had a hard time getting the shower gels refilled, and had to call to ask for this to be done. But otherwise the service was outstanding, especially Shawn at the front desk. I will definitely stay here again and recommend this place to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, safe, and decent rooms to sleep in.”
Reviews.Author: wynoami
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Marais makes a great effort to be a high-end boutique hotel but misses the mark a bit. Service is great, location is perfect (right in the center of the French Quarter on Conti & Bourbon), the building is secure and safe, and the rooms are mostly comfy, but the design lacks quality. The sliding bathroom door doesn't quite close all the way, there is little to no room for toiletries to be stored in the bathroom, 1 bathrobe, no in-room cooler or fridge, the toilet seat wouldn't stay up, and while the shower looks cool, there's no where to keep your stuff! The bed was soft and comfy though (most important). The free drink is a nice touch. You can use one voucher per person at any time during your stay. The courtyard looks great in the photos but no breeze gets in there, plenty of bugs at night, and the salt-water pool is warm when you want a cold dip and looks more like a swamp than a refreshing oasis. Overall, I don't regret staying at Le Marais but when I return to NOLA I will rest my head elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlcg
Reviews.Content: The location: This hotel was the perfect place for our family of 7. We stayed for 5 nights and never ran out of things to do in the area. Within a 15 minute walk from the hotel, you can get to any part of the French Quarter. The Canal streetcar and St. Charles streetcar are only a couple minutes away ($1.25 per ride or $3 for an unlimited use day pass on New Orleans public transit system) if you want to explore outside of the French Quarter. The rooms: I think many of the other reviews provide good detail on the rooms. On the advice of others from this website, we asked for a courtyard room away from the elevators, and we were not disappointed. We were very pleased with our room (on the 5th floor). Briefly, the rooms are clean, cozy, modern, and while they are on the small side, they are nicely appointed. We were 2 adults and a child in our room and with bathing suits and towels - there just weren't enough hooks. Because of this, we found ourselves leaving our towels in the tub when they really didn't need to be replaced - we just didn't have anywhere to hang them to dry to use again the next day. Extra hooks would help tremendously. Room service was great... press the green button by the light switch when you are leaving and by the time you get back, the room has been made up. (Thanks Maria for such great service). The swimming pool and courtyard: There is a beautiful and quaint courtyard off the lobby/bar area. It was a great location for the complementary breakfast and for relaxing after a long day of walking. The pool is warm and partially shaded. It's on the small side (about 12' by 20') and about 4' deep. The seating bench makes it a bit like a hot tub or warming pool. We used the pool at least twice a day. Towels are provided poolside. If/when they run out of towels, you just have to ask the front desk and they'll quickly get more. The Vive bar: The welcome drinks were a nice added touch the first night; we made a habit of returning to the Vive bar for happy hour (5-7 pm) each evening before we headed out for dinner. Recommendations for restaurants and jazz clubs from Lauren and JT at the Vive bar and Pierre at the front desk were very helpful. All of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. In the mornings, a complementary breakfast is served in the bar area. It's a simple breakfast that includes an assortment of cereals, breads, muffins, juices, jams, etc. There are several coffees and teas to choose from. There was also a hot tray of bacon and sausages and a tray of cold hard-boiled-eggs. The breakfast staff (Amanda and others) quickly replaced items that were running low and cleared tables promptly. One thing that bothered me about the breakfast though was the amount of waste it generated that could have been recycled (e.g. single-serve jam jars, cereal boxes, juice bottles). Also a microwave in the breakfast area would be a nice added touch. Thoughts on traveling with kids: This hotel is best suited to couples and friends traveling together. We were a group of 6 adults and a 5-year old. The pool was entertaining enough for our son, but this is not a hotel that caters to families with kids. We ran into only one other child at the hotel during our 5-day stay. Never-the-less, the staff were all very friendly, kind, and welcoming to our son and we heard no complaints from anyone (guest or staff) about having him at the hotel with us. Thoughts on traveling with a larger group: We were a group of 7 occupying 3 rooms at the hotel. The hotel did a great job at accommodating our room requests and with providing us with recommendations on what we could do in New Orleans. Finding an inexpensive way to get to the hotel was a challenge. Taxis cost $14 per person each way. The airport shuttle was even more. For groups of 6 or more, we found out at the airport that a limo was the least expensive way to go and we could all travel as a group. Car rentals are very expensive for large vehicles and parking is expensive - we made out just fine without a vehicle in the French Quarter. Most restaurants (I think ALL that we visited) automatically add a tip of 18% or 20% for groups of more than 5 or 6; this is ok if the service is good, but frustrating when it isn't. Overall: The points I've raised here are mostly for information... any negatives were very minor and didn't sway our overall opinion of the hotel. We'd highly recommend this hotel and if we return to New Orleans, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ChatraKAT
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel! We spent time in the heated salt water pool with our three year old. The breakfast was more than we expected! Very relaxing. It's not really a kid friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: jamesjen25
Reviews.Content: The hotel was less than a two minute walk from the center of Bourbon street madness, yet we did not hear any noise coming from the crowd. Our room by the street had some traffic noise, but that would probably be consistent with any other hotel in the French Quarter. Tons of lovely shops, food and drink places nearby, and a five minute walk to the Charles Street Streetcar. The rooms, albeit small, were clean and modern, but also had the lovely laid back Nawlins' charm. Bathroom was small as well, but not cramped. The hotel was definitely good value for money, and a great base for our trip. +++: Location: In my eyes, the location was perfect. It was an easy walk to almost everything we wanted, and in a beautiful part of the French Quarter. Close to entertainment venues, dining and drinking options, convenience stores, public transportation - basically everything a tourist needed. Rooms: Charming decor with comfortable double beds. In room amenities were perhaps a little lacking, but thoughtful. For example, they provided plastic cups in case we wanted to take a drink from our room out into the street, but they felt a little cheap. Bar / Service: The in-house bar was a good place for a get-the-night-started drink, especially since the hotel provided us each with a coupon for one standard drink. The bartender was friendly and mixed great drinks. Front desk and cleaning staff were courteous and congenial. ---: Minor cleanliness / renovation issues: During our stay, the hotel continued with their refurbishment. This was not a very major deal, just the sporadic "wet paint" sign, as well as the hallway smelling of paint for the whole day. Fortunately the smell did not seep into our room. Also, while the room was generally clean, there was a small live cockroach that scuttled across our floor, of which I promptly disposed of. This was the only bug in the room I found, but I was definitely more wary of the room's cleanliness after finding it. Room size and lack of curtains: Fairly small, but not cramped. Enough space for luggage and hanging up some clothes, but it was quite a cozy stay. Also, there are blinds, but not curtains, which means that natural flight will seep into the room once the sun rises. Probably was not the best for someone who was trying to sleep off a hangover. Bathroom shower: Zero water pressure from shower head, was basically like showering with a dripping faucet; became Infuriating after awhile.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant oasis, a hidden gem, great service, positive attitude from all staff”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan H
Reviews.Content: We agree with the reviews of the 2 entries for May 22/23. We stayed for 4 nights and could not fault any aspect of this great boutique hotel. We fully endorse it and recommend it 100%.

Reviews.Title: “A Breath Of Fresh Air!”
Reviews.Author: catz9886
Reviews.Content: It was so wonderful to stay in a modern, boutique hotel in New Orleans. Having traveled to the city for stays all of my life, small, contemporary and quiet is difficult to find. I absolutely love the vibe of the place. Everything is just right. Not too much, not too little. The bar and pool area create an intimate atmosphere. One that my husband and I really enjoyed. Just a small front desk with one very qualified individual to take perfect care of you. A standout among many! It was a very enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: expat4
Reviews.Content: Sadly, we were only booked for one night at Hotel Le Marais.... It is truly a haven of quiet in the middle of the french quarter. The rooms are beautifully appointed and just the perfect size. We had requested and received the rooms facing the interior/courtyard side. No noise from Bourbon Street which is just a half block away. The entire staff (sorry I forget your names!!) were excellent and most helpful from the front desk staff to housekeeping to the valet. We loved being able to sit out in the courtyard adjacent to the bar and have our drinks (2 complimentary vouchers/room!). Was also a nice touch to have complimentary water in the rooms as well. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone. Great value for the money....

Reviews.Title: “Cute Boutique Hotel w/ perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: cxb360
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay at Hotel Le Marais. I had a tough time finding a reasonabley priced hotel in the heart of the French Quarter. Most hotels seemed too over the top with the decor or almost too "romantic" in feel. I was looking for a nice hotel for my bachelorette party, and Hotel Le Marais was the perfect in mood & feel. The hotel is not that big, so it has a very boutique feel to it. The amenties are not over the top, but very nice-- which is perfect, given we were only there for a few days. There isn't a restaurant, so there's no room service, but they offer complimentary continental breakfast, which is lovely. Since you're in the heart of the French Quater-- you really don't miss the restauarant anyway. There are tons of places to eat-- just steps away from the hotel. The only bad thing I would say is that if there are people in the hallway-- you can absolutely hear their voices. I had tried to take a nap at some point, and had a tough time sleeping, since the people in the hallway were so loud. I don't thing it was entirely their voices-- it was a combination of the people in the hallway & the walls being a little to thin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Location”
Reviews.Author: CrystalRose54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and had a very nice vacation. The room although a little small for 3 people would have been adequate for 2. Pretty courtyard with small pool was a lovely back drop for cocktails and breakfast in the morning. It was a great location just seconds off Bourbon St but no noise so from that point of view couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the French quarter”
Reviews.Author: TWKT
Reviews.Content: The best thing for me was it's excellent location in the French quarter. Just round the corner from bustling bourbon st but yet quite. Very friendly and helpful staff and a satisfying breakfast all added to thecexperience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Nadine V
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel and truly enjoyed it. The hotel was very clean and the staff were excellent. Beautiful court yard very relaxing. I would highly recommend stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ira B
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during Jazz Fest with a group of friends. We were all in different parts of the hotel, on three different floors. My wife and I were in the back, on the courtyard, and were extremely happy with our clean, sun lit room and treed view. At the end of the hall, it was quiet and worth the walk "around the block" to the elevator. Other friends stayed on the street side at their preference, and were also pleased, but those near the elevator did experience more traffic noise. Service, cleanliness and friendly staff were beyohd reproach. All of us look forward to returning. The place is a find.

Reviews.Title: “Cute boutique hotel, but noisy hallways”
Reviews.Author: azgal_33
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night while on a business trip to New Orleans. The staff was curteous, the rooms were stylish and clean. My one complaint is that I heard EVERY noise from the hallway. This includes being woken up when they slipped the paper bill under my door early in the morning. I am not typically a light sleeper so I found this to be unusual. I really want to like this hotel and stay here again, but am torn because of the noise issues.

Reviews.Title: “Sets the standard”
Reviews.Author: Michelle D
Reviews.Content: This was the cleanest hotel I've ever been in! The staff was very attentive and friendly. Our room overlooked the courtyard and was very quiet. This hotel is in the perfect location - we could walk everywhere - Jackson Square, Royal Street, Canal Street, Bourbon Street as well as catch the streetcar to other areas of town like the Garden District. If we needed a cab, the hotel staff was very helpful in setting this up as well. There were plenty of restaurants within walking distance as well as stores and other attractions. Free water, breakfast, and wifi were an added bonus. The bar and pool area were nice areas to hang out/rest between stops. I would recommend this place to any of my friends or family who wished to visit New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hg67as
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with my wife and 5 year old daughter. Perfect location (though take your 5 year old down Royal St rather than Bourbon St and its strip-bars). Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Hotel is stylish and in good condition. Our room was quiet. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect haven near bustling Bourbon St”
Reviews.Author: Divehigirl
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our short stay in this newish boutique hotel and wish we could have stayed longer. The rooms, although not very large, are comfortable and nicely furnished. The quality of the beds and bedlinen was fantastic (like sleeping on a cloud, and I hadn't smoked anything!). Free wifi everywhere (a must nowadays), large-screen HD TV (unfortunately no programs in French - TV5 Monde is missing in the French Quarter, what a shame). The staff at reception were very friendly and helpful - we needed help with the safe which was blocked and someone knocked on our door 30 seconds after I called reception. The breakfast is fine, but not outstanding. Nice to be able to have it in the patio, though. The patio is a wonderful place to relax after visiting NOLA, it is nicely decorated, with a pool and fresh flowers everywhere. I will return to Le Marais at my next visit in the area. In the meanwhile, I hope French TV will be available, and also that the plastic glasses and cups in the rooms and bathroom will be replaced by real glasses and mugs (more ecofriendly).

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 3 nights in New Orleans and stayed in this wonderful hotel. We donâ€™t need a lot of special attentionâ€¦.just enjoy it when a hotel is scrupulously clean and managed by well-trained staffers. Le Marais did not disappoint. The bed was very comfortable and dressed with snow-white linens. The continental breakfast was nice and the bacon was cooked perfectly. Now, for some folks, the way bacon is cooked may not be importantâ€¦.but it is for meâ€¦. as I routinely send it back to the kitchen in many restaurants. Because of the prime location, we walked everywhere we went and enjoyed seeing the French Quarter on foot. It was from the positive comments on Trip Advisor that convinced us to choose this hotel. Thank you, Le Marais, for making our 49th wedding anniversary celebration a great one!

Reviews.Title: “a nice french quarter hotel”
Reviews.Author: lisach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Le Marais with some friends prior to a conference that we were all attending. We were here for a total of 4 nights. None of us would describe ourselves as hard core french quarter partying types, but I definitely liked the vibe of this hotel -- a funky little place but also quiet and relaxing. Despite being just half a block away from Bourbon St, I never thought this place was loud or obnoxious. The staff were nice but I wouldn't say that anyone went out of their way to be super helpful. I did talk to them more than I expected because of the fact that my room key card stopped working literally every single day. They really should come up with a new system. The room was nice - a decent size with a truly great shower. I was disappointed that they didn't leave fresh new little bottles of shampoo/conditioner/etc every day. There were 3 of us staying in the room and we would have appreciated that. They did have free wifi, free water (only 2 bottles, would have been nice to have 3 given the 3 of us in the room), and an ok free breakfast. We also got one free drink per person which was a really nice touch. I definitely wouldn't mind staying at this hotel again, as it was pretty comfortable and nice with a not exorbitant price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms and great value.”
Reviews.Author: ohenryoh
Reviews.Content: I love NOLA! And this is my favorite place to stay. The staff are friendly and knowledgeable. The rooms are modern and nice. And the location is great. From now on this the only place for me.

Reviews.Title: “a bit mixed on this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: CavKA
Reviews.Content: I spent quite a bit of time researching hotels for a trip wtih a friend to NOLA. Now we had to limit our options as not all hotels have twin rooms (2 beds). We would have opted to stay elsewhere if this was not an issue. That said, le Marais had mostly good reviews and so we opted to stay there. So a few things that might help others. We had a room facing the main street; there was little to no street noise. There is some from the hallway and the room walls are thin. Still, I am a pretty light sleeper and with ear plugs, I was fine. The rooms themselves are fine in size. Two people could manage without feeling cramped. Usual amenities. There were quite a few notes about the shower and water spraying in to the bathroom. This is so not an issue. You just need to turn the shower head slightly away from the entry point and you will be fine. It is not a completely open space, it has a glass division, it just does not have a door that closes so where you enter and leave is open but really, with a bath mat in front of this and a slight turn, we had no issues. There is a safe, iron and ironing board and bottles of water they leave. There is free wifi that worked in the rooms and public areas. The breakfast in the morning is fine, not stellar but fine. Usually some bacon, with some form of eggs, then bagels or bread you can toast, cereals, yoghurt and coffees and juices. It is a self serve and you can eat in the bar area or outside. We did have drinks in the bar at night, bartender was nice (great music) and you can find a seat inside or out. The location is great. Very close to the French Quarter and if this is your first trip to NOLA, the FQ is not a bad choice. The hotel was far enough from Bourbon street (which really is just such a tourist, ugly trap) so you can enjoy being central but not that central. The only let down of the hotel was the front desk staff. They were indifferent at best. Upon check in and as well asking some advise, they were just not interested. There is no concierge so you rely on them and this is the main weakness of the hotel. For this reason and teh general warmth of the NOLA folks, I would stay elsehwere. As well, this is a trendy (attempting) hotel and when you are in NOLA, I think getting a taste of NOLA is better. This is not NYC, so why do a boutique, trendy hotel when in the heart of the south unless you prefer this. I think the next time, if I want this kind of hotel, I will try the International and if not, a bit of a larger B&B. I gave it 4 stars as the interior and location and upkeep are fine. But if I were to add it all up; it would really be more like a 3.5. Le Marais, if you want people coming back, do talk to your staff and let them know a little friendliness and advise would not hurt!

Reviews.Title: “a fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: G C
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and only good stuff to say about this small quiet gem just a block away from Bourbon Street. Clean, modern, comfortable rooms with coffee makers and complementary bottles of water. Really knowledgeable, friendly staff. Good breakfast which we ate in the quiet courtyard by the side of the pool. Loved it and will definitely come back here when in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Marais is a Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: TamsenTM
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with Husband and 2 kids for 4 nights. Staff, from front desk to bartenders/breakfast staff were professional and friendly. This is a good choice if you prefer a more modern atmosphere than a gildy/old school style. The bar and courtyard were funky and modern with nice plants and flowers, which our balcony room overlooked. I was annoyed that several disintegrating cocktail napkins remained in the pool for several days . . didn't make for an appealing swim in the pool. Breakfast was sufficient and it was nice to eat in the courtyard and talk with fellow guests. The location was great, close to everything but tucked on a side street. Rooms were modern and comfortable, though some of the furniture is showing some age/scratches and my comforter was stained. Our hair conditioner was not refilled and we never received a bath mat the last day, but otherwise the unseen cleaning staff did a fine job. We had no issue with the open shower design, maybe because the water pressure was almost non-existant. Besides the few small issues, we enjoyed our stay and would return . . we loved New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: qryche68
Reviews.Content: For some reason, I had never been to New Orleans before...and based partially on reviews through TripAdvisor I choose Le Marais for my visit. I was there on a Wednesday and Thursday night, so it wasn't exactly a packed French Quarter...although the Thursday was the start of the French Quarter Festival so the Thursday night crowd on the streets was noticeably larger. So I don't know if the quietness of the hotel was the result of having few neighbors on my floor or if the hotel is always that quiet. I wasn't keeping hours that would have had me crossing paths with too many others...so I don't know! Check-in was quick and flawless. I drove there and used the valet parking which was quick and easy. My room was overlooking the courtyard...very nice...and no noise from outside the hotel until garbage trucks/work trucks started on Conti Street in the morning...but not at a level that would wake you up. Everything was at a consistently high service-level, so there's nothing that stuck out....and in this case that's a good thing. The employees were great from the front desk to the valet to the bartender. Breakfast was good; they advertise a continental breakfast so I was suprised to see bacon and sausage available. Property was clean and well-maintained. Althoguh I didn't use it, the exercise room looked great...since few travel to NOLA to work out, I wonder how much the equipment actually gets used! And you're right in the middle of it all in the Quarter...easy walking distance to everything. I'll try not to wait as long to return...and I will return here!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel in the Quarter”
Reviews.Author: luv2travelwithpete
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at the larger hotels when traveling to New Orleans, but I'm glad they were all booked this time because I now have a new favorite. The location is PERFECT if you want to be in the Quarter. One block off Bourbon, and within walking distance of everything. They have a nice breakfast with a little of everything... yogurt, pastries, eggs. We used the gym, which had everything we needed. The rooms are clean and modern. I am pretty picky about hotel beds because I hate to leave my Tempur-Pedic, but found Le Marais' to be quite comfy. Oh, and the bar is great, too. I was on a girls' weekend trip, and we found ourselves there for afternoon cocktails often.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans Vacation”
Reviews.Author: joeysails
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was everything you see on the website. Comfortable, Clean, Modern with a Very Friendly Staff. Court Yard was a Big Plus. Worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: spiritedtravelers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a getaway weekend the end of January. New Orleans is one of our favorite cites, and having visited many times we've stayed at several hotels throughout the years, usually in or within walking distance of the Quarter. We tried Le Marias due to reviews on Trip Advisor, and were not disappointed. The hotel is in a fantastic location, between Bourbon and Royal, but very quiet. The staff were ultra helpful and the room clean and spacious for NOLA. The complimentary breakfast was very good with seating overlooking a beautiful courtyard. We will absolutely stay here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean & quiet.”
Reviews.Author: ljcalhoun
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so quiet, clean and modern. Just steps from Bourbon Street yet once you walk through the door you feel like you're miles away from the noise. Great Vive bar and courtyard with heated pool. The only hotel I will stay at again in Nola!

Reviews.Title: “All about location - this is a good one”
Reviews.Author: renosteve
Reviews.Content: We took over this hotel for the Final Four March 29-April 3 booking all of the rooms. This is a clean and well managed hotel. A room key is required to access the elevator or stairs, so it makes for a safe feeling. The lobby has flat screen tv's throughout and funky looking comfortable chairs to relax in. A small bar is just off the pool area and down from the exerciser room. Our room of 2 double beds was well acquainted with free bottle water each day and coffee packs for your in-room coffee. There is a good size safe in the closet and the shower, no tub - is large and offers easy access. Our room 311 didn't have a balcony but the room above and below did. So that would be room 211 and 411. There is a desk in the room to sit at and 3 drawers in the cabinet which the flat screen TV sat upon. The best feature of the hotel is the location. On Conti St between Bourbon and Royal is the ideal location for club hopping without the noise of Bourbon St bars. You are a 30 second walk to Bourbon St from the hotel. For the trolleys on Canal St you are a 6 minute walk away. Taxis are constant out front should you need to get across town. Jackson Square is a 12 minute walk away. Enjoy New Orleans wherever you stay. Fun city - cheap drinking and awesome foods.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location and Quiet too”
Reviews.Author: Alta_gal_12
Reviews.Content: This great little hotel is tucked away in the middle of the French Quarter yet the rooms are quiet and restful, even while the streets are loud and boisterous. It was featured in the Jan. 2012 Delta Airlines Sky Magazine and recently mentioned in the Air Tran magazine so the word may be out! This is a really pleasant place to base a New Orleans visit. The only tip I'd offer- the valet parks in the garage directly across the street from the hotel. Unless the sign on the lot says it's full, skip the valet and park the car yourself in that lot. If the sign says the lot is full, let the valet park the car in the lot (it's reserved for hotel guests).

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: drredpgh
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. There are Many pros and a few mild cons. The main advantage is locations. It's ideally located 1/2 block off bourbon and there is no street noise which is amazing. The courtyard and small pool were wonderful to relax in after long day. The rooms are nice but small. The walls are a little thin so if u are near the elevator beware. Also the thermostat clicked and woke us up when it came on which we thought strange. The continental breakfasts were substantial. Other than the few little things that disturbed the sleep at times, we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: komediankat
Reviews.Content: The location to Bourbon street was the best. Only a half a block away from all the fun but certainly quiet enough when you got back to your room at whatever time to sleep. The staff was helpful, polite and so friendly. Rooms were clean and very comfortable. We had a balcony room that overlooked the pool/courtyard which was so nice to open the doors and enjoy the beautiful weather. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel one block from Bourbon St”
Reviews.Author: papanew77363
Reviews.Content: Loved the location- next door to Oceana Grill and one block from Erin Rose. Close to my other favorites like Mr B's and Acme. The staff was uber friendly and the hotel was immaculate. Very intimate and comfy. Looks like i have a new favorite in the Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely French Quarter retreat”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlily3609
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel on St. Patricks Day. Our room with a small balcony was spacious and modern. The bathroom has limited space but uses it well. The staff was attentive and very helpful with restaurant suggestions and making reservations for us. We had on unruly neighbor in the middle of the night and the staff was quick to resolve the issue. There is a nice small bar which overlooks the patio area and small pool. We enjoyed the complimentary drinks (the pear violet martini was a treat) and the bartenders were enjoyable. The complimentary breakfast was great--good selection of hot and cold items, lots of juices, fresh fruit,etc. The hotel is just off Bourbon so you have access to that scene or can easily walk around it to the rest of the quarter. I would definitely stay at this little oasis again.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely first stay in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: irulanrae
Reviews.Content: I spend 3 wonderful days at Hotel Le Marais. The glowing reviews of this place are completely accurate. From this minute I walked into this hotel I was impressed. I arrived much earlier (7:30 am) than the scheduled check in time which is 3 pm. The front desk attendant was named Pierre and he was wonderful. They had a room available and he let me check in immediately. The room was pretty similar to the ones pictured on the website minus the decorative pillows and such. It was gorgeous. I did not get a room with a view but that wasn't much of a concern to me. This hotel is less than a block away from Bourbon Street. The perfect location. It was so close that we would go back and forth just to put things away or to use the restroom various times of the night. I did not hear any noise from Bourbon Street. A few other members commented on the shower. They are correct that it does not have a shower door but I just put a towel down and it was fine. The walls are thin but nothing that you can't ignore. The breakfast was great and had a variety of selections. The beds were very comfortable. Check out time is at noon and were expecting, like most hotels, to be able to leave around 1-2 pm. Well not so much. I assume this is due to the hotel being constantly booked. The front desk called a few minutes after 12 to see if we were ready to go. Once we got downstairs we realized there were 5 people waiting to check in. Our flight didn't leave until 9 pm and Pierre offered to hold our luggage and have a car ready for us when we returned. He kept his word. We returned to our hotel with our luggage and car ready. One thing to know is that this hotel charges an incidental fee of $50.00 per night when you check out. I got home and checked my account and noticed an additional $100.00 on my credit card. I called the hotel and they assured me the charge would drop off in a few days, which it did. I loved everything about this hotel and highly recommend it to anyone visiting NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay near Bourbon street”
Reviews.Author: natalie n
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights last month ... Steps away from bourbon street and a few blocks away from decatur street (cafe du monde and central grocery). Nice and professional front desk staff ... they gave me directions to the st charles street car and kept my luggage for a short while after we checked out ... We were given a room on the fifth floor which was perfect, the noise from bourbon street was undetectable, the two free drink tickets given during check in were used to obtain very tasty bloody marys... The room was clean and the beds comfy ... Overall a great experience, I would recommend this hotel to my friends and family ... You do need to valet your car and at 32 dollars a day its a little pricey but comparable to other parking options. The french quarter is better viewed walking and during the day I felt safe to explore the area.

Reviews.Title: “A special hotel in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: SFFranny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two kids, ages 11 and 16. This hotel was a great find--it's a little jewel in the heart of the French Quarter. Once you enter its doors, it is also a peaceful refuge from the excitement outside. The rooms are small but lovely, with super comfortable beds. We appreciated the drinks at check-in and the perfectly adequate continental breakfast, which included cold cereal, instant oatmeal and grits, hard boiled eggs, yogurts, fruit, bread and pastries. The real scene-stealer is the lovely modern and elegant courtyard patio and pool. The pool is small but it didn't stop our kids from swimming. And since this hotel is small itself (I think 64 rooms?), it never felt crowded. Lovely front desk staff. We would return to this hotel. Oh, one note about noise: we were on the Conti side and we could hear the Bourbon street partying at night. Two of us didn't notice the noise, the other two slept with earplugs (which we always travel with, since we are sensitive to sound). So know yourself, and if you think it might be a problem, ask for a courtyard facing room. Again, a great find and we recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here every Year for Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: tandyk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here every year for our anniversary. 7 years in a row so far. Great location if you want to be close to bourbon and the quarter. This hotel has small rooms but the most comfortable bed ever, wide screen TV, very cozy for 2! We stay in the King Suite. The Vive Bar is great. Alex is a great bartender. The court Yard is beautiful and comfortable, the breakfast isn't great but bacon, sausage, boiled eggs, bagels and fruit is plenty to get you going and free if you are on a budget! The coffee is delicious as well. We have yet to have a problem at this hotel. Ladies, you do need to know that there is no bath tub. Stand up shower ONLY so just keep that in mind. Doesn't bother me but just in case you prefer a bath over a shower. The restaurant right next door is WONDERFUL. Oceana Grill and Bar. This restaurant was featured on "hells kitchen" and obviously took all of Gorden Ramsey's chef advice because the food is outstanding. The Eggs Benedict and the crab cakes are a MUST HAVE! All in all, this Hotel is affordable for it's location and a very nice stay! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the updates and more!”
Reviews.Author: MomNOLA
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for some time now...... We stayed at this hotel when it was the St. Ann. WOW!! What an amazing transformation. The rooms are lovely and the comp breakfast was fabulous!! We were very pleased with everything- however..... we were near the only elevator in the hotel so it was a bit noisy, I normally think to ask for a room away from the elevators and I forgot. We also encountered some VERY rowdy people in the room next door . I finally called the front desk and security arrived within minutes. He also checked in with us and said he would monitor the situation to make sure things did not get loud again. This was very much appreciated and it did stay quite after that. I was very impressed with this and the rest of the customer service we encountered. We will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in the heart of the French Quarter. The location is great and close to all attractions and restaurants in the French Quarter. The hotel is very clean and boasts an array of amenities including bar, pool, fitness center and computers for guest use. Enjoy a drink in the elegant courtyard under the banana trees. Very relaxing. The rooms are a good size and have flat screen TV's. The room and bathroom are very clean and modern. The hotel offers a nice breakfast to get your day started. No need to run around the FQ looking for a breakfast site. The staff were all friendly, courteous and accomodating. This is my second visit to NO and my prior stay was at one of the major, established larger hotels in the FQ. I would rate this hotel on a par or even better than my earlier experience. You can't go wrong by staying at Hotel Le Marais.

Reviews.Title: “great location & wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Bluebird217
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 days here with friends for a get away and it was perfect. The hotel is in the middle of the French Quarter, but 1/2 block up from Bourbon St and built long ways into the block, with rooms facing an inward courtyard: the result is quiet and private. Take your bathing suit! The pool is small, but nearly hot tub temp and the private courtyard. Two nights we sat here with drinks and dangled our feet in after a long days of walking. The linens were great, large new TV's, every thing is spotless all the time. Every person in the hotel is professional, polite and friendly. I can't say enough about the hotel and the staff..... take a bow Le Marais, you've earned it!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rob Mossack
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel, right in the heart of the French Quarter. This place had everything we wanted, was in a ultra-convenient location, and is staffed by extremely friendly and helpful people. The room was ample-sized, and the bed was extremely comfortable. The warm, salt-water pool was great, especially right after a quick workout in the fitness room (had two-treadmills, an elliptical, and a bike, along with weights and workout balls). Yes, the doors were a little thin when it came to noise, but not anything to keep you from staying here. And to boot, we had a room with a window facing Conti Street, and the noise over on Bourbon (only a half block away) was negligible. You're less than a ten minute walk from Jackson Square and the French Market, and only about five minutes from the stop for both the Canal St. and St. Charles St. streetcar lines. Ten minute walk to Harrah's, if that's your thing....and goodness sakes, there's plenty of selection as far as places to eat without having to walk two blocks! Hands down, Le Marais is the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: JorgeLD
Reviews.Content: We (wife+myself) liked the hotel very much. The location was perfect, between Bourbon and Royal streets. The hotel rooms where big enough, modern in style and almost silent from noises coming from the street life. Only two things to complain about. First our room was to close to the elevator doors and there was an annoying "clink-clank" sound everytime the doors opened (unconveniente during the night). My other complain is the pillows, they are tall/big and quite uncomfortable to me. If you like this kind of pillows nevermind this complain. We are overall satisfied, although the room did not come in cheap (usd 300+ per night...). Bottom line: I definitely recommend it, specially for its location and overall comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: bae1984
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here last week and loved it! The hotel staff (Shawn, Leila (sp?), Eugene and Christina) were all very, very polite and the room was definitely adequate for the two of us. The beds are super comfortable and my kiddo loved the big pillows! We enjoyed New Orleans so much we extended our three night stay to a four night stay! My only complaint is that the doors to the rooms are not as heavy duty as most hotel doors and they also close very loudly. Three out of the four nights we were there, our neighbors woke me up going in and out of their room, while also talking and laughing in the hallway...and it was always between 2 and 4 a.m.! People are ridiculously inconsiderate! Even with the noise, however, I still loved the hotel and am going back next week with a friend for another visit! Thanks for the wonderful stay, Hotel Le Marais!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wanted and more”
Reviews.Author: Linda C
Reviews.Content: First, you can't beat the location! The hotel is beautiful - we spent more time in the courtyard then we ever would have imagined. The pool is heated which makes for a great ending after a day of walking. The rooms are updated and nicely done, beds are comfy, wi-fi is complementary, and the staff friendly. The decor is fun! I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: TexasAG350
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel there was a mix up with our room rate, but the manager helped to secure our original rate. After this, he went out of his way to ensure our stay was perfect. The hotel is very clean, well maintained, and the balcony room was awesome. We liked that the hotel was not on Bourbon Street, but you could see still see enough of the action from the balcony. When you are trying to sleep a Bourbon balcony is not all it is cracked up to be :). They also provide a little breakfast in the a.m. We also enjoyed the calm, retro bar downstairs each night before we headed out. The bartenders were very helpful and friendly. We have suggested this hotel to all of our friends and family who travel to NOLA frequently. We will stay here from now on! Thanks for making this the best break ever. Now...back to reality :(

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and peaceful retreat in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Marie63_12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right off of Bourbon St. but the moment you walk in, you feel like you're in a different world. The lobby is beautiful and the view of the courtyard and saltwater pool is breathtaking. Our room was right on the street but it was incredibly quiet. We were located right outside the elevator and that got a bit noisy at times but not too bad. The bathroom is nice and modern, but too small for the belongings of 2 people. And having no shower door is messy and strange. The see-through bathroom door was fine for my husband and I, but would be a bit strange for other folks who arent so familiar with each other. All in all a wonderful hotel at an extremely reasonable rate. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rdmdld
Reviews.Content: Being our first trip to New Orleans, we wanted to get a feel for the French Quarter, so this hotel had an excellent location, just a half block from Bourbon Street and all of the other attractions in the "Quarter". It has the boutique feel and is recently updated. It's a comfortable size to relax around the lobby or pool and bar and avoid the big hotel style. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Our room was nicely decorated and reasonable size. We asked for and got a mini fridge at no extra cost. The breakfast is excellent and more than adequate to tie you over to mid afternoon. All in all a very good choice for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel with a lot of charm!”
Reviews.Author: crucker73
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I stayed at Hotel Le Marais for a girls trip and we were very pleased. The hotel is located a block from Bourbon Street, which allowed us to walk to everywhere we wanted to go. The hotel staff was pleasant and welcoming. When our check in was delayed, they provided us with extra drink coupons for the hotel bar Vive, which according to my girlfriend has the best margaritas in New Orleans! Rooms were not huge but, big enough. The only suggestion I could make would be to put a mini fridge in the rooms. Also, do not use the transportation service that they suggest in their booking confirmation email. They overcharged and will have you waiting at the airport for a hour!

Reviews.Title: “Great except the pillows”
Reviews.Author: Mackd11
Reviews.Content: Pillows were waaay too firm. We asked for softer ones and were told that all the pillows were the same. That's pretty lame considering even crap-hole hotels have some variation in pillow choices. The hard plump pillows made sleep extremely restless for my wife and I. We slept like crap and were exhausted and I developed pretty bad back pain. Other than this very fixable issue, hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Modern boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LisaScottsdale
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our fifth anniversary and to enjoy the French Quarter. This hotel is 1/2 block to Bourbon St., just off the beaten track to be quiet. It is close to everything within walking distance. Safe and clean. It is a little gem! Ask for a "courtyard" facing room, King bed. Very comfy bed and pillows! Best "Hurricane" drink found right at their bar. My only issue was a bump with our first night reservation being erased..we were accommodated well for that inconvenience. And the contemporary walk -in shower, with no closing door, sprayed water out onto the bathroom floor. Besides this the location and friendly staff make this a super place to stay right in the French Quarter. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: jwharper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Hotel Le Marais and had a GREAT stay. Here is what you need to know: Get a room that faces the courtyard. The hotel is a block from Burboun and if you face Conti street I would imagine you might hear a lot of noise. We had a room on the 4th floor facing the courtyard and heard NOTHING! it was amazingly quiet for being so close to all the action. Also, the internet is painfully slow. Breakfast is great- there are eggs and bacon as well as bagels/toast and cereal/fruit. I was very impressed with the free breakfast and is an absolute perk of staying there. the rooms could be cleaned better - but overall, I was very happy here and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent, the location was about as good as it gets and the staff was outstanding. We'll be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Updated small hotel in the heart of NO”
Reviews.Author: Calgirl3
Reviews.Content: My husband just spent three days in New Orleans, the week after Mardi Gras. We can highly recommend Hotel Le Marais, a small recently renovated hotel just off Bourbon Street. Our room was well appointed if a little small. Ditto for the bathroom. My only complaint is there wasn't a single towel rack in the small bathroom, but if you like to throw your towel on the floor, you don't need an excuse here! The bed, and especially the linens, were extremely comfortable and the ventilation was whisper quiet -- not something you find in every hotel. We were glad we had requested a room facing the lovely courtyard because it was peaceful. Said courtyard is also lovely, a nice place for the complimentary breakfast if you can snag the only table, or for an evening cocktail next to the in-house bar. We would definitely consider staying here again when we're next in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique, fantastic bar/patio/pool area!”
Reviews.Author: jPuffDaddy
Reviews.Content: It's such a simple touch but when a property gives me a free drink or wine tasting, it just sets a positive tone that's easy to maintain. Especially a unique property like this! Throw in a free breakfast and I'm yours! Perfect location near Bourbon street, the hotel is actually hard to see from the street - all the more surprising when you walk in and are greated by a mesmerizing flood of bright bluish-neon lighting that jump starts your senses. Grab a drink at the bar and head outside to the patio/pool area for an amazing setting with great seating options, including a romantic 2-person clam shell lounge. The pool is very warm so it's really a big hot tub - wonderful! Service was great, people are friendly - a complete package!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Courtney102
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay at Hotel Le Marais was enjoyable. If returning to New Orleans, I would book my room here without hesitation. I made my reservations directly with the hotel, who were pleasant and very helpful in finding me the best rate. The courteous service continued throughout the stay from checking-in, getting information, and with all members of the staff. Cleanliness was clearly a priority for the staff, which was certainly appreciated. One afternoon I returned to find they were vacuuming the front mat outside the hotel, which was just one example of their attention to detail. Everything was very modern, but also very comfortable. The outdoor courtyar was a great oasis in the afternoon. The location was very convenient for the conference I was attending, as well as sight-seeing and spending an evening on the town. Though I did not use the gym, it appeared to offer quite a range of new equipment. The business center was small in space, but I was usually the only person using it and I felt that it was well appointed. Within our group were four people with different priorities (convenient, comfortable, value, and cleanliness) and the Hotel Le Marais exceed all of our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Marais is the winner, HANDS DOWN!”
Reviews.Author: ampfrances
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing less than amazing. The staff was extremely courteous and helpful. They were fun and silly and always laughing when we would joke around with them. The bar was quite and a great place to meet others who were staying in the hotel or to meet up with friends before hitting Bourbon Street. That said, nothing could prepare us for the amazing outdoor heated salt water pool. No joke, we spent at least three hours in it every single night of the four nights we were there! The pool is absolutely what made this perfect. We had a bunch of friends staying at the Hilton, and they came over to our hotel every night because (A) our location was much better and (B) THE POOL! We were hooked. I think I'm still having withdrawals since we left! I read reviews that told us to request a room away from the elevator and facing the courtyard (and we received what we requested), but I don't see how any room in this hotel would have been a bad one. Price wise, we were debating between this hotel and the Ramada on Bourbon. My parents stayed there a few months before and really liked it. My husband and I are into supporting the local small businesses, so I took a chance that this boutique-style hotel would be better than the corporate-run Ramada, and boy were we right. The location was perfect, as was our hotel. And we didn't ever hear a peep of sound from Bourbon Street. Granted, we didn't get to our hotel until 3am at the earliest every night, but we had no problems sleeping in until noon the next day. This is the only place I'll stay from now on!!

Reviews.Title: “Wed'll be Back!”
Reviews.Author: S N
Reviews.Content: Outstandingly comfortable, well-located, beautiful hotel with marvelous service and great continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brendan B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Le Marais for Mardi Gras. I booked early and the prices here were fairly reasonable. The photos looked good, but I wasn't expecting much. The room was clean and modern, the complimentary breakfast was good, the hotel pool and bar were pretty nice. Best of all, the beds were fantastic. I was also surprised at how quiet the hotel was during Mardi Gras. At that time, only guests were allowed into the hotel and they kept a guard at the front door in the evenings. They also made me sign a conduct agreement when I checked in. Obviously, these steps were due to Mardi Gras. But after a day of partying, it was nice to be able to come back sleep undisturbed as late as necessary. It's at a great location in the French Quarter and would also be a great couples or family hotel. I would say that if you're going to Mardi Gras and want to go crazy at the hotel too, you'll want to find somewhere else, because they seem pretty strict about conduct. If you're going to Mardi Gras and don't have a problem partying literally anywhere else in the city then coming back to a quiet hotel, this place is for you. If I had to find something to complain about, I would say that maid service missed our room one day and the internet was pretty slow, but those are minor complaints and I'll be staying here on my next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but with Issues”
Reviews.Author: Medianas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three days during the end of Mardi Gras. The location is great with nice looking rooms and comfy beds. The continental breakfast is good. On the negative side .. When we checked in at 3PM we were told that the room wasn't ready. The told us it would be a couple of minutes. Those minutes turn out to be 75 min of waiting in the lobby. We had to ask them three times what was happening. We go the response "Its Mardi Gras". What Mardi Gras had to do with cleaning a room, I have no idea. The Room we got was on the fifth floor right across from the Elevator. The noise from the corridor was loud. It actually felt like people were standing right in the room. I had to check the door because I was sure I must have missed closing it. Make sure to bring earplugs if you don't wanna get disturb by people small talking. The Internet didn't work properly during the whole stay. We mentioned it a couple of times and they said they were on it but nothing happened. One of the reasons I booked this hotel was because of the free Wifi as I had work to do. I ended up going to Starbucks each day to send emails and do research. The Bathroom doesn't have shower curtain or door which makes the bathroom floor very wet. You need a lot of towels to soak it up. The last evening when we were packing I checked under the bed and found one used towel that wasn't ours and hamburger wrappers. That means that they haven't cleaned under the bed for at least thee days. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect choice!”
Reviews.Author: Vicki V
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. It was very clean. The rooms were large. We we very close to all of the action but without all of the noise and craziness of actually being on Bourbon Street. I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay in NOLA!”
Reviews.Author: MzHQuinn
Reviews.Content: When I originally booked a hotel in New Orleans for our trip, we were going to stay at the Chateau Bourbon but it is and will be under major renovations so I knew that wasn't going to work. I did some online searching and came across Hotel Le Marais. I emailed my travel agent and she canceled our reservations at the Chateau Bourbon and booked us a room at Hotel Le Marais. From the time our driver dropped us off I knew that I had made a great choice in changing hotels. The staff was extremely friendly when we checked in (and we didn't have to wait to check in as a room was ready for us) The Vive! Bar was a great place to grab a drink, and the bartenders were super friendly! The rooms didn't even feel like "hotel rooms", they were very clean and were very comfortable. The hotel provided 2 bottles of water each day (which came in very handy) and a continental breakfast each morning. The courtyard was so nice to just sit and relax by the heated saltwater pool!! The Hotel's location is GREAT you are steps from Bourbon Street, but you'd never know as it's very quiet in the hotel. Not only will I be returning to NOLA and staying at the Hotel Le Marais, but I'll recommend this hotel to anyone who is going!!! Thank you Hotel Le Marais for making our vacation extra special =)

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfy, and secure.”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: The location cannot be better. You can walk just about anywhere you would want and yet, once inside the hotel, you felt away from the hustle of nearby Bourban Street. And as we were there during the few days before Mardi Gras, the city was bustling! After the initial check in problem (our reservations had been cancelled and not by us!), we found the room to be small but sufficient and comfortable. And you have to use your room key to enter the elevator which I felt was a plus for security.The staff was very helpful overall - happy to hail us a cab when needed - but neglected to inform us of the available breakfast during our stay. I only found out as we were checking out. I would stay there again and that in itself is an endorsement.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Home away from home"”
Reviews.Author: Jamee S
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Le Marais. It is close to all the action, but not too close. J.T., Pierre and Christine all provided excellent customer service. The hotel was quiet and clean. Even though they don't have a restaurant attached to the hotel it didn't really take away from our experience. There are plenty of places to eat near by. The continental breakfast in the mornings was easy for those mornings we didn't feel like going out. We would definitely recommend Le Marais to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, New, New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: checkpointcheryl
Reviews.Content: We fled from our originally booked hotel, the Prince Conti - sounded good but what a dump! - to this place just down the street. Huge relief. Brand new renovation, hip, clean, comfortable. Room rate includes a nice breakfast buffet and delicious coffee, plus one free drink at the bar. The charming courtyard has a heated pool with a history - right after Katrina, the National Guard used the (old, since renovated) pool to get cleaned up. Prices are reasonable. Stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: wildkristin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what I was looking for our tenth anniversary. Quiet, clean, beds and bedding very comfortable, nice view of the courtyard, NO noise from pedestrian traffic, and perfect location to Bourbon Street. The bartender was right on with his recommendation for Oysters on the half shell at Felix's where the locals go. Valet service was very prompt and accomodating, secure parking lot. I would have given this five stars but my only complaint was that we did have to wait an hour after check-in time to get our room as there was not one ready. Three other customers were also waiting for their rooms. Since we were only in New Orleans for one night we were a bit frustrated with losing an hour of daylight for sightseeing. That being said I would highly recommend this hotel and certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Ani0707
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I, and another friend staed at Hotel Le Marais for 7 days in February. The hotel is great. It is new, clean and very comfortable. It is a great location - close enough but far enough from Bourbon Street, and close to walk to other tourist areas in the French district. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The daily breakfast is great. The pool is great too - heated if you would like to go swimming when not so hot. The bar tenders are also great - great cocktails and recommendations on where to eat etc.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location”
Reviews.Author: papaeConn
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of the French Qt, Clean rooms,Great Staff,Nice little Bar. And a good rate. Whats not to like!

Reviews.Title: “Aquarian Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Joanne M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for the perfect place to meet 3 of my siblings and their spouses to celebrate 4 birthdays to fall between 1/31 and 2/9. We found it in the Hotel Le Marais. The location could not have been better, so close to Bourbon St. but in the hotel you were in your own beautiful retreat. The courtyard with the heated salt water pool was heaven as well as the well stocked bar. I think the greatest part of this property though is the management and staff. They went out of their way to be sure we had everything we needed or wanted and were always ready with a suggestion when asked. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Gem”
Reviews.Author: willing292
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay in less than 8 months, and we are still in love with Le Marais. This hotel is clean, well maintained, has an excellent free breakfast, polite and helpful front desk clerks, incredible atmosphere, a superb location half way between Bourbon and Royal streets, and is a half a block from the FQ Police station. It's bar and courtyard with pool, are welcome refuges after walking our butts off all day. We will of course return here. I can't imagine staying any where else in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “A cool retreat in the heart of the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: gracienola
Reviews.Content: We are native New Orleanians and tried the Hotel Le Marais over the New Year's weekend in the Quarter. The hotel is charming, chic, quiet and luxurious, with marvelous views over the rooftops. The staff is attentive and the bar and pool retreats from the nearby hubbub of Bourbon Street. Steps to Antoine's, KPaul's, Royal Street Antiques and the Historic New Orleans Collection. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Super chic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: brckhse
Reviews.Content: Could not be a better location for French Quarter action...steps off Bourbon Street, but astonishingly quiet. Ultra cool atmosphere, modern decor, local art, serene saltwater heated pool in the courtyard. Top of the line comfort amenities: large thick towels and robes, luxurious bed linens, ostrich-leather chair and ottoman in my room, huge flat-screen TV. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Would ABSOLUTELY stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BPJP
Reviews.Content: Beautifully remodeled hotel in the perfect location. Very clean and very quiet - unbelieveable since it's only 1/2 block off Bourbon Street. The staff was excellent, the bar was a nice quiet retreat and the courtyard is charming. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem 1/2 block off Bourbon St”
Reviews.Author: sunbern52
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Trip Advisor and were completely surprised at our luck! Modern, elegant boutique hotel 1/2 block off Bourbon St. We got coupons for 2 free drinks when we checked in, and went to the elegant bar which had full glass windows facing the beautiful outdoor brick-walled courtyard. It had a small, beautiful Key West style pool, comfortable outdoor wicker seating areas, outdoor bar area, and lots of tropical foliage for shade. Our room was beautifully decorated, very comfortable beds, and modern Roman shower in bathroom. They also had valet parking which was necessary as there is is very limited parking in the city. Staff was friendly, accommodating and everything in this hotel looked clean, modern and new. You also needed your room key-card to enter the elevator which was very reassuring for security. Le Marais is an oasis of tranquility from the noise halfway down the block.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in the best location.....”
Reviews.Author: trvlbufElmhurst
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 amazing nights at Le Marais. The rooms have very comfortable beds, tea/coffee making facilities, complimentary wi-fi, nice toiletries and are very quiet! The hotel offers complimentary continental breakfast that included eggs, sausages, bacon, fruits, breads, muffins, juices, yogurt, oatmeal. More than expected of a continental breakfast. The staff is also very attentive. The hotel is half a block from Bourbon Street, close enough to the action but intimate and quiet. They have valet parking for a fee, which is the same in every hotel in the area. At least you are ensured a secure place for your car. They offer a complimentary bar drink upon registration. If you like bubbly, make sure to try the "Bubbly Vie". The heated, intimate pool was soothing and a great way to relax after touring the city. They have "ginger snaps" at the front desk, all day. My husband had quite a few. Higly recommend this hotel and would definitely return when in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect French Quarter Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Dennis P
Reviews.Content: Having arrived for business earlier in the week with accommodations at an iconic NOLA hotel, we were looking to stay an additional few non-business related days in the Quarter for a first time experience. However, knowing that staying in the Quarter on a budget can sometimes be a huge compremise; cleanliness, convenience, amenities, friendliness/professionalism of staff, and overall value were of utmost importance to us. Not to mention being able to access the madness called Burbon Street, yet retreat from the noise and mayhem when the desire to relax arose. Hotel Marais superseded all of our expectations and was the perfect French Quarter retreat. The contemporary yet comfortable decor is fresh and inviting. The room size is what is typically expected in a dense urban setting but, was nicely appointed with a quality king size mattress, decent lighting, large flat screen television--cant recall if i ever turned it on though--an iPod docking station, proper storage, desk space and casual sitting area. The bath while a bit tight with dropped ceilings could be challenging for taller individuals but, was also nicely appointed with modern and functional fixtures--I wouldn't mind that shower at home! The sleek lounge/bar and quality of drinks served were fantastic--not to mention our stay included a complimentary round of drinks of choice, and we decided on top shelf libations. The private inner courtyard was perfect for enjoying the hearty complimentary continental breakfast outdoors--my only wish would have been to have a bolder and richer coffee brew. The staff were most accommodating, friendly, and professional. The front desk staffing were knowledgable of the area and offered great suggestions for music venues on Frenchman Street, as well as area restaurant suggestions. They were even so kind as to store our rented bicycles on short notice--the bikes we rented from American Bicycle Rental Co just a few blocks away were a fantastic addition to the stay and made getting around the Quarter simple and entertaining! Hotel Marais is a definite recommend even for the most discerning. We are looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great NO experience”
Reviews.Author: simoniSimoni
Reviews.Content: We went to NO with three other couples to celebrate a big birthday. Our friends stayed at other hotels. Our place was always the meeting place due to its central location, great bar and courtyard. We loved the hotel. It was very quiet yet right around the corner from Bourbon st. The service was top notch and the breakfast just right. We will stay her the next time we are in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Experience”
Reviews.Author: starrgirl52
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a fabulous stay at Hotel Le Marais. The decor was impeccable, the room was small, however the space was smartly used. The complimentary continental breakfast had an array of items to choose from , eggs, bacon, sausage, english muffins, bagels, five different cereals, fruit, and a variety of hot and cold beverages. Housekeeping did a fabulous job of keeping our room immaculate on a daily basis. The front desk staff were courteous& helpful to every guest, and to non guests who stopped in looking for information. Each morning all staff greeted us with a " Good Morning, Have a Nice Day". The hotel is in a great location between Bourbon & Royal St., you are close to all the action without all the noise. I have stayed at quite a few 5 star hotels and definitely feel the Le Marais surpassed them in customer service, the warmth and friendliness of the Le Marais staff should be mirrored by other hotels. I look forward to my next visit to New Orleans and you can be assured Hotel Le Marais will be my choice. Karen S

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location!”
Reviews.Author: kloMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the week of Jan.14th thru 20th, was very happy with the rooms big comfortable beds with white comforters very clean. Just around the corner from Bourbon St. yet couldn't even hear any noise while we were in our room. The Hotel itself was nicely decorated, nice bar which also had an included continental breakfast in the a.m. coffee, fruit, cold cereal, hot cereal several options for bread, bacon and sausage, hot eggs on the weekend but weekdays consisted of cold boiled eggs. Staff was very pleasant. We had a balcony room but they were very small with no chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Ann C
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while in town celebrating a friends birthday. The birthday girl stayed at a hotel that was further out. 4 us elected to stay in the French Quarter.
