Everyone that stopped by our hotel kept saying they should have stayed at Hotel Le Marais because of its ideal location right off of Bourbon street. Let me also add -- the pictures do this property no justice. This place is GORGEOUS. Last but definitely not least the staff rocked!!!! We even ran into a love couple that recently became engaged.....congrats to them!!!!!! I look forward to returning in the not too distant future!

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Celebration...Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LauraUSC
Reviews.Content: Best location in New Orleans...crawl back if you have too! Side street down from the Front Door on Bourbon...beautiful hotel...friendly, great staff...gave two very happy travelers comp drink coupons...lots and lots of breakfast with a variety...spent Dec 30 thru Jan 2...stayed in a second floor room overlooking the pool...french doors opened to balony...never shut them...even at night and the music drifted from Bourbon...made it all the better!! great courtyard/bar area...learned of hotel from Budget Travel magazine review which was totally on target...I always seek out "boutique" hotels and this one will not disappoint...absolutely no complaints...Perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Gem”
Reviews.Author: ScubaSherrill
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little (64 rooms) quaint hotel in the heart of the French Quarter, nestled between Bourbon and Royal Streets. There's no restaurant on site, but plenty of great restaurants located in the neighboring blocks, that finding someplace to eat is never a problem. Complimentary breakfast consisted of eggs, sausage, bacon, breads, cereals, fruit and coffee/tea/juice. Nice size rooms with a spacious bathroom. Very modern interior makes for a nice change of pace from the historic surroundings. Great hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be happier, but who is the absent "engineer"”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler805
Reviews.Content: Went for 4 days prior to cruise with 3 other couples. All ammenities are brand new, chic, clean, and very useful. The room we had was top floor under the HVAC system, and room "hummed". They moved us promptly to another room. Breakfast was huge - fresh fruit, juice, milk, yogurts, cereals, eggs (different kind daily), lean bacon - yum! It was in bar and very light to great back side yard...didn't use pool or spa, but looked inviting. Front staff were not real knowledgeable of area but tried to help - friendly. They could use a doorman - especially with luggage, but still easy to get in with no steps (thank goodness). The workout room was fabulous with lots of water, towels, fans - but they couldn't find the engineer to blow up the workout ball.... only downside of whole stay. They also had a great computer room that saved my day...no charge. Very inexpensive and very clean and nice. All 4 couples were greatful for for the wonderful experience ...also close to everything, yet quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Le Marais is just around the way(from fun!)”
Reviews.Author: Adam S
Reviews.Content: I believe a total of 66 rooms are in this "Boutique" style hotel....which is beautifully decorated/rennovated and located on Conti St in the midst of the French Quarter. You are a very quick stroll to all you would expect to visit in the quarter from Cafe du Monde, GREAT restaurants (we stayed on Christmas Day night so had to 'stroll' into what was open which happened to be Oceana Grill across the street and a few doors down (AWESOME by the way). I would knock on Le Marais by saying that it is $30 to valet park-I understand this but we were not advised up front. Also, they have no restaurant so don't expect anything beyond a Continental breakfast-but who cares about that Cafe du Monde is well within walking distance. I did like that they offer 1 complimentary bar drink per guest, no strings attached....but, DO tip your bartender! Le Marais has done a lot decoratively with the space they have. The room we stayed in was not large by any means, but was VERY comfortable, which a comfortable place to clean up and lay my head was all I really needed, right? They do have a nice HD Tv in room so you can relax and watch some shows, but WHY would you do this when the French quarter is open to you so close by. Will definitely return to this hotel when I stay again in New Orleans. Reasonably priced considering the location and basically covered all of my needs with a touch of class added in to the ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “Tania is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: MissyMa
Reviews.Content: The treatment we revived from Tania at the front desk was phenomenal. When we had an issue, she bent over backwards to accommodate us. Her warmth & care was exceptional. I would stay at this hotel again just to visit with her. She made our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great French Quarter hotel”
Reviews.Author: hitravbug11
Reviews.Content: My bestie and I stayed here over Memorial Day for a fun weekend in New Orleans. We love NOLA, we aren't really Bourbon people, but this hotel's location is great for where ever you want to go. It's in the heart of the French Quarter, making every place walkable, and say you want to go to Cochon or another local foodie haunt, you wan easily grab a cab. We both liked this place a lot and would go back any time. It has a stylish, contemporary feel, and it's actually quiet despite the location. And there is a pool, i fact, the outdoor pool area is really relaxing and pleasant. The only thing we would have changed from our last trip is to have more hours in the days.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated hotel in great NOLA location”
Reviews.Author: VZRivers
Reviews.Content: One can enjoy the sophistication of a sleek European boutique hotel in the heart of the French Quarter, and for a fraction of the price. Hotel Le Marais is small, friendly and professional with friendly prices as well. The location is perfect, the rooms are super quiet, and the overall experience will make you want to return for another stay. The private courtyard, small pool and chic lighting inside and out add to the cool ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “All round perfect!”
Reviews.Author: johnnylough
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel by looking at hotels on Trip Advisor and we were not dissappointed. 3 couples travelling together and we all loved it. The location in the French Quarter was excellent. We walked everywhere. The staff were great in assisting us with tours, where to eat, etc. The bar tender even warmed up our left over gumbo from our cooking class. The breakfast was excellent, cereal, eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, bagels, fruit, etc. Definitely would go there the next trip to New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Modern Comforts in the Heart of NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Ryan T
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in October 2011 during our wedding week, and we couldn't have asked for more! The stylish modern decor is unlike ANYTHING else in the downtown area (and I have seen quite a few hotels in New Orleans). Contemporary music and lighting welcomes you to the lobby. The bar (Vive!) is classy and chic, and the courtyard is great spot to have a few drinks. The pool is refurbished and heated, and well-maintained (we swam a bit every day). The rooms, though French Quarter sized, are well furnished, the flatscreen TV is large, and the beds are simply heavenly. Big props to the front desk, housekeeping staff, and to Michael DeZura (the GM) who took the time to greet guests as he walked through the lobby! Nice personal touch! The free breakfast was better than most, offering not just the usual dry goods, but eggs, bacon, and sausage as well! This was a great way to wake up after a night out on the town. Bottom line, look no further! This hotel is no poser, they are the real deal!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Heather D
Reviews.Content: Great experience at this Hotel! The rooms were true to the pictures on the website and I loved the modern decor/feel of the hotel. This hotel is a smaller, boutique type hotel and it met out needs in every way. The location was perfect for walking all around the french quarter as well as being close (but not too close) to the nightlife. The continental breakfast, while traditional, was above expectations and saved our money to spend towards our other meals. We enjoyed the bar which had delicious drinks as well as the courtyard area with the pool. Beds were super comfortable. Service was great and super helpful! I would definitely stay here again as well as recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel. LOVED the staff. Loved the location. Loved the room. Loved the courtyard. Loved everything. Rooms were well appointed, and quiet. As a virgo... I am a serious clean freak. This hotel was immaculately clean, the room, the lobby, the courtyard, and the pool. The place doesn't serve food except for free continental breakfast, but there is several places for food steps away from the front door. The Staff was so on the ball and polite, it was amazing. Especially after watching a friend deal with check in at her hotel the St. Marie and they were completely unorganized, and absolutely rude to everyone who was upset at the front desk because their rooms were all messed up. I watched for several hours in the lobby one incident after another. So I found even more appreciation for the great staff at the front desk at my hotel. The lobby was so incredibly cute. All colorful with blue, purple and pink lighting inside and outside. Let me just tell you how nice that is when you stumble into your hotel at 5am completely [--] faced. The cute bar was a good start for a start out drink, bartender was kewl and friendly just like everyone we encountered at the hotel. By far this will be where I stay every time I go back to New Orleans. I've stayed at the Marriott before but it doesn't have NOLA charm and it's on Canal so there's more walking, this time we wanted a hotel in the french quarter and we wanted something completely remodeled not some 200 year old hotel with thin walls and cockaroaches. This place was a beautiful boutique hotel that had great personality. Clean freaks, my gay boys, city slickers and snobs would love this place! PS Free Internet in the rooms is a definite plus!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good -with Room for Improvement”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler675
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the Thanksgiving holiday & overall had a good experience. I've vacationed in NOLA a dozen & a half times in the past 10 years, so I know a lot about the various hotel properties. This is a 66-room hotel, centrally located French Quarter that has undergone a major re-do within the last year. (I remember it as the St. Anne that went belly-up after Katrina). The bedrooms are small & the baths are even tinnier, but both have stylish appointments, considering the limited space they had to work with. The hotel has only 6 rooms that sport balconies, so good luck at trying to get one of these. The complimentary breakfast offered was adequate with the basics, plus eggs, bacon & sausage. Nice enclosed courtyard with a small heated saltwater pool, although I thought the weather too cool to use it, & lush, tropical landscaping. The hotel is immaculately clean, however the maid skipped me one day & I had to complain. The front desk instantaneously had my room attended to & couldn't have been more accommodating when any request was made. Only had a few issues with the hotel, as I'm a meticulous guest & want the most out of my vacation. 1) There's only one slow moving elevator in a 5-story building that's used for everything. 2) Plastics disposable cups are in the bathroom -very Holiday Inn Express, in an otherwise elevated atmosphere. 3) Lack of balconies, as mentioned above. 4) Bar supports need to be installed for safety in the showers, as the black marble tiles get slippery. 5) Lastly, the hotel facade is too modest & needs some pizzazz -to emphasize the "wow" that's going on inside. Would consider being a repeat guest, if the price was right (rooms tend to be pricey).

Reviews.Title: “The hotel shows what good taste and money can achieve.”
Reviews.Author: Loucie
Reviews.Content: A bright jewel small boutique hotel situated perfectly on a side street in the French Quarter. No street noise - just could hear a few doors closing inside. Good linens. Excellent breakfast served until 10:30, which suited us well as we are late risers. Room service is from a good restaurant next door. The patio is definitely New Orleans but with a bright, updated look - comfortable seats and small pool.. Newly renovated in 2010 for over $8 million, and it shows. Excellent, helpful staff. Small rooms; large TV's (42"). Would always stay there when in NO. We bought the POP package and it was absolutely a fantastic bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Classy and Near Everything!”
Reviews.Author: CamilleNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in hotels all around the Quarter in the past 10 years or so. This was by far the best. Le Marais is a small hotel, beautifully restored, quiet and classy, with a modern lobby furnished in great colors. Leave the street and you are in another world. The rooms are clean and comfortable, breakfast is included. It took them a few days to get the wifi working on the fifth floor, and that bothered me. In spite of that, they deserve 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tigerP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Le Marais for my association's board retreat, and was tremendously pleased with this hotel. It's location is ideal, as you can walk anywhere in the French Quarter. It's far enough off Bourbon Street that I couldn't hear any noise. The courtyard and pool area was relaxing. Each morning, the breakfast was ready early and had a good selection of continental items as well as a few proteins. Perfect start to the day each morning. When I come back to New Orleans, this hotel will be at the top of my list of places to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: leslieh33
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night visit to New Orleans with 2 other couples for our annual Holloween trip. We were moved to the le Marais because the St Louis, our usual hotel, is closed for renovation. We were concerned at first but ended up very pleased with this hotel. It was recently remodeled and the name was changed from the St. Anne. The addition of a free breakfast was great. All kinds of fruit and bagels and muffins, plus eggs and bacon and sausage. It was available for 3 hours, which was nice for our 3 couples because we do not always get up at the same time. The rooms were small but with great beds and flat screened T V s. We got help from the staff several times and they always were more than helpful. We also got a free drink when we checked in. We saved it for the last night and had a good visit with the bar tender. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crystal C
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week in New Orleans...this hotel was incredible. Clean, modern and quiet. Front desk staff were always friendly and helpful. Never a bad night sleep there! The breakfast was alot more than continental with eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, etc. Awesome hotel and would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great value ... but”
Reviews.Author: lucky4us
Reviews.Content: Great quiet â€˜off Bourbon Streetâ€™ location, rooms are modern and clean. The king bed was one of the best I have found in upscale hotels. The breakfast was above average for the continental breakfast that you are usually presented at other hotels. Hotel Le Marais Sales Management was very helpful and provided us a competitive group rate. On the downside, check your credit card when your vacation is over. Although the hotel practice is to present photo ID and credit card upon check-in, we found another room was billed to our credit card in addition to our own room. We called to have this resolved and hotel management advised they would not reverse the charge, we needed to contact the other party (someone who was also in our group of seven) to have them submit their credit card. We contacted our bank directly and they will resolve it for us. This should have never occurred with a photo ID and credit card required at check-in for each room. Hotel staff should not have assigned the charges arbitrarily to our credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara T
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying at this hidden gem. Perfect location near Bourbon and Royal. Very modern, updated and clean. After many stays in N.O. this is the quietest room we've ever stayed in! Within walking distance to all restaurants and Bourbon. Pierre, the desk assistant, was so helpful and kind. Eugene, the bellhop/all round guy was a delight. After staying at the old traditional hotels and realizing how noisy and dirty they are, this was a real find! The bed was super comfy. The free breakfast served by Ana was wonderful. The coffee is the best and real bacon! No bathtub but the shower was amazing! Don't be dismayed at long lines for well known restaurants. Even the smallest little cafe has the most amazing food! Try them. Pierre will give you the names of some. After a stroll and drinks on Bourbon you are only a half block away to your restful, quiet room at the Le Marais!! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Artis4good
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Marais on Conti Street is a beautiful haven in the midst of the French Quarter. It is quiet at night in spite of the noisy streets, and the accommodations are fabulous. I love the decor and the courtyard. Highly recommend. Not outrageously pricey either.

Reviews.Title: “The Place is Cool”
Reviews.Author: Harperworx
Reviews.Content: The Le Marais is a chic hotel with a cool color palette. The location is great the staff friendly and informative I definitely plan to stay at Le Marais the next time I'm in NOLA

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in French quarter”
Reviews.Author: brookdavis75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent three nights at the le marais and the following is the pros and cons Pros Great location in French quarter Very comfortable bed and linens Free continental breakfast Great bar area and outside patio with small pool Decor modern and chic Quiet considering in the French quarter Cons Small bathroom...as a female i need more space Terrible shower and it flooded all over the floor No restaurant No place to buy any drinks or snacks so you are forced to leave hotel No fridge so could not even chill water No ice machine so no chilling any drinks or making drinks Hotel bar does not open until 3 pm so no bloody Mary's or anything else until later

Reviews.Title: “Hard To Fault”
Reviews.Author: saxier1
Reviews.Content: Really nice new (refurbished) hotel a few steps away from Bourbon St. I doubt you could find a better location in NOLA than this place, it's clean,new, friendly and worth shopping around for good rates. The only negatives were: no in room safe in room 505, (we ended up with a safety deposit box instead), and a sometimes dodgy wireless internet connection, although this may have just been our room on the top floor. They were very friendly, hospitable and helpful, however, and the well appointed rooms were lovely to stay in, would highly recommend to anyone seeking very central comfortable and quiet accommodation whilst in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “So good we stayed another night!”
Reviews.Author: NOLARiverCItyCouple
Reviews.Content: The rooms are awesome, we were given free drinks at check in, the breakfast is yummy and the overall look of the hotel is simply stunning. The staff is helpfull and the parking was thirty dollars which is cheap for NOLA. The best part is that you step out of the hotel less than a block from Bourbon, in the Quarter with tons of things to do and see! We often stay at Hilton property's but we will make Hotel Le Marais first choice everytime! And they allowed us to check in almost two hours early!

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: montrealboomer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a group of girlfriends for four days and then was joined by my husband so he and I could stay an extra week, just the two of us. This hotel is perfectly located, close enough to Bourbon Street but far enough to not have the noise effect. The rooms are immaculate. The beds are comfortable, the linens excellent. I can not say enough about the hotel staff's attention to detail and helpfulness throughout our ten day stay. The courtyard is a beautiful place to chill at the end of an evening and we all made use of it regularly. The hotel arranged tours for us and made our entire stay terrific. As we sadly departed on that final day, the staff said they refused to say goodbye but instead would say "see you later" . They will definitely be seeing us again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: LizziesPal
Reviews.Content: Was a little concerned about staying in a boutique hotel near Bourbon Street; but could not have been happier with the choice! The hotel is right, and I mean RIGHT, at Bourbon Street and within close walking distance to almost any tourist site/event any one wants to see/do in New Orleans. Even being that close to Bourbon, the street noise was almost nonexistent inside the courtyard and rooms. The room and bathroom were small, but who spends that much time in a hotel room in New Orleans! The beds and bedding were to die for! Being on the top floor, we had to run the shower water quite a long time before hot water reached us; but the hottest water anyone could want finally did arrive! The staff was some of the friendliest and helpful I've ever experienced in my travels. Thank you "Pierre" for help at the front desk; and to "JT"... thanks for the great drinks and conversation. The continental breakfast... well, not sure what continent, but it was the largest spread of breakfast foods I've ever seen in a hotel!! We definitely enjoyed the courtyard and used it to the fullest! We were a group of 8, and did experience some minor problems; but all problems were immediately addressed by the hotel staff and quickly resolved. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the French Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Always my 1st Pick when visiting French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Nina M
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this hotel! Baron is the best from the front end staff. Our room is always spacious, clean, and towels for days. With all of the noise of Bourbon Street, turning the corner to Royale @ Conti just immediately put me into a state of relaxation at Le Marais. Its internal courtyard is quiet, private, and inviting. The salt water pool is great, and the gym is adequate if you eat too much gumbo and need to burn a little off. Will be in French Quarter again during Halloween 2011 and I'm already booked in my favorite room. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Krewezing
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel we reserved for our trip, but after a drink at the bar, we moved our belongings and checked into Hotel Le Marais! Fresh and bright and welcoming, we just had to experience a new hotel in the French Quarter. The location is unbeatable - walk out the door and a right takes you to Bourbon Street and a left takes you to Royal...The hotel has recently reopened and it's beautiful and no detail is too minor. The bar is small and intimate; the outdoor lounge/pool area is lovely and our room was top-notch. The bathrooms are small, but very tasteful and well-appointed (love the open ended shower!) and the rooms and bedding are sumptuous. No hesitation about recommending this new jewel in the Quarter!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: laurajean59
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. Staff were incredibly helpful and kind. Room was great. Location was excellent as it was our first time in New Orleans and we were able to do a great deal of exploring from there. Very close to Bourbon Street. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but”
Reviews.Author: SpankyFL
Reviews.Content: Overall it was great. Our room was a perfect size, except the bathroom which was one person and not well roomy. Our friends rooms was noticeable smaller even at the same price. I would overall rate it as a great location, nice room, but not a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovelyproperty, very quiet despite the location.”
Reviews.Author: lemons1
Reviews.Content: An oasis of cool on a terrilby hot spell even for New Orleans. Yes, parking is $30, but it's unlimited in-and-out and the garage is right across the street. Very quiet despite being a half-block over the increasingly noisy Bourbon Street. One of the two barmen was particularly good. A ho-hum breakfast buffet little different from a chain morel was one of the few reminders that this is actually a mid-range-priced hotel despite its chic decor. Excellent bed. The open shower (no tubs at this property) problem can be mitigated by putting a bath mat just outside the opening. (Got used to this in Europe.) About my only quibble is that there are no towel racks, just a double hook on the wall. A problem for 2 washcloths and 2 wet bathtowels plus a handtowel. And stop by the front desk for a ginger snap.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VC50
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is beautiful, staff is excellent. I got sick at 4:30am the young lady at the front desk was very kind and helpful. She went and got me a coke. The next day I slammed my finger in the door. I was helped instantly. My only worry is that they will be able to find the shoe I left under the bed. They also make the best Long Island Ice Tea. Overall everything was wonderful. I will be returning to this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Quiet”
Reviews.Author: ivonne713
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Le Marais on the recommendation of a business associate. I was in a regular King room. It was very comfy and the sheets and bed were great! The bathroom is small, but for one night it was perfect. The bar area was lively and the courtyard/pool area was lovely. The room came with continental breakfast that included eggs and bacon. I have no complaints. The room was very quiet. I was here for business, but I would recommend it for pleasure as well. It close to the corner of Conti and Royal...so it was convenient to all the great restaurants and action. It was so hot in New Orleans that the pool was warm. Valet parking was $30 per night. The front desk gave us 2 complimentary drinks tickets at check in to use in their bar. It was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location,Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SeymourMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Great location in the French quarter. Easy walking distance to most attractions. The room was spotless,quiet and comfortable. The staff we very good. Will stay in this hotel next time we are in New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Clean, fabulous location, good follow through from management”
Reviews.Author: T0r0nt0traveller
Reviews.Content: We were here for my husband's birthday last weekend. Great party city and a lot of fun. The location is ideal ... less than a block off Bourbon Street but far enough away that your sleep won't be disturbed. The rooms are very clean and brand new. All members of our party commented that the beds were very comfortable. Liked the bath products. The hotel is attractive and newly renovated with a nice courtyard for breakfast and drinks. The only problem we encountered was that the courtyard was closed for a few hours three of the four nights we were there for an event. Management quickly rectified the problem with free drink tickets and $20 off per room per night. That was a very fair solution. The staff was very professional and did what they could to make our stay enjoyable. We were upgraded to very nice courtyard view rooms, which we really appreciated. The only teensy snag, which was quickly corrected, was that we were charged for the room upgrade, which was free (we were staying four nights in three rooms, after all). I just printed off a copy of our reservation with the price and it was changed for us. Really appreciated the front desk staff co-ordinating tours for us. We went on an airboat bayou tour and a Katrina tour, both booked through the hotel. Both were great. The free breakfast was nothing special (like a grand buffet somewhere with smoked salmon and papaya slices or something) but good enough. There was eggs, bacon, yogurt, fruit and muffins, etc. in a serve-yourself situation. It closed around 11, which meant about 1/2 the people in my party missed it. Overall, great value (we paid about $100 per night), great location and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Addition to the Vieux Carre!”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: This would get a 5 rating from me except for one thing - the bathrooms and closets are rather small. This may be carping on my part, but otherwise it was a wonderful stay and value and I would definitely stay here again. Everything is new and fresh and works, especially the a/c, unlike most of the other hotels in the quarter. I do wish they would install room safes, but again, I'm carping. The location is great and the rooms are quiet as they face the lovely courtyard. The included breakfast is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Dion_C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the very heart of the French Quarter. It is new, clean, and has good facilities. WiFi, breakfast, and a very well equipped business centre was free (normally charged for at other hotels), so I felt like I had good value for money. The staff were friendly and helpful. As this hotel has only just opened, there were a few very small teething problems in the area of service, but I am sure this will be sorted out in no time. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, an Amazing French Quarter Gem and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Tim H
Reviews.Content: I wish I could go back to New Orleans soon, just to stay here again. Everything about our stay at this hotel went wonderfully! For this particular trip, I booked 3 rooms for a bachelor party. - Staff: The staff at the Le Marais did an awesome job of helping with everything from taxi reservations, room details, area information, and more. They were all very friendly and pleasant to work with. I had to change our reservation details several times, and the reservations folks were very understanding and accommodating. - Location: One of the primary reasons we stayed here was to be in the heart of the French Quarter, and not have to walk back to canal street at the end of the night. This place is in a perfect spot, central to everything. - Value: The price we paid per room ($161/night) was well worth it when you factor in everything you get with it. Free high speed internet, free bottled water, free REAL breakfast (delicious, eggs, bacon, ham, etc, etc), complimentary drinks when you check in. I was very impressed with all of this. - Condition: I am very picky about a hotel being in good condition, and this place was basically perfect. The hallways, the rooms, the common areas, how the hotel smells, the gym, EVERYTHING was like it was brand new. Fresh and clean. It has a nice modern vibe to it, with all of the nice luxury touches such as Grohe bathroom fixtures, premium bedding, boutique soaps and shampoo, etc. I would totally recommend this hotel to any of my friends and family, and definitely stay here again. It hits on all the right points, and is nice and clean, comfortable, and has a great blend of luxury and value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and authentic new orleans”
Reviews.Author: Prancer85
Reviews.Content: This place was great! We got there at 9:30am and they let us check in right away, eventhough check in time isn't till much later . Friendly staff, and pretty and clean room. Right off of Bourbon street , so it was walking distance to all the fun! Will deff stay here next time!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and charming”
Reviews.Author: Dybis
Reviews.Content: Beautiful modern but comfortable property. Great place to stay in the heart of the Fench Quarter but on a quiet street. Rooms were modern yet comfortable, fresh and all around a great place. Good staff, nice bar and pool area and a nice small breakfast to boot. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet and Solid Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SmilingTravelers325
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights Tues-Sat in June. Check-in took about 2 minutes, and front desk was very welcoming. The room was not huge, but just right. Room appointings were all very lovely, and bathroom was nice. Best part of the room: BED! SOOOO SUPER COMFY! I slept like a rock every night, although my husband said he heard partiers on the street below (we were on the 5th floor) on the wknd nights in the wee hours, but I didn't hear a thing. The front desk/concierge was always very nice and accommodating. My only recommendation for them is the learn more the 'local' places to make recommendations. But the hotel location was perfectly accessible to everything we did! Even when we were ready to avoid the bourbon street scene. The welcome cocktail was a very nice touch, and we found ourselves having drinks at the bar other nights as well. The continental b'fast was just right, although the 'hot' food (i.e., scrambled eggs) was put out only on weekends. we enjoyed our b'fast every morning outside in the courtyard, which was nice both morning and night. THe reason I only gave a 4 for cleanliness was as follows: When we arrived, the room was impeccable. However, over our 4 day stay we noted that they did not change our sheets (at least 3 of the nights anyways), and even made our bed with the newspaper tucked b/w the sheets that my husband had read that morning. they should have checked and thrown it out. Also, a coffee mug I had brought up from breakfast was left on the TV table for 2 nights! It was in plain sight--should have been taken away. Mostly, these are minor kinks that this new hotel should/can work out. Overall, it was a sweet and solid little hotel in the French Quarter, and we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Angered, dissatisfied with customer service, complete nightmare”
Reviews.Author: lcamel1
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for the hotel a few months in advance because I was attending a wedding in the french quarter. I called the hotel directly to reserve the room and reserved one of the non-refundable, advance purchase rooms. The week of the wedding came around and I received a phone call from the hotel 3 days before the wedding. I was told the hotel was overbooked and I was being sent to a hotel near the airport. If anyone has been to New Orleans, you know this is far and not a convenient location. I expressed my dissatisfaction and was told all that they could do is send me there or cancel my reservations. I even spoke to the manager at the time and was told there was nothing else that could be done. They proceeded to tell me that the city was booked and airport accommodations was all that was available for the weekend. I reluctantly canceled my reservations and panicked about finding a room for the weekend. Miraculously, I found an available room in the french quarter within 5 minutes of my search. If I was able to find a room, why wasn't the employee searching for accommodations able to find it. The room was located at the Sheraton so it wasn't an economy location. I am angered because I wasn't offered anything for the inconvenience nor the extra money I had to spend for a last minute available room. The customer service concerning this incident was very poor. I have read the recent reviews and would love to have a nice experience with the hotel. However, this one experience was a nightmare and I would hate for anyone else to have to go through. It may have been a computer glitch that caused the problem but management could have offered a little more for the trouble that they caused. If my room was booked around January, how did they decide who gets to stay in hotel and who gets kicked out. Overall, just a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true”
Reviews.Author: thorntca44
Reviews.Content: 3 couples - friends for 30+ years, vacationing together for the first time. The hotel was fabulous - the rooms were clean and the beds were incredibly comfortable. The pool area was lovely and a wonderful way to end the evening. The location - perfect walking distance to everything. The staff pleasant and professional. My husband and I had been to the French Quarter 15 years earlier and we begged our friends to share this experience with us. Thank you for making this a most memorable experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hnrgreen
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, literally steps from Bourbon street and a short walk to the French Quarter. The hotel staff went above and beyond to meet some special requests to make our stay incredible. The rooms were very clean, quiet and very comfortable. A complimentary drink card from the bar is given at arrival and breakfast is also included. We will definetly return to this hotel our next trip New Orleans because this is "THE" place to stay near the French Quarter. The hotel staff is exceptional and personable.

Reviews.Title: “We left our hearts on Conti Street...”
Reviews.Author: coronah
Reviews.Content: I booked our June 2011 stay at Hotel Le Marais back in January 2011 after finding an excellent deal on expedia.ca. Around Feb-Mar we started seeing some bad reviews show up saying people had been turned away after booking months in advance. Naturally I was completely freaked out by this - we'd been looking forward to our trip for so long and had saved up for it. Fortunately, we worried for nothing! I emailed (and tweeted) the hotel a few times prior to our trip and was assured we'd be fine. Still, I worried. We showed up at the hotel on Friday morning around 11am. There was a TINY snag when our friends got assigned an already occupied room (woops!) but other than that everything was wonderful. Our rooms were ready promptly, were clean and quiet and safe. This was our first time staying in the French Quarter (previously stayed in the CBD) and we worried it might be noisy but despite being right off of Bourbon Street, this hotel is super quiet! The hotel is newly renovated and is gorgeous in a modern boutique hotel style. Upon check-in you are given a coupon for a free drink at the hotel bar and all of the staff members are friendly and helpful. Pierre at the front desk was a big help to our group - offering restaurant suggestions and best taxi routes when we headed uptown. The beds are giant and super comfortable - I slept like the dead every night (although I may have had help from Pat O'Brian's hurricanes). You also get complimentary bottle of water in your room (hard to find hotels that don't charge you $8 a bottle these days!) and my husband and I even got a complimentary box of pralines in our room! THANK YOU Hotel staff! There is also a large flat screen tv (we hardly turned it on..hellooo, not on vacation to watch tv!) and an ipod dock in case you wanted to listen to some tunes while you get ready for the day. There is a jar of free ginger snap cookies at the front desk should you feel snacky while you wait for your taxi. The wifi in the hotel can be spotty at times but works well for the most part. We usually went out (or slept through) breakfast but we did eat at the hotel twice and I can say I haven't seen such a fantastic free breakfast spread at any hotel I have ever stayed at. Fresh fruit, Community brand coffee, yogurt, cereal, delicious crispy real bacon, sausage patties, all manner of breads and bagels and english muffins, scrambled eggs..EVERYTHING! All for free! We appreciated this very much on our check out day as we had to be at the airport early. The hotel also boasts a nice little quiet courtyard with pool. The courtyard is gorgeous but we did not use the pool as it was soooooo hot in New Orleans when we were there and the pool is a heated saltwater pool. Who cares though, we didn't come to New Orleans to swim! I bet that pool would be fantastic in Feb-March! The location is great as well, nestled just off of Bourbon street yet very very quiet. Since this was not our first time in New Orleans we did not go to Bourbon street but still found the location ideal for everything we wanted to see and do. All in all I would definitely stay at the Hotel Le Marais again and would recommend it to anyone. If we can get a good deal on expedia again we will be back sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel andwill stay again”
Reviews.Author: coultd
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location. Just around the corner from Bourbon Street but very quiet. Refurbshed beautifully and rooms lovely. Very good value and staff friendly. Right in middle of french quarter.Free continental breakfaxt and free internet. Would definately recommend and stay again on next visit to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Made a Solo Female Travler feel safe and comfortable... THANK YOU”
Reviews.Author: ElectricLollipop
Reviews.Content: I travelled by myself to New Orleans in Late March of 2011. It was my first time back in the city in about 10 years, and I did know what to expect. Hotel La Marais and all its staff made my stay a very comfortable one. By the time I arrived, the renovations mentioned in the other reviews were done, and the outdoor furniture in the courtyard arrived during my 6 night stay. The room was clean, airy, and comfortable. The only complain I had was that the window is bolted shut, so I can't let the warm spring breeze into my room. I had a lower level, courtyard facing room, but during the day, it was still bright, and even though by night there were music and the courtyard was lit, I never heard a thing. There is a small pool, but I imagine its more for socializing, rather then swimming. The courtyard is a fantastic place to wind down in the evening, and perhaps even socialize with other guests of the hotel. The location of the hotel is prime, and I could not have asked for better. I sincerely thank the staff for being friendly and discreet - this must be some of that Southern Hospitality people talk about!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: redhead13newyork
Reviews.Content: After reading several reviews indicating problems with reservations I was a bit concerned. However, a phone call to the hotel to confirm my reservation several weeks in advance made my concern go away. The location was awesome, the staff was friendly, helpful, and full of local knowledge. The bartenders were great. The hotel has a more modern feel. The rooms were small but clean!! I felt very secure.. Key card access to the elevator and the outside door for late night access. There was also a security guard in the lobby after 11. I've stayed in several hotels in the quarter and this was my favorite. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “All Good!”
Reviews.Author: ezevans
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Le Marias for Jazzfest, Apr 29 - June 5. What a lovely hotel. The remodeling reminds me of the boutique hotels in New York City as it leans toward more modern clean lines vs the ornate. My room had 2 double beds and although small was comfortable and no problems moving around. They did a very nice job using the space. The room was clean and the bed way too comfy. Given the hotel is about a quarter block from bourbon is was really pretty quiet. The staff was very pleasant and attentive. When I called down about a couple charges on my credit card that shouldn't have been there, they made the necessary phone calls and had everything resolved in 15 minutes! The continental breakfast is very simple but worked for me. Its in the bar area so if a mass group of folks came in for breakfast there wouldn't be places for folks to sit, but during my stay it wasn't a problem. Recommend enjoying your coffee and danish by the pool. Its tiny(you won't be doing laps) but nice if you want a dip and a very peacefil courtyard setting. I thought the workout room was adequate. Its small but it had a couple of aerobic machines, free weights and a nautilas set..you can certainly work up a sweat. I have a couple suggestions based on my stay. 1) Rooms with shutters over the windows should also have a curtain, shade or something to better block out the light. I couldn't really get the room dark and since most visiting are probably keeping late hours, that dark room is great for catching the late morning Zs. 2) The bathroom is cute but not user friendly if being shared. No shower curtain or door means no privacy and a lot of water gets out on the floor. Since its just a shower, a seat should be added.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely retreat in lively town”
Reviews.Author: maggie44113
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in New Orleans and we loved both the city and this hotel. The hotel has a lovely courtyard which was a quiet oasis off the bustling streets of the French Quarter. The rooms have all been newly appointed and offer clean, modern amenities. It is located between Bourbon and Royal streets near the beautiful grounds of the courthouse so it offers easy access to all sights, sounds and gastronomical adventures. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and comfortable modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: artslover
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located between Bourbon and Royal Street on Conti Street putting it in a very convenient location for most things a visitor would want to see and do. A New York Times review suggested it was noisy because of its proximity to Bourbon but we did not find this to be the case. Our room faced the courtyard which was very quiet. On night when Bourbon Street was in full blare, we sat in the courtyard and heard nothing but the voices of other hotel guests also enjoying the peace. The hotel was recently renovated to a modern style. It looks very clean with bright spots of colour and filled with contemporary furniture. Our room, a king with a balcony, was spacious and comfortable. The expected technological instruments -- flat screen tv, telephone, free wifi. I think there were movies available but we weren't looking for those. The bathroom was clean and reasonably roomy with a shower only and lots of towels and Avena amenities. The hotel does not have a restaurant but a decent continental breakfast is served in the bar area off the lobby and next to the courtyard. Afternoon drinks are also served in the bar where you can use the two complimentary drink tickets. The courtyard as mentioned already was a calm oasis with a small pool. Service was friendly and prompt. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel-look forward to returning”
Reviews.Author: bukowsical
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent stay at Hotel Le Marais. My room was beautifully furnished and very comfortable and the staff was friendly and accommodating. It was a delight to stay there and I'll look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Marty M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Marais is a splendid choice when visition New Orleans. Although quite small, the rooms are beautifully appointed. Staff is very friendly and helpful. 2 blocks from all the action, the hotel is quiet and secure. There is not much to see on the street side rooms so a courtyard view is beautiful and quiet. Nice continental breakfast in the morning until around 11 or so; bar opens at 3. You're in the middle of the action without the racket. Everything you could want to do in the French Quarter is a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible..................”
Reviews.Author: willing292
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on it's excellent reviews and prime location. WOW. We had the best time walking around the French Quarter, sampling the excellent food and drink. The pool and courtyard provided a great respite from the hustle and bustle of wining and dining. I love New Orleans and I love this hotel. We can hardly wait to return. Great FREE breakfast and super bar for a nightcap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamesb101
Reviews.Content: Our first time in NOLA.....My wife did extensive research on wher to stay and was excited about this Hotel...She was right....From meeting the person who she checked with on the stay several times to the other staff members...Everyone was very good....The court yard is paeceful and relaxing...The Hotel is well located in the middle of everything but is peacefull and quiet...We arrived on a early flight and where pleasently surprised that our rooms where ready....Our baggage was stored for several hours without problems due to our evening flight.....I hear the hotel was renoviated....They did a graet job except for one thing....There isn't a shower door .......That's it.... The balcony overlooking the courtyard was also a nice thing.... If you want to stay in a nice Hotel.... Don't miss this place... We're going back when return to New Orleans...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at the end of our three week trip”
Reviews.Author: Janeb
Reviews.Content: Eventually arrived in New Orleans at the end our three week trip and drove to the hotel. It wasn't a great start as we only had 20 minutes to get rid of our bags and drop our hire car off before being fined a day's extra hire, after checking-in asked the reception staff to store our bags and we'd be later to check-in to our room - but they insisted we had to put our bags in our room ourselves and wouldn't store them even for 20 minutes. We loved the location of the hotel, couldn't believe how close it was to the busiest most exciting part of town but also felt incredible quiet and peaceful! The room was lovely, looking over the pool and courtyard and other than very noisy neighbours in the room next door you couldn't hear a thing from the surrounding area. Breakfast was great and the courtyard was excellent for sitting out in either returning from our site-seeing or before going out at night. Although I didn't use the pool I was told the water was as warm as a bath. After our first encounter with the staff they were always courteous but I couldn't help feeling a little stiff and too formal. Everything else though was brilliant, we loved New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alfredale
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for about two weeks. The Hotel and its rooms were recently renovated and in excellent order. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Below are some of my observations about the hotel: - Just renovated. - Comfortable beds. Â  - Helpful and Â friendly staff. Â  - Nice continental breakfast. - Free bottle of water each day. Â  - Great location in the French Quarter - Quiet rooms. Â  - Good exercise room. - Nice courtyard with small swimming pool. Â  - Wifi is good in the lobby but spotty in the rooms. - Two complimentary drinks. Great hotel... highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Location---Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wstone60795
Reviews.Content: Super breakfast included in price.. Great convenient location.. Hotel was clean--service outstanding.. Maybe need a little help retreiving car

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for Jazz Fest”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveldiva
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat apprehensive when I saw this hotel is a 1/2 block off Boubon St. but not to worry-it's like miles away. We had a room in the back which was very quiet. I heard some say that rooms on the street were a little noisy, but nothing major. European breakfast was very good. Rooms were not huge, but very nicely furnished-very modern. The hotel has been open less than a year-so very new and quit contemporary-different for New Orleans. Bar was very nice. All staff was helpful. We've been to NO many times and would definitely stay here again. A little pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST location possible, steps from Bourbon St. yet a peaceful escape!”
Reviews.Author: IstasTim
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to New Orleans and booked everything on the internet. We were a bit nervous after reading reviews about overbooking, but our rooms were there waiting for us. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the owner even stopped by the bar to thank us for staying at his property. The breakfast offered made for a very pleasant start to our busy days, if they would add a boiled egg it would be perfect! We loved ending our day with a visit to the quiet courtyard, if we make it back to New Orleans this is where we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lydiafoster
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! Clearly they've done a lot of work since November 2010, as reviews dramatically improved after the remodel. The staff was so friendly, the common spaces are cute & hip, the free WiFi was a major perk, as was the location...right next to Bourbon St., but quiet enough to sleep through the night. And the beds--they could sell them to guests like the Westin does. That bed was so comfortable! The room wasn't huge, but who spends all their time in their hotel room? We really loved this place, it's cute back patio by the pool, the small bar inside that is open afternoons/evenings, and the great service. This is a real gem in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: TheDealSeekingDiva
Reviews.Content: Excellent all around! Highlights incl. superb location, super comfortable beds, FREE and tasty continental breakfast, great service, attractive decor, etc...I could keep going on and on! This is a great hotel!!!!!! I was a little apprehensive if we would have our room according to plan because of some of the reviews as of late. But have no fear all was WONDERFUL and PERFECT during my recent stay. I called the hotel a couple days ahead to verify my confirmation and that I would in fact have a room, particularly because of some of the reviews that I read that said there were overbooking issues. The hotel staff assured me that my room was secured for the weekend, even during the busy Jazz Fast Weekend! We arrived on Saturday morning all was great! We got our room and everything was perfect. AMAZINGLY comfortable beds, super clean room. The FREE continental breakfast at the hotel is awesome too! Who doesn't love a good continental breakfast and again it's FREE!!!! This hotel is located in the heart of it all! Even though you're only a block off of Bourbon St. it's a boutique hotel sanctuary! The evenings were quiet and it was very easy to get to sleep at night. And if you want to go out for a night on the town on Bourbon St. you're just steps away! It's amazing! Or escape to the beauty and art of Royal St. which is only a block away too. It's simply perfect! I can't imagine not staying here again! I've stayed at two other hotels in the French Quarter and this will now be my GO-TO spot!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Marais is a find!”
Reviews.Author: franklin2626
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marais for 6 nites on our yearly visit to NO. The hotel is totally redone - like new. The location can't be beat. Service was great. Rooms were fine and the price was very reasonable. .

Reviews.Title: “We were very happy with everything at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Lamsteropolis
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. Our rooms were fabulous and clean. The guys on front desk, especially Pierre and Baron were extremey helpful. Great continental breakfast. Excellent business Centre. We enjoyed the open courtyard in the evenings when we came in and the drinks were yummy. Try the Plum Martinis! Decor was very arty and tasteful. We went to the live jazz in the hotel across the street at night and it was very good. Bourbon Street was awful, but we still managed to find some little gems. Oceana Restaurant beside the hotel had some of the best food in town.

Reviews.Title: “A Celebration That Didnâ€™t Happen”
Reviews.Author: ldgertz
Reviews.Content: In January of this year my wife and I made reservations at The Hotel Le Marais in order to insure that we would have a nice place to stay for our 40th anniversary that we planned to celebrate in New Orleans. Expedia confirmed our reservations on two occasions prior to our April departure. On April 6, the night before we were to leave for New Orleans we received an email at 8:00pm (or flight was scheduled to leave at 8:00am the following morning). To quote the email, â€œ Unfortunately we are unable to accept your reservation for the Hotel Le Marais for your stay (which we had made and was confirmed 4 months prior) . However, the hotel has made alternate accommodations for you.â€� In a panic we researched the â€œalternate accommodations.â€� The â€œalternateâ€� hotel was 35 miles outside of New Orleans and had multiple reviews to the effect of â€œDonâ€™t stay here unless you like bed bugs, cockroaches, and drug deals in the parking lot.â€� After spending two hours on the phone with Expedia (which we will never use again) it became clear that there were no accommodations available at the last minute in New Orleans due to the popularity of the very festival that we had planned to attend. That ended our long awaited 40th anniversary celebration. In addition we lost our non-refundable $800.00 airfare. As a result I strongly suggest that if you are planning a trip to New Orleans, avoid The Hotel Le Marais (if you actually want to have a room when you arrive) and stay away from Expedia and hotels.com as they â€œhave no controlâ€� as to whether the hotel reservations that you made with them, and that they confirmed, will actually have a room available once you arrive â€“ or as in our case, hours before you leave for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Explanation but more over a really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonMidnight
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews before I chose to book this location, the first few were great and than came the bad reviews about overbooking. I contacted the hotel directly and asked if I was confirmed to which I was told yes, and I asked if all the reviews about overbookings were true. I believe the answer I was given was honest, which was, "we are aware of the reviews on trip advisor and we did have to walk people due to overbookings in March and early April. This was due to a computer glitch that we now have in order, and we are happy to report that for future dates there will not be this issue." I thought to myself that is all well and good, and I hoped it was true but I reserved relief for until we got there and were checked in. We arrived on a Friday and everything was in order, there were other people being checked in as well with no issues. The hotel was lovely, free breakfast, a great courtyard and a very nice staff. I would stay here in a heart beat. I believe that they have fixed whatever issue was occurring. This is just my two cents but my friends and I really liked this hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joelsu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located less than one block off of Bourbon St in the heart of the French Quarter. The service was outstanding and the accommodations were clean and comfortable. It was a pleasure to stop after a full day on the road, enjoy some hot food and relax. The courtyard was very nice and relaxing. Everyone from the front desk to the general manager made us feel welcomed and comfortable. Well done!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We were lucky...... YMMV”
Reviews.Author: hardcrab
Reviews.Content: After reading so many other reviews with others having booking problems with this hotel, we were getting pretty nervous about our reservations. We had reserved 2 rooms for 4 travelers (2 per room) for 4 nites back in January for a mid-April visit. We called the hotel directly a week before our trip, and were assured that all was well with our reservations. Then, with a few days to go and poor reviews due to overbooking still showing up on this site and others, we called "Bookit.com" to again confirm our reservations. Bookit had us wait on hold while they, in turn, called the hotel directly to confirm 2 rooms for 4 guests for 4 nites. Again, all was confirmed as planned. So.... when we got to the hotel, we were advised we had only 1 room reserved for 4 guests. No record of having 2 rooms. All of our printed confirmations listed, in big red letters, "MULTIPLE ROOM RESERVATION" and showed 2 rooms being booked (and pre-paid). After a pretty tense minute or two of checking, the front desk was able to find us an additional room. Whew. I don't know if we would have been so lucky had we not shown up early on a Thursday? My guess is arriving on a Friday or Saturday may have had the different result of being overbooked. All's well that ends well- We did enjoy the hotel, it's location and ammenities. The staff was very helpful as well. Nice little pool (didn't use, but pretty), nice breakfast, very friendly staff, very nice location, clean and safe. I do hope they can get their reservation problems in order- I'd like to stay there again, but at this point I'm not sure it's worth the stress and potential hassle of not knowing if you actually have a room until you get there. This would have put a damper on my vacation for sure. - At this point the reservation issue is still a gamble- I hope they resolve their issues quickly- things like this spread far and fast in the internet world, which is the first place people look for advice.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Book Here if You Actually Want a Vacation”
Reviews.Author: leslie011
Reviews.Content: We booked five nights ( for April 7â€”12) at this hotel in January. My credit card was charged immediately. We received a confirmation for the hotel stay by email upon booking and then two days prior to the trip. The night before we were to leave Los Angeles on an early morning flight we were shocked and disappointed to receive a notice that the hotel was over-booked and we were being "relocated" to another hotel. The other hotel was 25 miles outside New Orleans and had Tripadvisor comments such as "Danger-do not stay" and "Very dirty and many bugs." We called the hotel. The reservations person stated he had just been hired and did not know what to sayâ€”his supervisor would call back immediately. We never got that call. We spent most of the night trying to find another hotel in a city that was booked without any success. So we lost out on our vacation: lost plane tickets, baggage charges, and our time which had been taken off work for this long planned trip. We did not get to have our vacation because of the negligence of the personnel at Hotel Le Marais.

Reviews.Title: “Sold to the highest bidder”
Reviews.Author: PedroLpierre
Reviews.Content: Four couples made reservations three months in advance at Hotel Le Marais for the French Quarter Festival. The 2 couples who booked first got the best deals or so they thought. At 9:30 the night before an early morning departure, these 2 couples were informed that they had been rebooked at the "no tell motel" in a town outside of New Orleans! The 2 couples who made the later, but higher priced reservations were "rewarded" with their confirmed reservation. The explanation was simply "we're overbooked" and because of the festival there isn't a single room in New Orleans proper. Throught the late night efforts of an aggressive agent the 2 overbooked couples were placed at the Omni. The Omni was great. Hotel Le Marais is a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Too Bad, So Sad”
Reviews.Author: Br00kelynn
Reviews.Content: Well, we should have listened to the reviewers but we gave the Le Marais a chance. We were joking with each other on the cab ride to the hotel about getting our reservation messed up like we read on trip advisor. We had booked in December for our trip in April so we were pretty sure things would be OK. WRONG! They did not have the room we reserved. The staff was apologetic but it was of little consequence. They did put us in another room for the night and reduced the rate. However, we had to leave early the next morning for a tour so we had to repack everything and take our bags down to be held until the room we reserved was ready. When we got back from our tour at 2:00 pm out room was still not ready. The room was nice. The hotel is in a great location but lacks on amenities. It is small, there is no restaurant or food service on site and there are a lot of bugs that need to be worked out before we would stay there again. Not yet worth the expense. Too bad, so sad.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NOLAfan76
Reviews.Content: I'd read the horrible reviews about overbooking, etc., so I was a little worried as we headed to check in. But our room was in the system (though it wasn't ready, but we were there before 3 pm), and the front desk folks could not have been nicer. The room was fairly spacious, the amenities were great. It really felt more like a boutique hotel in Los Angeles than New Orleans -- except that the French Quarter was right outside the door. Our room faced the courtyard and was very quiet. The complimentary bottled water was a nice touch. The continental breakfast was nice -- didn't need to eat much since we were going to be stuffing ourselves much of the day. Our complaints were minor -- the bath mat disappeared after the second day and never returned. They ran out of bacon at breakfast, but it was almost cut-off time anyway. Cell reception in the room was spotty, but the free wi-fi worked fine. The staff was courteous and helpful, especially when it came to getting us a cab to the airport at the end of our stay. We really enjoyed it and would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Sort of Disappointing Experience, But Something Good Came Out of It”
Reviews.Author: travelcricket
Reviews.Content: I came in for a long weekend to one of my favorite cities ever! My friend booked a room for us through a 3rd party site and called the hotel to confirm that they had our reservation. I was traveling with a great friend of mine. It was her first experience in N.O.L.A. So I wanted to be a great host to her and show her why I love the N.O.L.A. so much. I have family from New Orleans that told me that the St. Ann Marie Antoinette had been renovated and changed to a different name. I had heard the new property was modern and a buzz was zipping around about how nice and cozy this boutique hotel was. I had to stay at the Hotel Le Marais. Upon arrival, we found out that we were bumped out of our room. In fact there were a few other guests experiencing the same problem. Being it was a busy time of the year, the management at the Hotel Le Marais sent a couple people to their sister property at the airport. We could have stayed at the Dauphine. Although it certainly was not my plan, I decided that the airport was 30 minutes away, not including traffic, and not near the Downtown, French Quarter/Bourbon Street areas. Unlike the others, I had an option. I have family that after Hurricane Katrina, relocated to Metairie, Mandeville and Gentilly right outside of New Orleans, and Thibodaux (near Baton Rouge) about an hour away from New Orleans. I decided to go and stay with family. I felt worse for the people who were in my same situation, but did not have anyone in town to stay with. My friend was so upset and I have to admit, I was disappointed too. I wanted to stay near all of the action, the restaurants and nightlife. Staying with family was not a horrible option, but not part of the original plan. I can not say much about the hotel, because I did not get to stay there, see the rooms or experience what it would be like as a guest. I will say that there was something good that came out of this. I had the chance to meet the front desk staff and I have to say that Tania and most importantly Daffne (who I think is the Reservations or Front Desk Manager). They were so apologetic and most of all very accommodating. Daffne actually asked that we 'give the Hotel Le Marais' another chance if we ever come back to New Orleans. She handled the situation so well, that I will take her up on that. I cannot speak for my friend, but I surely will give this hotel and 2nd chance. We had a great time in N.O.L.A. but were inconvenienced a bit driving back and forth. Most times, even stuck in traffic. I have to say that the Hotel Le Marais has the BEST location, and it is near everything!

Reviews.Title: “Always overbooked!!!”
Reviews.Author: skier0072
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 3 months ahead of time with a prepaid non refundable rate. I called the hotel to confirm my reservation due to numerous reviews of the hotel being overbooked, but they said my reservation was fine and that we had a room. The next day we got a call that we had been bumped from our room and that we would have to stay in a hotel 5 miles from burbon street that was only a 1.5 star hotel and cost less than half as much per night. We were also told that we would receive no refund for the price difference. Luckily hotels.com found us a hotel nearby that was equivalent. Hotels.com also told us that at least 15 other people were bumped the same weekend, so this appears to be a consistently severe issue at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: RinQ
Reviews.Content: Prior to getting into town, we had called to see if someone could help us get on a daytrip we were interested in.. pierre was more than accomodating! he not only booked it, he really checked into a variety of options for us! We were more than happy upon our arrival. We really were happy to use our free drink" vouchers we were given when we checked in. Everyone at the front desk was helpful to us, but Pierre really went that extra step. We had some wonderful meals while we were down in new orleans, and many of them were recommendations from Pierre, and the other staff. The rooms were very clean, and the beds were comfortable. It is very modern. There was a continental breakfast awaiting each morning. The pool was very nice, clean and heated. The location was amazing, only steps from all the action on Bourban St. You would not even know it though! Even sitting outside in the courtyard at night, it was very quiet, you would never even know!! It was very accessible to get around town from the location, and overall was a beautiful place with many perks. It was my second time in the city, and I would hands down recommend this place to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: desouc
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I got a great deal on this hotel as it just opened in November! Everything about our stay was fantastic. The rooms were clean and modern, big flatscreen tv, nice modern washroom, big comfy beds... The staff were great and very helpful at helping us get around and book a swamp tour & city bus tour. The location was steps away from Bourbon, but on a quieter street where you don't get as much of the crowds going by. I like this kind of "boutique" style hotel - it's not too big with only 5 floors and the staff actually remembers you since there aren't too many people there. Breakfast is included, and is minimal, but if you're okay with a toasted english muffin/cereal/muffins and coffee/juice, then you'll be fine. Otherwise, there are plenty of cafes around where you can get a nice warm beignet! There's a small "heated" pool outside in the cute courtyard that my friends and I took advantage of a couple of times... it's quite nice, warm and relaxing. The sun didn't really shine on us during the day though since the courtyard is between two tall walls of the building. But, the pool was just an added bonus, not a necessity for me!

Reviews.Title: “NO ROOM”
Reviews.Author: JDBell
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 months in advance . Had confirmation #'s from a third party( Book-It) that they had received from the hotel, but still no room the day we arrived. They did put us up in they're sister hotel Dauphine Orleans but not without problems with billing. At check out I was told everything was taking care of but when I checked my bank the next day I had been charged for the entire stay that had aready been paid from the third party. I will have to say Dauphine Orleans was very nice and the people very understanding and helpful. I would stay here again for sure. The other property(Hotel Le Marais) seems to be having this same problem of overbooking which tells me they are under poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room.”
Reviews.Author: jbsunlvr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel for four nights. We arrived at 3:00 P.M. checked in quickly but our room was not ready, they stored our luggage for us and advised it would be about an hour for the room. We ate and the room was ready upon our return. We were on the forth floor at the end off the hallway. The room was nice, bed comfortable,and there was a big TV. Our room was quiet but we were as far away from the elevator as you could get. There is just the one elevator and I'm impatient so I ended up taking the stairs most of the time. The wifi was a bit slow. The breakfast had enough selection that most people should be able to find something. We checked out and had some time before our flight out so they again stored our luggage for us. I liked the hotel but probably would stay some where else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Booked 2 1/2 months ahead of time, and got booted”
Reviews.Author: leiedtrout
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Le Marais 2 1/2 months before our trip through Hotels.com. Three days before we were to arrive, we received a call from Hotels.com telling us the Hotel Le Marais had "an inventory problem" and wanted to move us to the Crowne Plaza... at the airport. The airport is 20-30 minutes away from the French Quarter. Completely unacceptable. How are they booked up when we booked well in advance, and how is it they waited until the WEEK of our arrival date to bother to tell us, AFTER we received a confirmation of our impending stay a day before? Hotels.com had a lot of trouble finding us another room in the French Quarter as a result. Based on their obvious problem with overbooking, we won't plan on staying here ever, even if other reviews are so positive. If a hotel won't honor your PREPAID reservation, they're not worth booking. I'd hate to have arrived and been stuck with no hotel to go to!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Gem in the heart of the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BillsMaryland
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Le Marais hotel for Mardi Gras. The hotel is beautiful and great detail and thought went into the decorating of the property. While the hotel is located on Conti Street between Bourban and Royal it could not have been quieter. Once you enter through the front door you are in a quiet sanctuary. All the staff are wonderful. The staff appears have have great loyalty to the property and it shows from the front desk staff to the housekeeping personnel. Thanks Le Marais staff for making my stay so enjoyable. I can't wait to return to a first class property.

Reviews.Title: “They cancelled our reservation 3 days ahead”
Reviews.Author: NOLAlover045
Reviews.Content: I wish I could write an actual review of this hotel, because I was looking forward to staying there. However, they called three days before we were scheduled to arrive and told us that the hotel was overbooked and they had to cancel our reservation, even though I had reserved two months earlier. They offered to put us up at a sister hotel near the airport. Why go to New Orleans if you're going to stay at the airport. Just ridiculous. Luckily I was able to find another hotel in the Quarter on my own. Just completely unaccepatable. We will never stay at this hotel, even though we come to New Orleans frequently.

Reviews.Title: “Could be great, but needs a little more time to mature”
Reviews.Author: lofo16
Reviews.Content: Overall, in terms of quality, we were very happy with Hotel Le Marais. The hotel was very clean, very new, and very comfortable. However, we did have an experience that prevents us from giving the hotel 5 stars. The hotel was overbooked by the time we checked in and half of our party (of 7) had to stay at a hotel four blocks away, and while I give them the benefit of the doubt that it was because we booked on a travel site that oversold the hotel, there were a few details that should have prevented this from happening to our party. First, half of our party, including the one whose name the reservation was under, had spent the previous night at the hotel and informed them that they were there for BOTH room reservations. Next we had tried to check in 2 times prior to check in time, but both times were told that rooms were not yet available. When we finally did get to check in, two hours after check in time, we were told there were no rooms. Given that they CLEARLY had notice we were there, it was utterly frustrating that they didn't have a room for the rest of the group and we had to be split up. However, the hotel acknowledged that they should have reserved a room for us and ended up paying our cab fare to the new hotel (which was very nice) and comping us the one night's stay. Because the hotel was able to acknowledge their mistake and handle the situation very well, and because it was otherwise very nice, we do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience - great location and accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: SherryBaltimore
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a visit to NoLa, and a stay at Le Marais. We selected this hotel based on the reviews on this site, and would highly recommend it. It's in a great location for anyone who plans to spend a great deal of time in the French Quarter! Just off of Bourbon, Royal and the other streets where the 'action is' but amazingly quiet considering the craziness closeby. The room was great -- we had a room with a courtyard balcony. In addition, we enjoyed the free continental breakfast each morning and a free cocktail in their bar. Although on the more expensive side, overall we were very pleased that we chose the Le Marais!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the hotel”
Reviews.Author: foodiegal10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is awesome! It is half a block away from Bourbon street. We stayed there during the Mardi Gras weekend and it was so close to everything! When I checked in on Mar 2, the front desk associate, Shaun, informed me that no King rooms were available and the only room they could offer me was the room with 2 beds. It was not a problem since the room was a bit bigger (hopefully) and I have an extra bed to put my stuff on. The room was very clean and new. Internet was free and they had free breakfast every morning which is even better. All the staff was extrememly helpful with directions. I must commend their manager, Daffne, she was very helpful and she is always on top of things. I work at a hotel and managers don't usually work til 2am and come back at 6am! talk about hard working. Thank you Hotel Le Marais for making my trip to New orleans a great one :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, fantastic staff, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sbrbnsclite
