Reviews.Content: A group of us decided to spend our 30th birthdays in New Orleans and discussed different hotels back and forth for awhile before finding this one. Let me say, I am absolutely thrilled we found this place and cannot wait to go back. The location is absolutely amazing, perhaps a half block off of Bourbon and right in the middle of everything. The decor is very modern and everything was very clean and well kept. One thing I found odd was the pool area; the pool is very small, in a brick courtyard without a single lounge chair in site. That really didn't matter much, just found it strange. Also, I cannot say enough nice things about the staff at this hotel. My boyfriend and I had an unfortunate situation where the credit card we brought to hold to room had been compromised and shut down upon check in, so we were facing significant charges to use debit (charges that would be refunded within a week of checkout, but that was still money we couldn't use in New Orleans). The staff was so patient with us and when we got it all figured out, they provided us with a complimentary upgrade to make sure our trip didn't start off on a negative note. The room was great, beds were very comfortable and huge. Bathroom was great, shower was unique in that it had half of a glass partition, rather than a curtain, so it's almost fully exposed. My friends and I want to make this a yearly tradition and will most certainly return to this hotel. Went at the end of February, so we got the Mardis Gras experience without it actually being Mardis Gras- great time overall!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: peace_love_midwest
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Le Marais for three nights last week for our first trip to New Orleans. I had read multiple reviews here on Trip Advisor recommending the hotel and we were not at all disappointed. The hotel is located on Conti Street, only a half block from Bourbon and a few blocks from Jackson Square. Staying here puts you within reach of all the beautiful sights, sounds, smells (okay, some of the smells on Bourbon Street wouldn't exactly be described as beautiful, but they are part of the experience), and tastes of the French Quarter. The staff was incredibly welcoming, helpful, and friendly. Upon check-in we were told about the Continental Breakfast and the warm, saltwater pool in the courtyard. We were given two free tickets for drinks at the hotel bar--a very nice touch! I believe the hotel recently underwent a major renovation, and all of the hard work that was put into the project definitely shows. The lobby was clean, modern, and trendy (without being intimidating or obnoxious) and our room was equally impressive--clean, with modern decor & furnishings, a super-comfortable bed, and a flat screen tv. For our gadgets, there was an i-pod dock on the alarm clock and FREE Wi-Fi throughout the hotel (rare to be free, but definitely appreciated!) The bathroom was spotless. Our particular room on the third floor had a view of the beautiful courtyard and was amazingly quiet, even with the craziness of Bourbon Street being so close. The morning we checked out, the front desk arranged to have a cab waiting for us. We hated to leave at all but it was nice to not have to hail down a cab on the street. It might be of interest to note that there were no hidden costs or fees tacked on to our bill (as that does happen, unfortunately, at some hotels.) I think the Hotel Le Marais is an incredible value--the quality of the hotel, combined with the kind staff and great location will ensure that you have a great stay. We fell in love with New Orleans and its awesome people. We will be looking forward to coming back and staying at the Hotel Le Marais again!

Reviews.Title: “reservation meaningless”
Reviews.Author: mk2me
Reviews.Content: I booked our room on the hotel website on 12/5/11, then recommended to our friends who subsequently booked with the hotel website and got the same rate and same room type. This was for arrival on Sat, 2/19/11. On the Wednesday before we received a 2nd confirmation from the hotel. Late on Fri nite the hotel simply left a voicemail less than 24hrs prior to checkin advising they had overbooked by 40 rooms given a computer problem and we were in the lucky 20 who they have made alternative accommodations for the first nite. Our friends, who had booked after us, got no such voicemail. We all arrived together around 7pm and were anxious to get our rooms and enjoy the first parade which had already started. They checked in without issue. Then we were told that was the last room and we could go to the Bourbon Orleans for the same rate and then return the next day for the 2nd and 3rd nite. I asked how it was determined that our room was given up before someone who reserved after us. No good explanation was received. The Bourbon Orleans is a related property which I never would have chosen. They barely were able to get us a room since they were full too. We got a room on the top floor with no room number and it smelled horrible, was dirty and extremely dated, this after having to walk several blocks thru the crowds with our luggage. Hotel Le Marais eventually comped us that room, but only after my repeated complaints and insistence that they do so. Once back at Hotel Le Marais we enjoyed the brand new rooms which is why we reserved there. We received a standard room when I would have thought they would upgrade us for all of the inconvenience. The lesson is that a reservation means nothing with this hotel and they can put you on the street or at a far inferior property and feel no remorse for it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: canadian2011
Reviews.Content: We just got back - exiting before crazy mardi gras weekend. We have travelled a lot and like to check out the smaller hotels- bypassing the typical luxury chains. Everything was wonderful, from super fast check in, complimentary breakfast, fabulous king bed, location, friendly and courteous staff. How nice to be greeted with "welcome back" on our return to the hotel every day. Everything was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Kulemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with another couple for five nights the end of February for the Mardi Gras festivities and parades. The location was excellent, a mere 1/2 block off Bourbon Street, but the hotel itself was still quite and relaxing. The staff were wonderful and helpful, giving us tips where to eat and how to get around. Every day they were sure to ask how our day was and if we were enjoying ourselves, The hotel itself will be really nice when complete. The only thing lacking was the patio furniture which when it arrives will make the courtyard a wonderful place to relax with a cool drink after a long day of exploring. The salt water pool was a lovely treat, warm and relaxing. The rooms are small but well appointed and nicely decorated and like previous reviewers have said, the beds are soooo comfortable, we slept wonderfully! The bottles of water left in our room each day were really appreciated as were the two complementary drink tickets given when we arrived. The wifi signal was poor in our room, but excellent in the room across the hall, but free service never the less. Reception in the lobby of course was excellent. The continental breakfast was fine, breads, biscuits, fruit, yogurt, sausage rounds, great coffee, selections of juices, etc., enough to start us on our day. The value was for what we paid (we booked thru expedia) was excellent. We would definately like to come back to New Orleans and would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: jolewnick
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we were looking for. We traveled for the Carnival portion of Mardi Gras celebrations and we certainly hit the jackpot. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. The renovations that have been done to the hotel are beautiful, and the hotel location is supremely central. The continental breakfast was enough food and choices to go and start our day without worrying about paying for breakfast elsewhere. The pool is small but it has a nice bench in it to sit and soak with friends. On our last night we had a friend who traveled with us but needed to catch his flight very early (leaving the hotel by 4 am) and he asked the front desk to make sure he was up and ready. He wasnâ€™t answering his phone for his wake up call so they actually sent hotel security up to wake him up! Now THAT is service! An added note- can I just say that the beds are 100% hands down the most COMFORTABLE I have EVER slept in. All travelers in our group agreed! Given how nice the hotel was, the extra perks (actually has a courtyard and pool, you get free drink tickets at check in, continental breakfast), the location and friendly staff, this hotel definitely outweighs any in pricier ranges and even those that are less expensive. I also found this hotel's parking to be more reasonable than other hotels in the area. My husband and I have been to New Orleans several times each and stayed in different hotels, but this is going to be the one we go back to. Thank you Hotel Le Marais for a wonderful extended weekend!!

Reviews.Title: “good location, not quite ready yet”
Reviews.Author: msdrannie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for Valentine's day weekend... the pool was intermittently closed and I actually had to plug in the exercise equipment to use it. The maids took FOREVER to clean our rooms, and didn't leave enough towels or the touted robes. The front desk people were in general very helpful. The bar was fully stocked and the bartender made us our free welcome cocktail (which we actually got on the third day since the bar was closed when we arrived late the first night) with gusto. The pool area was quite nice and the water was delightfully warm once the pool did open. The elevator was VERY slow and since there is only one it seems like there were always people waiting or it was full and we had to wait for it to pass us and come back. They have electronic signs on each door to tell the maids "do not disturb" or please clean" and they actually rang the doorbell before they came in... The shower in our room was quite bizarre with no curtain, and the controls on the opposite side as the spout (about 12 feet away) although I can appreciate that they were trying to go for the modern aesthetic, I don't think it was very safe nor smart since water was EVERYWHERE and we were quite cold from the draft... The location was steps away from bourbon and very close to Jackson square but quiet enough that we slept like babies. The breakfast was fairly sparse and there were never enough places/coffee cups to go around. It was cereal, bagels, yogurt and the like... I do think that many of these issues are related to the fact that the hotel has recently opened... I would check to see more recent reviews to see if these issues get better...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Love HotelLe Marais and their staff”
Reviews.Author: Music124
Reviews.Content: I want to commend Hotel Le Marais on their hospitality, competence, reliability, efficiency and attentiveness regarding our hotel stay. From the beginning of our booking process earlier this year to the final checkout I have been very pleased with all stages and personnel. Shawn was excellent booking my room and giving me the room I requested. He was always cheerful and anxious to help The next day after we checked in, we overslept for breakfast and we came down to the front desk and explained that we have missed breakfast this morning and asked to the young lady who was working if we could get some fruit and yogurt. As fast as she could she ran to the kitchen and brought us oranges, apples, yogurt and amazingly she also included muffins, sausage patties with English muffins, milk and orange juice. Seriouslyâ€¦this is SERVICE!!! The type of service you donâ€™t find everywhere. She went above and beyond our expectations and if I remembered correctly her name was Daphneey. The room was clean and nice, with everything you could possibly need. The bar was awesome with candles lighting up in every table. Shawn and Alex at the bar were amazing. The heated outdoor pool was relaxing. My wife and I were really impressed with the overall appearance of the hotel, the staff and especially the comfort of the beds. Thank you Hotel Le Marais, your immediate staff, the front desk staff, to the housekeeping departmentâ€”each person made my wife and I feel welcomed, cared about and treated like a friend. We will definitely comeback again and again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, quiet place in the middle of French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: jaysavvy
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Marais was a great experience. As we approached along Conti Street and drove past Bourbon St and pulled over I thought for an instance that my wife had lost her mind. Literally 1/2 block for the center of drunkeness, I was sure our stay was going to be loud if not worse. I was completely wrong -- we were greeted by Pierre at the front desk, who got us into our room early, and answered every question. Pierre also let us know that for any reservation or travel needs he would take care of for us. We stopped briefly at our room which had modern amenities, yet maintained the quaintness of the original architecture rather well. We were in a perfect place logistically to travel all ends of the French Quarter, and visit all of the sights. Most important to me, was when we returned to the hotel, and the party hounds were still going on Bourbon St we couldn't hear a thing. Slept like a baby. Great, great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have hoped for in a hotel during our stay in New Orleans!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWoods
Reviews.Content: Being first time visitors to New Orleans, we did our research prior to our visit. During this research, we discovered Hotel le Marais and were delighted to find a newly remodeled property available right in the heart of the city. From our time of arrival to our time of departure, we were well pleased with our experience. The hotel is clean, nicely decorated, and quaintly sized in a convenient location near all highlights of the French Quarter. We found the staff to be welcoming, friendly, and helpful in every way. The room was well equipped with luxurious linens, a wonderfully comfortable bed, a desk work area, and a great large flat screen TV. It was truly a great place to retreat to at the end of a busy day for a peaceful night's sleep...all only a half a block away from Bourbon Street! Amenities included continental breakfast ( breads/pastries, cereals, fruit, sausage, coffee, and juices...just enough to tie you over before your next great New Orlean's meal), an amply equipped exercise room (Who needs to exercise when you should be out touring this great city by foot?), vouchers for free drinks at the hotel bar, bottled water in the room, spa quality shampoos/soaps, and a salt water pool in the brick courtyard. This hotel had everything you could need to be comfortable during your stay. With vacations being too few and far between and the option of only spending your money one time, Hotel le Marais was a great find for us. We had a great time and would certainly choose to stay here again if we visit New Orleans again in the future. It is truly a gem in the heart of New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel-only minor disappointments”
Reviews.Author: uniftbl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while visiting New Orleans for the first time. We stayed 3 nights and overall enjoyed our stay. Upon check in, we were not told about the continental breakfast, if the hot tub was working (as the Front Desk Manager reports in several of these reviews), we weren't informed about it. Surprisingly, I believe it was the front desk manager that checked us in, but didn't inform us of what the hotel had to offer. The courtyard was still closed and had plastic hanging over the doors. It still appears that the hotel is still going through the "renovation" stages. The front desk personnel (last name "Pierre") was very nice and helpful. He booked a city tour for us that was amazing. The bar area is very nice. Overall the hotel had very low lighting (burning candles everywhere) but was sheek, nice bathroom amenities, comfy beds and nice rooms. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Matt_W80
Reviews.Content: This hotel was less approximately one half block off of Bourbon Street and yet was quiet even on weekend nights. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the rooms were both clean and comfortable. I very much enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is non-existent at Hotel Le Marais”
Reviews.Author: swall27
Reviews.Content: We planned to stay at the Hotel La Marais for the Rock 'n Roll Marathon/Valentine's Day weekend. When were arrived at the hotel on Saturday (2/12/11) we (and a lobby full of a dozen angry patrons) were told that they had completely overbooked the hotel and no longer had rooms for any of us. We sat in the lobby for a little over an hour without any clarity on how the staff woud handle the situation. Repeated requests by those in the lobby to speak with management were declined. After much prodding we were moved to a nearby French Quarter hotel. After a long day of travel, missing our afternoon pre-race warm-up runs and fighting with the hotel staff all afternoon, we arrived at our new hotel which was small and filthy. Exhausted and hungry, we decided to leave the situation for the following day (after the race). Hotel staff had given me the general manager's t contact information and I sent a very civil email asking to arrange a time on Sunday to chat about being displaced. After finishing the marathon on Sunday, we called Hotel le Marais and let them know we would like to return there if they had a room for us - they had told us that we could spend our remaining two nights there when we left the day before. They said they'd have a room ready in about an hour (at 3pm). I asked if that was guaranteed. They said it was not - we would have to check at 3pm. We called at 3pm. They did not have a room for us, but might in another hour. At that point, having not received a reply from the manager and being given the run-around about getting a new room (and having spent the night in a filthy hotel), I called Orbitz's customer service (where I spent over an hour trying to see if they had any help to offer - they did not). Around five we called back to Hotel Le Marais - it was unclear whether they would have a room for us. So we went over to the hotel in person, and were finally given a room. I let the staff know that I'd still like to chat with the manager if possible (since the front desk staff had told us on Saturday that they were not able to offer anything in the form of reimbursement/compensation). They said he would be in on Monday morning and asked if I'd like to set a time for him to call me. We agreed on 11am. The next morning 11am came and went without hearing from the manager. I checked in multiple times and was told he was in meetings all day. The head of housekeeping informed me later in the day that he had actually been in earlier, but had not reached out to me. In the evening the front desk manager (who had not identified herself as someone who could solve problems on Saturday) asked me what we would like done to make this situation right. While I appreciated her effort, the time to ask that question was on Saturday, not Monday evening. I let her know that what I would like was 3 nights complementary (since that's how many we had paid for) in the future where I could come back and enjoy their hotel without disruption (having to be sent to a filthy hotel, be given the runaround with the staff, spend my Sunday waiting until I had a room to move in and trying to contact management that never showed up, etc.). She said this seemed like a reasonable request and would check with the manager. My wife sent a more extensive email to the general manager, with no response. Later that evening I received an email from the front desk saying they were "more than gladly" to offer me ONE complimentary night at Hotel Le Marais in the future. I'm unclear as to why I would come back to New Orleans for one night, or pay additional money to stay at a hotel where I have no confirmation of their desire to put customers first, or that a room woud even be there for us. Mistakes are made and I tried to offer a solution that would allow them to remedy those mistakes. After a future undisturbed stay (one with quality customer service), I would have been more than happy to come on here and given Hotel Le Marais 5 stars. To have spent time every day that I stayed in New Orleans reaching out to the hotel staff to rectify this situation was ridiculous to say the least. It's unfortunate because it's a beautiful hotel. But it's not a cheap place to stay and in the future I'd spend my money somewhere that actually has customer service. I spent my last minutes in New Orleans on Tuesday morning that day with the front desk staff - who had told me the manager was coming... waiting for a manager who never showed up (while making my cab to the airport wait). I've reached out to the hotel staff since returning home, again to no response. My wife and I love to travel, and neither of us have ever experienced such poor customer service at a hotel, particularly when the business is at fault. I'll be posting my experience to many other travel sites. We had a terrible experience and I absolutely do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: SKerwin
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I both graduated from college in Dec. '10 and to celebrate, we wanted to spend a week in our favorite place...New Orleans. When booking, we found the St. Marie Antoinette hotel. In the picture it looked a little old fashioned but was in our price range and in a great location just off of Bourbon and smack dab in the middle of the Quarter. When we arrived we were surprised to find that the St. Marie Antoinette had renovated just around the time we booked and was now called the Hotel le Marais. All we could say was.....wow! As soon as we walked in, it didn't look anything like the pictures but rather like a Las Vegas hotel! The decor was much newer and the lobby had beautiful black and white photos of bayous and forest vegetation found around New Orleans and southern Louisiana. We were immediately greeted by Pierre, the nicest, friendliest desk manager/concierge we've ever encountered at any hotel. We chatted about the weather (it was December after all...so while it was chilly, being from Wisconsin we were quite used to it, but not Pierre :) Once checked in we headed to our room to find the elevator and hallways incredibly clean (not the half clean/half smokey scent most hotels have). Once we hit our room we were again blown away. Remember how I mentioned Vegas? Well this was it! The room was gorgeous! Black marble stand-in shower with new fixtures, large black wooden headboard at the back of a huge and soft king bed, flat screen TV w/ cable, desks with lamps with AC outlets at the top (handy for pugging in phones, etc), new iPod clock radio (great for playing music when getting ready to hit the nightlife), a big red leather armchair, and wi-fi internet. Once all settled we would come and go as we pleased and were always greeted by friendly staff at the desk (at any hour) and were glad to see doormen/security at the door in the evenings (not they were needed, but a great piece of mind). Every morning we would see Pierre at the front desk and would chat about sights, drinks, and of course, restaurants. He always made us feel welcome in New Orleans (not like tourists) and recommended some great places (Dooky Chase's...amazing!) When it was time to leave Pierre made sure the afternoon desk manager new when we would check-out and when our flight was and had a cab waiting for us when it was time to go. We were incredibly sad to go but we will definitely be back...and when we do we will absolutely stay at the Hotel le Marais!

Reviews.Title: “Good place, Great location”
Reviews.Author: static1
Reviews.Content: I had one night in town and found the newly remodeled Le Marais on Hotwire for a decent price. There still seemed to be some renovations going on, but that did not affect my stay. Check-in was smooth and friendly, and they even gave me a free drink coupon for their lounge (which I lost). I found the rooms to be comfortable, clean, and quiet enough for New Orleans. The lobby has a hip, trendy setting, with electronic music playing and a martini lounge. The location is pretty cool, being right on Conti, 1/2 block from Bourbon (near Oceana and The Copper Monkey). I did not notice any extra street noise. Their business center was not set up at this point, but they did allow me to use their computer to print out my boarding pass. The only issue I had was an erroneous charge on my credit card that was reversed before I had a chance to call them. I'll be staying there again in a few weeks for our anniversary, so I'll see how things are second time around!

Reviews.Title: “Basically a Club Quarters-type place.. Good location, Not a lot else”
Reviews.Author: stonewall2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed this past weekend, and although the hotel has been remodeled and is modern with fresh paint. We had a few problems... First, we checked in early on Thursday and went to our room and realized it was a double-double... we had requested a King and immediately went back to the front desk. Clerk was dismissive and since we had booked through Expedia that we were somehow a second-class guest or something. Although our room had been paid for for nearly a month. We were told that there were no King size rooms available and that they would see if something came available later on. Knew that was a load. Basically, the hotel should not utilize the service of accepting reservation from expedia if they are not going to read the request for room-type- and if they plan to treat guest who use it differently. Secondly, make sure that you do not get a room number X01 or X02... as these will be right across from the elevator and maids closets and you might as well sleep in hallway because it is pretty much would sound the same. I understand that when you stay in the French Quarter you can expect there to be some noise, but it was bad. And the worse part was the discussions and bantering of the cleaning staff right out side the door. And you should be prepared to wait about ten minutes for the water to heat to a level where you can shower.. at least that is the situation on the upper floors. We travel quite a bit and have stayed across the spectrum of hotel types and are not typically inclined to complain or go overboard about anything. In fact, this is the first time I have ever posted anything. The bar area and bartender were good. Although this is the Big Easy and we were eating great meals elsewhere---- the offering of continental breakfast was what you would expect as we really didn't count on it for more than some coffee or toast and jam. But this place can do better and it should. This was a birthday trip for my wife without the kids and having twin beds really sucked! Try a little harder next time (or at least fake it a little better and pretend to give a crap)-- if we had stayed in the type of room we wanted and not across from the elevator--we would return here as the location really is good and the rooms are clean and have the basics. Oh yeah-- if you don't like to have your head at a forty-five plus degree angle... you might like to bring your own pillow. As the ones here are fat puffy monsters!

Reviews.Title: “Website was a little Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: monkey380
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and very comfortable. The staff is very friendly. The website (which they have now changed) was a little deceiving. it said "deluxe continental breakfast". There were bagels that you could heat up. Now their website says "coming soon". It says there is an outdoor heated pool. However during our stay, it was not open. Their website also stated "complimentary bathrobes". Our room did not have them. Our room was very hot also. We turned the air down to 64 degrees but still did not cool off. Other than that, everything else was great. The bed was very comfortable! We slept very well. Our room was clean and cozy. I would stay here again, however I saw other hotels around the French Quarter that were a lot nicer for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: springtx249
Reviews.Content: A really nice hotel in an excellent location in the FQ. My only concern is that renovations were still going on. They should be completed w/ the courtyard this week. Rooms are largest furthest away from the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “A calm, cool gem hidden in the heart of the action.”
Reviews.Author: sylver71
Reviews.Content: Hotel Le Marais is a sleek, modern oasis in the center of the Bourbon Street madness. I can't say enough about the value of this hotel. The beds are amazing. I would visit just to sleep in that cloud of a bed again. The large, walk in shower was a delight and the beautifully appointed rooms are a pleasure to come "home" to. Clean, beautiful and relaxing. Le Marais is a delicious, secluded, QUIET hideaway when you've had your day's fill of French Quarter fun.

Reviews.Title: “a good value ... today”
Reviews.Author: travelin f
Reviews.Content: This hotel is newly renovated. It looks great today. They cut corners in renovation, for example, they didn't replace the elevator which is painfully slow. They used cheap doors and you can hear right through them. While waiting for an elevator we could clearly hear a shower in one room and a whoopie session in another. The complimentary breakfast is lame. A few boxes of cereal and bagels laid out in the bar, not a service person to be seen. That said, the bed was great, free wifi is appreciated,location is great and quiet. The rooms are pretty, small but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Shake off some opening jitters and its an A+”
Reviews.Author: FunkDoc35
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel over Christmas with my fiancÃ© and her parents. Overall a pretty great experience and i would stay again. The Hotel is clean, showers are great, TVâ€™s are new, free WIFI is available (which is rare for hotels, but shouldn't be) and the best thing is that it is right off of Bourbon Street, but quiet enough that you can have a great night sleep. My biggest complaint is that if I had not done a lot of research on restaurants and music, i probably would have been stuck on Bourbon Street the entire time without an idea of an outside world. I had asked the concierge about restaurants and i was directed to chains, and when i asked about authentic New Orleans BBQ i was directed to Applebeeâ€™s or his mom's place (are you kidding me). For a boutique hotel, the staff need to be educated on restaurants for all classes of people, especially foodies like myself and inherited family. We want the best NOLA has to offer and the staff were clueless when it came to places like Cochon or August. They still have some finishing touches to put on the hotel, like tables in the bar area, but the bartender's personality (and outsanding mojitos) made up for lack of everything. One last comment which made me disappointed... the manager had boasted on this site before that they have the biggest hot tub in New Orleans, but failed to mention that is isn't open. One of the first posts here was a business man saying how he would have loved to go swimming in the pool that was open, which makes me think it was a fake post by management. This place is great, it doesn't have the charm of some older New Orleans hotels, but that also means it is probably a lot cleaner! Just make sure you do your homework about this great city before coming.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new and Good...but not great...yet”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Christmas week and thought overall it's a really sweet little boutique hotel. This place could be GREAT but I think they still have some stuff to work out. The place is sleek and modern, "mood" lighting in the lobby (Think Virgin America's cabins and you'll get the idea) . Their standard room was larger than most standard rooms in the quarter. Very modern decor and finishes. Actually like a new Marriott or Hyatt. Very comfortable bed, lots of pillows, a nice sitting area by the window, FREE wifi. Bathroom is very modern too. I REALLY like the walk in shower. Very clever touch is the faucet for the shower is at the opposite side of the showerhead, so you don't get splashed with water trying to turn the shower on. Also they have an electronic "Do not disturb" signs which is a great touch. They have a nice bar in the lobby which opens on to the courtyard. When I was there they were still renovating the courtyard and it was way too cold to linger out there anyway. When the weather gets warm, this could be a nice nightspot. They advertise a "state of the art" gym. Um, no. It is no where near a state of the art Gym. It's a small fitness room with a couple of pieces of new equipment. Looks like it was not quite finished when I was there. Flatscreen TV was not working. (Shouldn't the cardio equipment actually face the TV?) Anyhow, for the very few of us that use a gym in New Orleans, you could get a decent workout here. They serve a very nice continental breakfast in a small conference room off the front lobby. Local coffee (Community Coffee) and some great fresh muffins (Still warm!) MUCH better than the usual Costco crap you get at other hotels. Also, no great hoards of starving people fighting for the last crumb of food here. But for the life of me, I can't figure why they dont put this spread out in the nice bar area instead of a cramped little conference room??? My one big issue which with the place is the hot water. I had to run the tap for a good 20 minutes before I had warm water. When I asked about this at the front desk, I was told that when the hotel fills up the pipes get more use so the hot water comes faster. HUH??? a 7 Million dollar renovation and you can't get hot water? Over the next day or so it got worse and finally no water pressure either. I went back down to the front desk and was told I'm the only one complaining. That really broke my heart. I wanted to love this place, but the guy obviously did not want to deal with me. Anyhow I persisted and told him to send someone up to look at my room. They did and the problem was fixed. (Although hot water still took a couple of minutes to come) For those traveling here by car, the hotel does not have a garage but contracts with a local garage that is a little bit away from the hotel, so during peak times, it will be quite a wait for your car. You'll need to call down and schedule it. Same with Valet service. Contracted only during peak times. There is no room service (no restaurant on site) But there are plenty of food options literally with a stone's throw from here. One last point that kept me from really loving the place totally... noise. NOT from Bourbon Street. They insulated the windows really well for that, but you can hear everything in the hallway and vice versa. I was right across from an elevator so I probably had more traffic by my room than most rooms, but it was a nuisance. (Ask for a room away from an elevator). Although I thinik they have done some really terrific work in the renovation, the place looks really sharp, I think they need to work out those plumbing issues soon.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel - nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: angelapoech
Reviews.Content: We were at the the Le Marais during a few day's visit in New Orleans and very much enjoyed the stay. The hotel director was very friendly, charming and caring, with whatever question we had. The Le Marais is a beautiful Boutique Hotel with a nice courtyard and some of the rooms with balconies who overview the courtyard . that means quiet nights with no aircondition but a cool night breese. Welcome drinks and bottled water in the room are included. A perfect hotel for a romantic stay in NO.

Reviews.Title: “Funky boutique hotel, hopefully the pool will open soon”
Reviews.Author: Rebexellent
Reviews.Content: The hotel only re-opened 2 months ago, but this is a great hotel with modern apeal. The showers were really great (good pressure) and the bed was really comfy. The large flat screen tv was icing on the cake. Awesome location - right accross from Bourbon St by the Royal Sonesta hotel (which we also stayed two nights at - Le Marais was a much more personal experience).

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: RonD34515
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are in New Orleans at least twice a year. Many times, we have stayed at the St. Ann Marie Antoinette (former name of the hotel) mainly because of the price. I was completely shocked and delighted by the renovation of the hotel and the quality of the new staff. Everything in the hotel and everyone of the staff far exceeded my expectations. We may never stay at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Chicagobob_9
Reviews.Content: The hotel was under construction. Awakened to loud drilling. Pool area was not available. Hot water was not available on demand. Staff was unattentive at best. Toilet was not clean upon arriving.

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely different...”
Reviews.Author: corvette151
Reviews.Content: First off, my wife and I visit New Orleans 6-8 times a year and this will be the hotel we stay at from now on. This hotel could not have been built in a better location. Seated between Bourbon & Royal, you have the best of both worlds literally steps away. I know being this close to Bourbon Street may send up a red flag to some people, but we found our courtyard balcony room to be very quiet. Unlike other hotels this close to Bourbon, we were able to escape the hustle and bustle of the night life when we were ready. If you are looking for a typical New Orleans style hotel with French Victorian influence, then this isnâ€™t the hotel for you. This hotel has been completely renovated with a boutique/contemporary dÃ©cor. The large screen TV, chair with ottoman, and an unbelievably comfortable bed made it easy to relax. We loved the step in shower, which had more hot water than we could use. The entire staff greeted us warmly each time we entered the hotel, and was more than willing to answer any questions we had. Overall, I think you will be hard pressed to find a better all around hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all of my expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: jnbball
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had never been to New Orleans before. We booked a cruise in March for a December sailing so I had tons of time to research where we wanted to stay. We decided that we would stay close to Bourbon St. as opposed to the cruise terminal as we would have an entire day to see the sights. I read all of the reviews and not many were very good, at the beginning of the year when I started my research. We took a gamble and booked the room based on location alone. Oh my! were we surprised when we went to check in. This hotel is amazing! Not only are you half a block from Bourbon St., but extensive renovations have made this hotel 5 stars in my book. And, even though you are only half a block off Bourbon St., you don't hear any noise when you are in your room. Pierre was an amazing person. He helped point us to all the places to go during the day, and told us the hot spots to hit at night. I have no complaints at all. The room still had the "fresh paint" smell. Not too overwhelming, but I could tell it was recent. I will definitely stay here again if I get to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Elegant, Best Location in Quarter, Excellent Southern Hospitality, and Gay-Friendly”
Reviews.Author: sevillanitacubanita
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New Orleans and I could not have picked a better place to stay. If you want to be in the heart of the French Quarter, in an elegant, comfortable and charming hotel with excellent service and hospitality, go no further. Hotel Le Marais is it. This is a boutique-style, classy hotel that has just undergone a complete renovation, from carpets to bathroom fixtures, to lobby furniture. In fact, when I arrived, they were putting finishing touches here and there. My overall experience here was wonderful. The rooms are very large and confortable and surprisingly quiet even though right in the French Quarter. My very comfy queen-size bed was superior in quality as was the giant new flat screen TV. The towels were plush and oversized, just great. My room was super clean, with that smellof being new. Another great thing about this hotel is its location. It was fantastic to be able to walk to famous Bourbon or Royale just down the street, find plenty of galleries, shops, the Legends of Music Park Cafe, Johnny's Po Boys, walk a bit further to Cafe du Monde and the French Market, and find jazz so close by the hotel. Location is 5 Stars too. The lovely and attentive staff at the front desk and elsewhere that I encountered, were all extremely helpful, very welcoming and accomodating with any and every question or request I had. The hotel Manager, Michael, could not have been more professional, attentive, and delightful to interact with during my stay. He and his staff not only made me feel welcomed in what was a new city for me, but made me feel special because of their real interest in making their guests feel comfortable and happy at the hotel Le Marais, their obvious pride and joy, a jewel of a New Orleans hotel. I highly recommend this hotel if you plan a business or family trip to New Orleans. You can't go wrong with good taste, a classy hotel with a simpÃ¡tico great manager and friendly staff who all k now what they are doing! I would rate Le Marais as high as possible. Go for it and enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Opening Stay”
Reviews.Author: sostan
Reviews.Content: I had a group of 5 that stayed with them on their grand opening night. I was actually their first guest ever. I heard that the hotel was contemporary and I was curious to see how that would fit with the FQ theme. I must say that they did a wonderful job with this property. Everything from the service through the room amenities was top notch. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh, Fun, new Boutique Hotel in French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: michaelterrywatk
Reviews.Content: Had a chance to stay at the brand new Boutique Hotel Le Marais on my last business trip to New Orleans. Fabulous location right behind Jackson Square. Closeby great restaurants on Royal and Conti. The beds were to die for comfortable. Huge flat screen TV and large rooms. Bathrooms are small but the showers are really unique. Forgot my swimsuit but they had the largest hot tub- the size of a small swimming pool with sitting area all the way around. Bar area great for relaxing and doing some business. Recommend it highly. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovation of an old New Orleans landmark”
Reviews.Author: MeetingPlanner70706
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at the newest French Quarter property, Hotel Le Marais. While still undergoing the final touches of a massive renovation, this is a beautiful little gem right off of Bourbon Street. Upon arriving, parking can be a little tricky, as with all of the boutique hotels in the quarter. But valet was great. Lobby was small but very efficient, with the hotel lounge overlooking a stunningly beautiful courtyard, complete with a small pool. The rooms were very nice and stylish,. The beds were incredibly comfortable. LOVED the step in shower. Although no tub, the shower was great! And, even though you are less than a block off of Bourbon street, I couldn't hear any of the noise. This property is a real asset to the French Quarter and I would highly recommend it whether your going to the city for business or pleasure. Can't wait to stay again!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Le Marais
HotelInfo.Address: 717 Conti Street, New Orleans, LA 70130
